story:
We are the 2016 senior class of Drexel University Product Design, and we are a group of forward-thinking design students who want to spark discourse through our work. We have spent the last seven months producing our senior thesis projects, all of which represent the personal philosophies we have each formed throughout our four years of design education. Our projects tackle issues ranging from treating culture shock in international students, to encouraging veteran support systems, to improving prosthetic arms. We want our designs to bring light to issues normally in the dark, and start conversations for positive societal change. 

In classes, we have worked as a group with clients such as SEPTA and K'Nex. Additionally, we have all completed co-ops, some at notable locations such as Michael Graves Architecture and Design, Hasbro, SAP Innovation Center: Potsdam, and Article 22. 

Our program produces not only well-rounded product designers, but also thinker/makers - creative problem solvers who use their skills to make the world a better place. The 2016 senior class is the third graduating class from this young program, and we will be entering the world with a unique perspective that has the potential to change the way we think about design and where it fits in the world.



We are entirely responsible for the funding of our show in addition to the expenses from our personal projects. These costs are too much for us to bear on our own. We want our senior show to be the best that it can be, and we're hoping to experiment with new ways of displaying, organizing and communicating our work. 

Even with a frugal budget and the funds from our highly successful Holiday Ornament Sale in November, we will need to spend $5000 in order to make our show a reality.


With your help, we will be able to afford:

  • Printing Costs
  • Displays
  • Promotional Material
  • Event Catering
  • And more!
If you can't donate your hard-earned $$$ (believe us, we get it) please consider sharing this page with your social network. The more people we can reach with our message, the better. 


The show is May 27th 4:30-7:30 at the Pearlstein Gallery on Drexel's Campus. Let us know you're going on our Facebook event page here! 


We are so proud of our projects, and we can't wait to share them with you. Check out a short summary on each below. 



Chinese Learning Lunchbox is a subscription based system for 9-14 year old American-born Chinese (ABC) children that enables them to experience Chinese culture through food. It educates young ABC children about Chinese culture through crafting, communicating and exploring world history. The Chinese Learning Lunchbox encourages ABC children to understand and appreciate Chinese culture in order to connect with their family heritage.



Tilio is a system of display and organization that encourages self expression for renters. It is difficult for renters to feel a comfortable sense of belonging when they are constantly changing spaces. In response to this problem, Tilio seeks to give these renters an area designated for important yet nonfunctional items, in order to create spaces that best reflect an individual’s interests, aspirations, and inner self.



Tyr 3 is a modular prosthetic that mimics the layers of the human arm to provide superior comfort, utility, and beauty. The arm is a three tiered assembly of synthetic skin, muscle forms, and carbon fiber bones that can easily be customized for men, women, and humanoid robots. Tyr 3 is a dynamic platform that offers flexible solutions for the rapidly developing field of prosthetics.

The Bravo Pack is a campaign that encourages civilians to connect with the veterans in their lives in order to create a more welcoming society for our nation's heros.  Through music and a simple cup of coffee or tea, the pack provides an experience that creates a bond between two previously disconnected people. The Bravo Pack gives civilians a way to thank the veterans in their lives beyond saying “thank you for your service”.  




T1 is a self-driving car designed for 20-35 year old recent college grads and young professional families to enjoy their self-driving car riding experience. In the future, the self-driving car will completely change the current mode of transportation. More than 99% percent of a person's feeling and moods are influenced by the five senses. In this car, all the technologies, functions, and features are designed for satisfying the five senses: sight, hearing, smell, taste, and touch.



Crystal Cubes is a community storytelling system which allows members of communities affected by a tragedy to heal their emotional scars and share their burden.  Its goal is to create a space for discourse, empathy, and healing. By collecting their stories and experiences in a physical and digital format, this system aims to develop a stronger sense of community for users at home and facilitate discourse and awareness amongst the general public.


Journey is a physical/digital journal for students studying abroad that empowers them to take control of their personal narratives so as to overcome the negative effects of culture shock faster. It engages students with life in their new culture by recommending events, venues and friends. It encourages meaningful reflection through the creation of a physical journal using experiences they have recorded digitally. 


---------


Donate please!

Like us on Facebook

Click "going" to our event

Come to the show

& say hi!

---------


Music credit in video: Plushgoolash / Big Gay Water Fight

story:
Gorgon & Athena is a new clothing brand based in Greece.

It all started with our obsession with Greek mythology. Our ancestors attempted to explain the origins of the world and describe the lives and adventures of a wide variety of gods, goddesses, heroes, heroines and mythological creatures. Greek mythology has had an extensive influence on the culture, arts, and literature of Western civilization and remains part of the Western heritage. This is why we wanted to share with you these myths.

How?

By printing unique designs inspired by Greek myths and legends on T-shirts!

Everyone wears a T-shirt, right?  Then, why don' t you wear something stylish with a unique print that captures a history of thousand years? "Gorgon and Athena" unites the past and the present.

 

Aren't you tired of the same standardized T-shirts about Greece?

We are! That's why we wanted to offer you something exclusive and modern; thus, we gathered young talented artists from Greece and made a hub of inspiration and creativity! 

We design our prints under the Greek hot sun, feeling the breeze of the Mediterranean sea and enjoying the beauty of Athens.

Every T-shirt is hand-printed, and that makes it unique!

 

We have inspiration, creativity, and know-how. What we do not have is enough capital. 

Why do we need capital? 

Let us explain to you how the economies of scale work. If we design and print only one T-shirt, it will be costly and unaffordable for everyone. This happens as the fixed costs will be included in the price of just one T-shirt.

But what if we could print dozens of T-shirts? 

The increased total output would result in reduced costs per T-shirt and thus, at an affordable price. This is the reason that we have to print at once as many as possible T-shirts for each graphic design.

Here is where you come in. We need your help to raise the required capital to print our T-shirts. We have already printed one of our designs, but we need more money to print the rest of them.

What you have to do is pre-order your favourite designs, and then we will print all the T-shirts and deliver it to you by the end of May.

 

Except for the fact that you are gonna be the first to get the "Gorgon & Athena" T-shirts, you will have an up to 30% discount off the retail price.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

*Disclaimer - All pictures shown are for illustration purpose only. Actual product may vary.

 

We work with Meraki (μεράκι) and Filotimo (φιλότιμο).

These are two Greek words that are hard to translate.

  • Meraki means that we do everything with soul and love and we put “something of ourselves” into our prints.
  • Filotimo means “love of honour”, and we do this by respecting our customers and giving priority to business ethics.

In "Gorgon and Athena" we keep the social and environmental standards as high as possible by assessing our suppliers and partners frequently for their processes and materials. Moreover, our T-shirts are hand-printed using water-based inks.

We want to build a network with customers based on trust and loyalty!

 

 

If we reach our funding goal, we will start creating new graphic designs!

Here are our stretch goals:

  • If we manage to raise $5,500, we will unlock the full collection of Artemis!
  • If we manage to raise $7,000, we will unlock one new graphic design!
  • If we manage to raise $8,500, we will unlock two new graphic designs!
  • If we manage to raise $10,000, we will unlock two new graphic designs!


Goddess Athena used to wear a Gorgon head on her shield.

In ancient Greece, the Gorgon head was a symbol of protection against evil. Thus the Greeks used to wear it as a protective pendant on their clothes and shields. It was also popular as a royal symbol.

In Greek mythology, Gorgons were female creatures who are consistently pictured as monsters of hideous aspect. They had hair made of living snakes and fearsome teeth. The mere sight of Gorgons was sufficient to turn the beholder to stone.

 

Our designing & production team' s goal is to guarantee the highest quality and to minimize all the possible risks. We have created our prototype, and we are waiting to start the printing process.

Of course, there are challenges when running a company. We'll need to pay our suppliers, make arrangements for shipping and handling, and make sure that all orders are going to be fulfilled. We are working hard to make sure that all happens smoothly and we are confident that we will be able to deliver our products before the end of May.

 

Silk-screen printing is a printing technique whereby a mesh is used to transfer ink onto a substrate, except in areas made impermeable to the ink by a blocking stencil. A squeegee is moved across the screen to fill the open mesh apertures with ink, and a reverse stroke then causes the screen to touch the substrate momentarily along a line of contact. 

Why do we use this method?

  • Soft-feel on the hand
  • Durable prints

If you cannot contribute to our project, it doesn't mean that you can't help.

Share our project with your friends on social media and make some noise about our campaign!

   Instagram: gorgonathena

Facebook: @gorgonathena

 

Chrysostomos Barmpas, Charis Georgopoulos, Antonis Daktilidis  (AENTEP & PIY seminars), Anna Tzanaki, Alkis Kammenos, Danae Giatraki, Stasini Fili, John Chrousos, Georgia Gkolfi, Elena Demesticha, Marcy Benaki, Andreas, Evangelos & Alexandros Deirmentzoglou.

From Greece with Love!

story:
Founded in 2012 by best friends Josh Johnson and Jim Leatherman, who after years of sourcing and designing for other companies saw first hand the importance of domestic manufacturing and decided to do something about it.  BROKEN HOMME is a 100% American Made boot collection. The collection partners a contemporary and working class aesthetic to a range of classic silhouettes. By embracing life’s consequences, we proudly stand in our own foot print. Manufactured in Los Angeles, California, we only release products that represent the true character of our identity. We want you to expect nothing but the highest quality product in terms of fit and design.

After an initial phase of developing, and manufacturing the our collection in a couple large scale operations throughout the US we happened upon a boutique factory located in Los Angeles are who had been producing safety boots for the Union Longshoreman in the Port of Los Angles. We immediately saw potential in this operation as they had been producing top quality footwear since the early 1970’s. We then decided to move our operation to the local factory soon after seeing the superior quality of the boots we were producing here. Two and and a half years later we found ourself in the unique position to acquire this amazing facility and take control of our own operation from the ground up. In order to fulfill this factory element the factory itself needs to be restored to its original glory to in order to maximize its potential as a manufacturer and also pave the way for a next generation of makers. Simply put, we need to put the factory back to work in order to achieve these goals.

To launch our Kickstarter project we have developed an exclusive boot collection that both highlights and represents the nature of the manufacturing and community that surrounds it. We have developed a unique combination of leathers and American Made components solely for this project. We are offering this collection far below retail cost in the hopes to gain long time customers who appreciate the quality and dynamics of our products and appreciate what we are setting out to build as a brand. 

We started this collection by working with our best tanneries from around the United States and our local finishing house here in Los Angeles to use the finest leather assortment available. We then merchandised this unique collection with 2 of our best styles, our factories staple longshoreman boot, and then developed the harness boot and chelsea boot to be both released for the first time to you.

To ensure they are as strong as stylish, each boot is built using goodyear welt construction, metal shanks, and cork filled midsoles. Our boots are comfy out of the box, but will always get better with age.

BROKEN HOMME boots are all built using only the most quality leathers from multiple U.S. tanneries as well as a finishing house located here in Los Angeles. Every leather in this collection is between 4-5.5oz in thickness to ensure durability and to maintain the shape of the boot for years to come.

The steel shank is a piece of steel that is about 1” wide and about 4” long that is placed in the boot during the bottoming process in manufacturing. Boots with steel shanks are more rugged and durable than boots with fiberglass or plastic shanks. The shankpiece reinforces the waist of the shoe and prevents it from collapsing or distorting in wear. The contour of the shank is determined by heel height. Shoes with low heels or wedged soles do not require a shank because the torque between the rear and forefoot does not distort the shoe. 

All quality boots are built around a carefully crafted foot shaped model - known as a “last”. It is the last which gives a boot its fit characteristics. We spent years perfecting our fits, and are sure you will love the fit as well. The quality of the lasting, and the time that each upper spends on the last, is crucial in giving all BROKEN HOMME boots their unique shape and fit.

The Goodyear Welt is traditionally used because it allows for comfort, durability, and the ability to be resoled. The upper part of the shoe is first formed over the last with a midsole of leather enclosing the bottom. A strip of leather know as the welt is sewn to edge of the upper and midsole. Before sewing the final outsole to complete the shoe, the cavity between the outsole and midsole is filled with cork. This cork layer serves as a cushion and a way for the shoe to “breathe”. Because the midsole is made of leather and filled with cork, the foot bed retains the shape of the wearer’s foot, improving fit and comfort. When the sole is eventually worn out, the welt is undone and the new sole is attached back to the welt without disturbing the imprinted leather and cork midsole.

 

Every one of our boots is finished with some style of Vibram outsole. Vibram is the world leader in high performance rubber soles, targeted to the outdoor, work, recreation, fashion, repair and military markets. For more than 70 years, the famous yellow octagon that identifies their brand has been synonymous with quality, performance, safety, innovation and design. We use all Vibram outsoles manufactured in the United States from their factory in Brookfield, Massachusetts.

Our factory is ready to roll now, we are scheduled to start our production run to begin on January 30th, and we aim to start shipping boots to our supporters in April of 2017.

After choosing your reward, we will message you directly on Kickstarter within 24 hours of the campaign closing(January 24th) to get your style/color/size selections. Because we are using a lean production process and manufacturing shoes as they are being ordered, it is important to fill out the selection survey as quickly as possible.

Five years into this, we have received a decent amount of press, but one really meant a lot to us, in 2015 we were featured in a article by the Wall Street Journal as one of the top five "Cobblers to Watch Out For". This was even before we were running our own factory, so we can't wait to see what the future has in store for us from here on out.

We use all Vibram outsoles manufactured in the United States from their factory in Brookfield, Massachusetts.Our factory is ready to roll now, we are scheduled to start our production run to begin on January 30th, and we aim to start shipping boots to our supporters in April of 2017.After choosing your reward, we will message you directly on Kickstarter within 24 hours of the campaign closing(January 24th) to get your style/color/size selections. Because we are using a lean production process and manufacturing shoes as they are being ordered, it is important to fill out the selection survey as quickly as possible.Five years into this, we have received a decent amount of press, but one really meant a lot to us, in 2015 we were featured in a article by the Wall Street Journal as one of the top five "Cobblers to Watch Out For". This was even before we were running our own factory, so we can't wait to see what the future has in store for us from here on out.

story:
Short, But Not So Short, Depending On How Much You Like To Read, Summary

We are two guys who spoke a tremendous amount of game during our time together on board USS George H.W. Bush. We spoke of big dreams and plans to settle down in Florida operating our own business together. We've picked up some good habits, attitudes, and ethics from our naval service, and we couldn't be more thankful for that opportunity. Now we are eager to bring our plans to reality with the help of those who will also benefit from our services.

This campaign is to get us the initial equipment needed to get started. The different services we provide depend on how well this campaign goes, but nothing will stop us from growing and offering new services! To explain what equipment we need, let us first tell you what services we want to provide.

Originally, we wanted our own clothing line. But it was going to take big bucks to completely brand our clothing, because who wants a shirt going to their customers with the "Gildan" tag still on it, right? Not a professional clothing brand in our eyes, and we don't have big bucks on Navy salary. So we put that behind us and instead focused on making it easier for us and others who feel the same way! And yes, there are one or two companies out there who offer the services we plan to offer, but when we set up just a t-shirt with them the way we wanted (screen printed, tag removed and replaced with ours, sewn in label on sleeve), the price is nearly $27! So did we want to have a $30 t-shirt + shipping in our clothing line? Not at all. We understand setup costs, but we're aiming for long term relationships that will pay for those costs later on. That's where we want to come in at $15 less! Maybe it's the labor they're afraid of? We're accustomed to working 13 hours a day, 7 days a week for 8 months out of a year (thanks USS GHW Bush). We're not afraid of some hard work. So help us, help you make a completely branded clothing line or product and ship it to customers for you, with:

  • Screen Printing
  • DTG Printing
  • Embroidery
  • Engraving (To laser etch leather belts, buckles and other products)
  • 3D Printing
  • Sublimation
  • Custom Printed Boxes (we wanted this for our brand!)
  • Custom Tags (this is a must, makes your brand look "boss")
  • And More!

And some services that shouldn't cost you, since it doesn't cost us:

  • Tag Removal
  • Photography of Products
  • Mock-ups of Products
  • And so on (These really depend on your creativity, but these are some services we've looked for)

Now a shirt built how we want it for $15 bucks, we can do that. We hope that you can too!

What We Need, Nothing More

We shook some hands and spoke to people who have some deals on equipment waiting for us to make our move. And we've broken it down to three levels we planned this campaign can take us to.

LEVEL ONE

Raising just 30% of our campaign would take us to LEVEL ONE allowing us to get everything we need to offer only Direct-To-Garment printing for those who want to get their brand started. We will still be able to perform the services we don't need equipment for, like tag removal and shipping to your customers for example. From here we would expand after a brief period to offer 8-color screen printing of your garments, posters, or other products until we can move on to larger equipment!
30% of our campaign will get us everything we need for the high quality DTG printing method we're looking for (because we want our prints to look nice!). We're aiming for:

  1. The Brother GT-381 for its 14 in. x 16 in. 1200dpi prints (which will make a portrait print perfect on a garment if you wanted!). This normally has a price tag of $28,000!
  2. The pre-treatment machine needed to pre-coat your garments so the design bonds to the fabric and lasts. This would normally run us $4,999!
  3. The heat press we'll need will cost us $1,200! This is used to heat the pre-treatment onto the garment, and with a different pressure flash dry the design after printing. This fancy dual pressure heat press will do just that for us.
  4. And all the supplies, like pre-treatment and repair tools we'll need to get started!

We already have web knowledge so we save on our "store front". So we'd be able to get started on DTG printing and drop shipping your COMPLETELY unique brand for just $26,000! Our LEVEL ONE.

LEVEL TWO

Reaching 70% of our goal would allow us to offer 12 color screen printing right away along with the DTG printing. This will make it possible for new brand startups to enjoy the quality of a screen printed shirt while not having to pay until they sell it on their website. And at a price we would have agreed to! So, reaching level two in our campaign will get us:

  1. An 8 or 10 station screen printing press that we will use to manually print your garments and products. A quality one of these go from $8,000 to $20,000!
  2. A few flash dryers to cure each color layer of ink as we lay them down. These can be relatively cheap, but a lasting one at the size we need will hurt pockets.
  3. A conveyor dryer for the final curing and drying of your garments for wearing and washing.
  4. A fancy Epson printer for printing designs onto our film for creating the screens. This baby will have a double purpose, since we can also print posters. Depending on how we do, we'll choose between a $1200 or $4000 version.
  5. An exposure unit that will prep the screens for printing the designs. We're opting for a quality vacuum unit for the best screen quality.
  6. The software we want to use will go for $1600 since we're planning on using AccuRip with Adobe Illustrator and Separation Studio for proofs.
  7. And our squeegees and initial paints. We'll probably accrue these over time.

There are more things needed in a shop for screen printing of course, but they're things we can build ourselves since they have nothing to do with the quality of the print. And we'd like to save ourselves as much money to pass those savings on.

LEVEL THREE

Reaching 100% of our campaign goal would bring us to level three! With this level of achievement we can squeeze in embroidery to our list of services. So we can go from just screen printing or sewing things onto garments and hats to embroidering on them! For this we'll just need a few things:

  1. An embroidery machine. Which will be chosen based on how well Jesse managed our piggy bank (just kidding both of us are needed for the secret hand shake part of its access). Our first choice would be the better choice, in our opinion and research, The Tajima TFMX-C1501. Which is way steep and would be purchased later. But if we receive enough feedback from our community of new clothing brand/business owners, we'll opt for the more obtainable Brother P1000e for $11,000 to $15,000. At least we'll be able to bring everyone the option of embroidery sooner, with awesome prices.
  2. And all we really need with this is a mess load of threads and some hoops to hold each type of garment. The little things we can handle!

Now what if we Super Saiyan Level Four it like our pal Goku (we hope you know who that is)? We're keeping realistic, but that's what we'd really like to see! If we see that too many folks want a less expensive route to getting their brand looking boss, making our campaign goal shoot passed 100%, then we'd have to take action.

We'll of course want to show our appreciation by upgrading everyone's perks and sending everyone gift's throughout the year! That means we'll do a little extra to make you happy about your perk.

Please, let's get into what we can give you for your contribution!


What You Get & Then Some

We put together some gifts we hope you'll like in return for your contribution.

We're still allowed 5 more perks to offer, so if you'd like to make one up using our current perks as a basis, we're open to suggestions! And if you'd like something slightly different on a certain perk, we'll gladly do it if it's within our capability. Just let us know!

Before we start, note that every perk comes with:

  1. Your Name listed on our site's "About us" page for life, as a contributor. You may have a link and a message with it as well! (good backlink opportunity for page rank, wink)
  2. Every listed contributor on our site will automatically receive a lifetime 7% discount. Any discount that comes with a perk is extra!
  3. Every Contributor listed will also be placed on a special email list that we'll use to send future gifts when we're well established. We'll never forget who's helping us to get to where we want to be.

So contribute to earn these as well as claiming one of the below:

1. JUST FOR GOOD GESTURE, $1

Everything counts, and with enough of these we can accumulate some back up if things go sour! So with this we're offering just our great appreciation and 15% off your entire first cart full of neat customized things. And that's on top of your lifetime 7% discount! :)

2. A GESTURE DESERVING OF A HUG, $5

Enough of these REALLY gets us some back up cushion, and we'll be indebted to you for sure. Claim this and you'll get 25% off your first cart with your 7% lifetime discount. A whopping 32%!


3. LIFETIME COUPON KEY CHAIN, $10

Claim this perk to boost your lifetime discount by 10 making it 17%! Not only that, you get a sweet Rugged Edge plush key chain the shape of our logo's turtle  (we're sorry for not having a pic yet!). Or choose a name tape key chain with your name or custom message! Our plush key chain is exclusive to this campaign, so this will be the only way to ever claim one of these. Claiming more than one of these allows you to give key chains (with their discounts) to friends but does not allow you to stack discounts. Sorry! Just let us know your choice and details when ordering or email us at projects@ruggedge.com 

4. CUSTOM PRINTED PRODUCT, $25

Claim this to make your lifetime discount 22%! We've selected 8 products for you to choose from, and for us to print on. Choose from: 1) T-shirt 2) Long sleeve t-shirt 3) Tank top 4) Sleeve-less shirt 5) Sweatshirt 6) Youth size shirt 7) Tote A 8) Tote B. Send your design to projects@ruggedge.com . The product will be printed using the DTG capabilities we'll acquire from reaching level one. Then you'll have a feel of the quality the Brother GT-381 can produce! Also, along with this perk and any other beyond this perk, you'll receive a personal thank you letter from us with our signature. Probably typed since we have boot camp hand writing, but we'll see! 



5. HELP OUR TURTLE FRIENDS TEE, $25

Instead of claiming a custom product, sport our exclusive protect the sea turtle shirt and we'll add $5 to our end of campaign donation to the Sea Turtle Conservancy in Florida! Now you're twice as generous and still walk away with a 22% lifetime discount and t-shirt. The shirt will be printed using the DTG method.

We chose the Conservancy because they focus strictly on our mascot's sea turtle friends and operate right in our backyard! They work to prevent everything that threatens sea turtles in hopes to remove them from the endangered species list, and we like that! We'll be able to continue our contribution to them through our printing, with your help. Sea turtles are too cool of a species to let them die out from poachers and pollution! If you're ever in Melbourne, FL. visit the turtles at the Barrier Island Center!


6. THE EVER HELPFUL CONTRIBUTION, $25

We're extremely eager to give back, I think we planned this more than our actual company. We spoke of many neat things we want to do. Claim this perk to send the Wounded Warrior Project or the NMCRS $10 and receive our plush key chain while turning your +15% discount into a lifetime code that forwards 15% of a sale to one of them or to the Sea Turtle Conservancy, anytime you or whomever you give it to uses it! Why not? You'll still have a 7% discount to your name! Our comrades made life pleasant during our time in service, we'd like to return the favor. Let us know which organization you want your code to support when ordering this perk.

7. SWEET VECTOR-PACKED FLASH DRIVE, $35

Ready for our geek side? Organize all of your designs on an 8GB flash drive for use on the go or with us! We're even packing it with thousands of royalty free vector art to get you started on creating your own garment designs! Choose one from the image below or send us a request. The vector files will be various design elements like: clowns, vehicles, wings, flames, sports, mock ups, and more. Use them to get your brand designs started or for your commercial projects!


8. ONE TIME LABOR WAIVER, $50

Have a labor waiver in the back of your pocket to slap us with when putting in an order or project. That means you'll only pay for the materials! Don't worry, we're accustomed to hard work from our time in service. We'll gladly support your future cause by printing your products using the very equipment you contributed toward today! With this waiver, you can potentially get screen printed shirts for your cause as low as $3 each!


9. GET YOUR VERY OWN NAVY-INSPIRED RUGGED EDGE UNIFORM, $85

Claim this perk and you'll be donning our navy-inspired uniform before we get to! We'll be rocking these babies when we're doing our thing in the print shop. Your uniform will come with our company name embroidered above its left chest pocket, and your first or last name above the right chest pocket. This is our "it's okay to get dirty" uniform. You can also ask to have your own company name or text instead, even change text color (silver is default)! You will receive a belt and buckle to go with it! You think your 15% lifetime discount went away? Not at all! Enjoy 22% off for life. Also, anyone who owns a pair lands on our VIP list for access to our future facility twice a year. You'll receive on site training on our equipment and free usage! You can always opt for further discounts instead. See perk for size info.



10. LET US BUILD YOU TWO CUSTOM SCREENS, $100

Claim these and you can screen print your own garments for your friends, work, or group! Then all you'll need are some hinges from the hardware store, a table, and paint! The screens will be high quality aluminum for longevity and to deter warping but if you want wood that's okay, just ask. The screen size will be 20 in. x 24 in. but the max design size we will do is 16 in. x 20 in. for the best possible print (tension is greater around the edges of a screen, so paint registration is less as you get closer to edges!). Choose between 156 or 230 mesh, and send your design to projects@ruggedge.com. (156 mesh is for general purpose screen printing but with a little better detail than 110 mesh. 156 is used for laying down base color or thick layers. 230 mesh is for finer detail, like halftones.

11. GET 20 CUSTOM SHIRTS, $200

Grab 20 friends and send us 20 designs to get some shirts made at $10 each! Same DTG method and options from the other perk! We'll even help out with your designs by sending you a collection of vector files to use. This deal won't come from anywhere else! None of our deals will!

12. HAND MADE REPLICA MK 76 LAMP, $200

Get a taste of our services with a lamp, made custom by us, the Rugged team, using recycled metals. A life size replica of the typical training weapon used by us while serving in the Navy. The actual practice weapon is used to train pilots in the delivery of the live general purpose bomb it’s designed to simulate. Our jobs as Ordnancemen were to assemble and load these puppies onto combat aircraft.

Your lamp will be sculpted and shaped using mostly recycled aluminum cans, sanded and painted, then wired to serve as an accent lamp or conversation piece. By default, we will paint the bomb body to resemble the general purpose MK-80 series it was designed for (as shown in the image). We are leaning toward accepting custom color, base, and shade requests and will contact you for them near the end of our campaign.

We’re making these lamps during this campaign only! Each will be stenciled “Made Specially For (recipient)”. At the conclusion of this campaign these will no longer be available unless someone else decides to reproduce them! -They can also be converted into a vase or other creative ideas upon request.-


13. CUSTOM AUTOMATED WEBSITE, $500

Claim this and we'll set you up with a website using the popular WordPress platform! We'll install your site onto your hosting account (we can recommend a few good ones for you based on your needs). We'll set the site up with your products or some neat mock ups and banners. Set it up to work automatically by notifying us when an order is placed on it, then we can print that order and ship it to your customer. We'll customize the look and your store emails. Add a few features, integrate your social networks, setup your free newsletter, etc. And lastly, walk you through setting up your payment gateways so your customers can pay you! Our goal for our service is to make this possible (opening an online shop for just the cost of hosting). You can easily learn to do this yourself through many forums and Google searches, so you can potentially start your shop for the cost of a $5 hosting plan! If you want to contribute to our cause however, we'll take care of the tedious stuff for you, get this perk!


14. GET 100 CUSTOM SHIRTS, $700

That's right! We'll print 100 shirts for you using the direct-to-garment method from our $25 perk. Except you'll be saving BIG TIME at $7 a shirt! As many different color and size options as you want, print 100 different designs if you'd like! Sell them at your shop, shows or give them away. Send your artwork to projects@ruggedge.com and include shirt colors, sizes and what designs go on which. Shirts will be Gildan brand, and we can remove tags free of charge if you wish!


15. BIG BALLER STATUS PERK, $1,000

We're not able to give you a percentage of sales like we want to :(! But they say we can definitely give you discounts! So for your generous contribution, we'll extend to you a generous coupon for $1,500 off an order with us. It will not be redeemable until 2017 though! You can gift it, split it up, or just make yourself a pile of custom merchandise. Use it over time to send off personalized gifts for holidays and birthdays directly from our shop to them!

You will receive a LIFETIME labor waiver! Your VIP pass to avoiding all extra costs associated with screen printers. 4 times a year, we'll complete your order for just the cost of the materials and you're welcome to send your own materials to save more!

Your advertisement or message will be placed in every one of our packages shipped (to our customers, not our user's customers) for a year. Send us the ad or have us design one for you, free.

You will receive a thank you box of goodies once a year for as long as we're around! You can choose to redirect this gift elsewhere at any time.

And any other ways we can show our thanks to you in the future. Or you can tell us to leave you alone already. :)


The Impact

Your contribution helps launch a company that focuses on launching other companies, imagine the chain of possibilities. Anyone with just a thought of starting a brand or something similar, can do so knowing there's a place to do it all with no money to start. And with the best quality, it'll be the best decision.

We have a long history of craftiness, leadership, and determination to bring the world a new way at time tested services. With our collective experiences in web development & design, graphic design & illustration, apparel alteration & printing, and solid work ethic, we're sure to perform well for everyone.


Risks & Challenges

 In the event we do not even reach level one, we'd use what we do raise to honor all of our perks. We've included our costs for material with the perks so that we can still create and send you your gifts. Any discounts that come with your gifts will still be honored once we do reach level one or above on our own. And you will most definitely be notified when that happens! For website related perks, we can and will still get yours up and running however, we'll have to make it automated using our competitors! Ew. They're still a big help, but plan on paying prices like $15 for a DTG printed shirt with the "Gildan" or other manufacturer tag attached. Only until we're ready for you to switch to our $15 screen printed shirt with your custom tag, hang tag, sew in and custom box!

All shirt order perks will still be printed however, ship dates may be pushed back while we wait for their completion. We'll make sure to keep everyone updated!

We're pretty accustomed to making things happen when chief says he needs something done. So we won't stop here. We'll put forth as much effort as we did for our navy, but now for ourselves. If after our perks are honored and we're even at 15%, that'll be enough for us to start bare!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you can't give cash contribution, but you certainly can contribute by spreading the word and asking others to contribute! Maybe you know a friend who wanted to start a clothing line for their band? Or a cousin who wants to offer engraved wood and acrylic products on their Etsy?

You can easily share our campaign using the Indiegogo share tools, and please do, so you can get credit for sharing. We'll be sending those with contributing friends some neat gifts!

So get friends to contribute, make sure it's tracked, for sweet gifts like:

1. 100 contributors - Ultimate Movie Basket or The Gamer's Kit

2. 250 contributors -  FitBit Watch or Sphero BB-8 App Enabled Droid (or two No. 1 choices)

3. 500 contributors - Amazon Echo or Kindle Voyage

4. 1000 contributors - PlayStation 4 or Xbox One console With Flat Screen TV (or two No. 3 choices)

5. 2500 contributors - DJi Phantom lll Professional Quadcopter 4K Camera Drone or Microsoft Surface Pro 4

6. 5000 contributors - Canon EOS 5D MK lll or Alienware 17.3 in. Gaming Laptop With 5 Game Choices (or two No. 5 Choices)

4. CUSTOM PRINTED PRODUCT, $25
Claim this to make your lifetime discount 22%! We've selected 8 products for you to choose from, and for us to print on. Choose from: 1) T-shirt 2) Long sleeve t-shirt 3) Tank top 4) Sleeve-less shirt 5) Sweatshirt 6) Youth size shirt 7) Tote A 8) Tote B. Send your design to projects@ruggedge.com . The product will be printed using the DTG capabilities we'll acquire from reaching level one. Then you'll have a feel of the quality the Brother GT-381 can produce! Also, along with this perk and any other beyond this perk, you'll receive a personal thank you letter from us with our signature. Probably typed since we have boot camp hand writing, but we'll see! 




5. HELP OUR TURTLE FRIENDS TEE, $25
Instead of claiming a custom product, sport our exclusive protect the sea turtle shirt and we'll add $5 to our end of campaign donation to the Sea Turtle Conservancy in Florida! Now you're twice as generous and still walk away with a 22% lifetime discount and t-shirt. The shirt will be printed using the DTG method.
We chose the Conservancy because they focus strictly on our mascot's sea turtle friends and operate right in our backyard! They work to prevent everything that threatens sea turtles in hopes to remove them from the endangered species list, and we like that! We'll be able to continue our contribution to them through our printing, with your help. Sea turtles are too cool of a species to let them die out from poachers and pollution! If you're ever in Melbourne, FL. visit the turtles at the Barrier Island Center!



6. THE EVER HELPFUL CONTRIBUTION, $25
We're extremely eager to give back, I think we planned this more than our actual company. We spoke of many neat things we want to do. Claim this perk to send the Wounded Warrior Project or the NMCRS $10 and receive our plush key chain while turning your +15% discount into a lifetime code that forwards 15% of a sale to one of them or to the Sea Turtle Conservancy, anytime you or whomever you give it to uses it! Why not? You'll still have a 7% discount to your name! Our comrades made life pleasant during our time in service, we'd like to return the favor. Let us know which organization you want your code to support when ordering this perk.
7. SWEET VECTOR-PACKED FLASH DRIVE, $35
Ready for our geek side? Organize all of your designs on an 8GB flash drive for use on the go or with us! We're even packing it with thousands of royalty free vector art to get you started on creating your own garment designs! Choose one from the image below or send us a request. The vector files will be various design elements like: clowns, vehicles, wings, flames, sports, mock ups, and more. Use them to get your brand designs started or for your commercial projects!



8. ONE TIME LABOR WAIVER, $50
Have a labor waiver in the back of your pocket to slap us with when putting in an order or project. That means you'll only pay for the materials! Don't worry, we're accustomed to hard work from our time in service. We'll gladly support your future cause by printing your products using the very equipment you contributed toward today! With this waiver, you can potentially get screen printed shirts for your cause as low as $3 each!



9. GET YOUR VERY OWN NAVY-INSPIRED RUGGED EDGE UNIFORM, $85
Claim this perk and you'll be donning our navy-inspired uniform before we get to! We'll be rocking these babies when we're doing our thing in the print shop. Your uniform will come with our company name embroidered above its left chest pocket, and your first or last name above the right chest pocket. This is our "it's okay to get dirty" uniform. You can also ask to have your own company name or text instead, even change text color (silver is default)! You will receive a belt and buckle to go with it! You think your 15% lifetime discount went away? Not at all! Enjoy 22% off for life. Also, anyone who owns a pair lands on our VIP list for access to our future facility twice a year. You'll receive on site training on our equipment and free usage! You can always opt for further discounts instead. See perk for size info.






10. LET US BUILD YOU TWO CUSTOM SCREENS, $100
Claim these and you can screen print your own garments for your friends, work, or group! Then all you'll need are some hinges from the hardware store, a table, and paint! The screens will be high quality aluminum for longevity and to deter warping but if you want wood that's okay, just ask. The screen size will be 20 in. x 24 in. but the max design size we will do is 16 in. x 20 in. for the best possible print (tension is greater around the edges of a screen, so paint registration is less as you get closer to edges!). Choose between 156 or 230 mesh, and send your design to projects@ruggedge.com. (156 mesh is for general purpose screen printing but with a little better detail than 110 mesh. 156 is used for laying down base color or thick layers. 230 mesh is for finer detail, like halftones.

11. GET 20 CUSTOM SHIRTS, $200
Grab 20 friends and send us 20 designs to get some shirts made at $10 each! Same DTG method and options from the other perk! We'll even help out with your designs by sending you a collection of vector files to use. This deal won't come from anywhere else! None of our deals will!
12. HAND MADE REPLICA MK 76 LAMP, $200

Get a taste of our services with a lamp, made custom by us, the
Rugged team, using recycled metals. A life size replica of the typical training weapon
used by us while serving in the Navy. The actual practice weapon is used to
train pilots in the delivery of the live general purpose bomb it’s designed to
simulate. Our jobs as Ordnancemen were to assemble and load these puppies onto
combat aircraft.
Your lamp will be sculpted and shaped using mostly recycled
aluminum cans, sanded and painted, then wired to serve as an accent lamp or
conversation piece. By default, we will paint the bomb body to resemble the
general purpose MK-80 series it was designed for (as shown in the
image). We are leaning toward accepting custom color, base, and shade requests
and will contact you for them near the end of our campaign.
We’re making these lamps during this campaign only! Each
will be stenciled “Made Specially For (recipient)”. At the conclusion of this
campaign these will no longer be available unless someone else decides to
reproduce them! -They can also be converted into a vase or other creative ideas upon request.-



13. CUSTOM AUTOMATED WEBSITE, $500
Claim this and we'll set you up with a website using the popular WordPress platform! We'll install your site onto your hosting account (we can recommend a few good ones for you based on your needs). We'll set the site up with your products or some neat mock ups and banners. Set it up to work automatically by notifying us when an order is placed on it, then we can print that order and ship it to your customer. We'll customize the look and your store emails. Add a few features, integrate your social networks, setup your free newsletter, etc. And lastly, walk you through setting up your payment gateways so your customers can pay you! Our goal for our service is to make this possible (opening an online shop for just the cost of hosting). You can easily learn to do this yourself through many forums and Google searches, so you can potentially start your shop for the cost of a $5 hosting plan! If you want to contribute to our cause however, we'll take care of the tedious stuff for you, get this perk!



14. GET 100 CUSTOM SHIRTS, $700
That's right! We'll print 100 shirts for you using the direct-to-garment method from our $25 perk. Except you'll be saving BIG TIME at $7 a shirt! As many different color and size options as you want, print 100 different designs if you'd like! Sell them at your shop, shows or give them away. Send your artwork to projects@ruggedge.com and include shirt colors, sizes and what designs go on which. Shirts will be Gildan brand, and we can remove tags free of charge if you wish!

15. BIG BALLER STATUS PERK, $1,000
We're not able to give you a percentage of sales like we want to :(!  But they say we can definitely give you discounts! So for your generous contribution, we'll extend to you a generous coupon for $1,500 off an order with us. It will not be redeemable until 2017 though! You can gift it, split it up, or just make yourself a pile of custom merchandise. Use it over time to send off personalized gifts for holidays and birthdays directly from our shop to them! 
You will receive a LIFETIME labor waiver! Your VIP pass to avoiding all extra costs associated with screen printers. 4 times a year, we'll complete your order for just the cost of the materials and you're welcome to send your own materials to save more! 
Your advertisement or message will be placed in every one of our packages shipped (to our customers, not our user's customers) for a year. Send us the ad or have us design one for you, free. 
You will receive a thank you box of goodies once a year for as long as we're around! You can choose to redirect this gift elsewhere at any time. 
And any other ways we can show our thanks to you in the future. Or you can tell us to leave you alone already. :)

   
The Impact Your contribution helps launch a company that focuses on launching other companies, imagine the chain of possibilities. Anyone with just a thought of starting a brand or something similar, can do so knowing there's a place to do it all with no money to start. And with the best quality, it'll be the best decision.
We have a long history of craftiness, leadership, and determination to bring the world a new way at time tested services. With our collective experiences in web development & design, graphic design & illustration, apparel alteration & printing, and solid work ethic, we're sure to perform well for everyone.
  
Risks & Challenges
 In the event we do not even reach level one, we'd use what we do raise to honor all of our perks. We've included our costs for material with the perks so that we can still create and send you your gifts. Any discounts that come with your gifts will still be honored once we do reach level one or above on our own. And you will most definitely be notified when that happens! For website related perks, we can and will still get yours up and running however, we'll have to make it automated using our competitors! Ew. They're still a big help, but plan on paying prices like $15 for a DTG printed shirt with the "Gildan" or other manufacturer tag attached. Only until we're ready for you to switch to our $15 screen printed shirt with your custom tag, hang tag, sew in and custom box!
All shirt order perks will still be printed however, ship dates may be pushed back while we wait for their completion. We'll make sure to keep everyone updated!

We're pretty accustomed to making things happen when chief says he needs something done. So we won't stop here. We'll put forth as much effort as we did for our navy, but now for ourselves. If after our perks are honored and we're even at 15%, that'll be enough for us to start bare!   Other Ways You Can Help We understand if you can't give cash contribution, but you certainly can contribute by spreading the word and asking others to contribute! Maybe you know a friend who wanted to start a clothing line for their band? Or a cousin who wants to offer engraved wood and acrylic products on their Etsy?
You can easily share our campaign using the Indiegogo share tools, and please do, so you can get credit for sharing. We'll be sending those with contributing friends some neat gifts!
So get friends to contribute, make sure it's tracked, for sweet gifts like:
1. 100 contributors - Ultimate Movie Basket or The Gamer's Kit
2. 250 contributors -  FitBit Watch or Sphero BB-8 App Enabled Droid (or two No. 1 choices)
3. 500 contributors - Amazon Echo or Kindle Voyage
4. 1000 contributors - PlayStation 4 or Xbox One console With Flat Screen TV (or two No. 3 choices)
5. 2500 contributors - DJi Phantom lll Professional Quadcopter 4K Camera Drone or Microsoft Surface Pro 4
6. 5000 contributors - Canon EOS 5D MK lll or Alienware 17.3 in. Gaming Laptop With 5 Game Choices (or two No. 5 Choices)

story:
Our mission is to bring high quality, hand-woven Guatemalan clothing items to the hands of Americans.  We need your support to build our network among weaving cooperatives so that we can have custom ties, bow ties, and scarves hand-woven. 

After volunteering at weaving cooperatives for the past 2 summers, we realized that the women weavers face a dire situation.  After the Guatemalan civil war between 1960 and 1996 claimed the lives of hundreds of thousands of men, Mayan women had to find a way to support their families.  They turned to the only thing they knew -- weaving.  Extensive weaving knowledge has been passed down through generations of indigenous women. These artisans create some the most beautiful, elaborate, and unique textiles in the world. 

The only problem is that these indigenous women have limited access to the American and European markets.  Many women struggle to sell their beautiful items on the dangerous streets of Guatemala.  

We want to bring the Guatemalan textile market directly to you.  With your help, we can create a marketplace that gives you access to beautiful and unique items while allowing women weavers to achieve fair wages and a better standard of living.  

www.vernclothing.com

Co-Founder Viktor Mak takes a weaving lesson from weaver Oralia Chopen.

Browse perks below. 

Handwoven Ties

This is one of the patterns that our neckties will be in, they will be available in three colors - red, green, and blue.

We are also working on other striped patterns with pastel type colors, but images aren't available yet becuase the textiles are going to take about another week to hand weave.

Here is a prototype of our self tie bowtie.  We will have a solid green, solid blue, and striped pattern tie.

 

Handwoven Scarf

 

Belts From Handwoven Fabrics

With your help, we can make D-ring style belts with these handwoven designs! Will be available in green, red, and blue.

 

About Us

Founded by a couple of college students with a passion for travel, volunteerism, and entrepreneurship, Vern Clothing's mission is to bring exquisite hand-woven and hand stitched clothing to the hands of people who wouldn't otherwise have access to these goods. 

The artisans and weavers that we work with don't have access to markets in Europe and the United States. They are forced to sell their work on the street or markets to the few tourists that wander by. It is our mission to connect these weavers with the world so that they can finally get fair wages and achieve a better standard of living.

story:
The best way to shop for men's clothing, period. 

It may seem shocking that two Chicago women are working hard to take the guesswork out of men’s clothing; but we saw several companies which make shopping personal and convenient for women and did not understand why men were being left out.


Manasole is a personalized shopping experience for men of every style. We offer customized monthly subscriptions and personal style advice. We are dedicated to delivering quality clothing and accessories to men while being courteous to both their time and wallet.  Manasole is for the man who loves to shop, hates to shop, or does not have time to shop.


1. Signing up is easy and seamless. Sign in with facebook or create an account at www.manasole.com (coming soon!)

 

2. Enter your style preference so we can customize your clothing options! We offer sizes small to 3X.


3. Visit your customized Man Cave and start shopping! One-click shop the entire outfit we select for you, sign up to receive select clothing items and accessories monthly or browse the entire season's collection!



At Manasole we are committed to quality. We strive to use premium cotton blends and the best materials for all of our clothing and accessories. We are working with some of the best mills around the world to get the perfect fit and offer extended sizes so we can make your personalized shopping experience a great one! 

The average price for an item at Manasole is $32. That means you can purchase an entire outfit for under $100.




         


         


       


                                                

                              


We have already worked with seasoned Chicago designers to put together a great Spring 2014 collection! We were able to produce samples for our models in order to put together a great photo shoot! Your contributions will help us to meet our first goal of $18,000, which will allow us to go into immediate production with our spring clothing so that we can launch in April of 2014. We like to dream big so we have laid out a few "stretch goals" along the way. 



We want to send you some great Manasole Gear just in time for the holidays as a special thanks for you support. 

               


                       

                

           

                            

          

              

                    

                       



   





  • To offer a personalized shopping experience to the career oriented male.
  • To deliver quality apparel and accessories.
  • To be courteous to both your time and wallet.
  • To give the best customer service on a personal level.

Ashley Nelson and Jacqui Nicholson are old CCC Choir friends.

We started Manasole when we both agreed that men didn’t have many clothing websites that made shopping hassle free. We weren’t going to settle for another site that had men browsing through tons of items spending countless minutes trying to find what they wanted and needed.

Not wasting any time, Jacqui' began researching on what was already out there and she met with Ashley over coffee to explain the concept. Ashley was fully on board, and we both started working with some of the best designers/manufacturers to create a spring line that would be versatile yet exciting.

Some of our manufacturers produce clothing for Brooks Brothers, Pink Dolphin, and even JCPenny. After working hard on the fit and making sure we offered sizes up to a mens 3x, we are now here ready to bring the vision to life!

     


Designers that have helped us along the way: Wendy Callupe, Rachel Bare
Photographer: Marcin Tomasczyk- mardynnphoto.com
Videographer: Matthew Messner- matthewmessner.com
Graphic Designers- Noa Scheininger, Christian Tan
Models- Nathaniel Andrew, Kendahl Ancheta, Rick Sindt, Partrick Viray

Hair/Makeup-Milica Pavlovic, Cristina Gomez


Our team has worked hard to mitigate the risks and challenges of this project. One of our challenges will be to introduce the Manasole brand to our customers. This is why we worked hard in creating a strong name that our customers would be proud to wear.

We’ve gone through an 8-month development process to ensure that we bring the best shopping service to our men. Having tested out the products we are offering, we can guarantee that you will love the clothing just as much as we do.

As there may be delays in the process, we will be sure to communicate effectively to all of our backers so that our reward fulfillment stays right on track. 


Even if you don't have money to to give to our project you can still help us out! Tell all your friends! Share on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and all other forms of social media. Email and share our video or just start using the word Manasole in daily conversations.

If you have any questions or you just want to say hello, be sure to contact us at info@manasole.com


 :-)
