story:
Our Story

Based in Brooklyn, NY, we are a husband and wife team who decided to pursue the American Dream by creating a socially responsible brand that combines our passion for fashion and animal compassion. ZoLa, named after our rescued dogs Zoey and Lani, is a new breed of clothing that fuses American fashion classics with a social mission focused on animal welfare/rescue.

ZoLa celebrates the human-animal bond and through our Be Awear movement, supports critical animal welfare organizations that ensure our animal friends live exceptional and healthy lives. Through our philanthropic mission, ZoLa will give 10% of the price of each product sold to local animal welfare and rescue organizations. Buy ZoLa. Help a dog.

The resilience of rescued animals to live happy and fulfilling lives after overcoming abandonment and struggles inspires us all to live life good and to the fullest. ZoLa specializes in the qualities that define an underdog - strength, resilience, compassion - and crafts products for those who exemplify these values.

Be Awear and Unleash the Good Life!

Our name

ZoLa was named after our two rescued dogs, Zoey and Lani (pictured below). 


Zoey is a brown Miniature Pinscher who we rescued from Animal Welfare League of Arlington. Zoey is the real-life embodiment of Scrappy Doo - her "let me at 'em" approach to life inspired us to launch ZoLa.

Lani is a black Miniature Pinscher mix who we adopted from Lucky Dog Animal Rescue. Lucky Dog rescued Lani from a high kill shelter. Rescuing Lani inspired us to launch ZoLa with a social mission focused on animal welfare/rescue 

Our inaugural product - the Underdog Polo Shirt

ZoLa's inaugural product, the Underdog Polo Shirt, combines meticulous design, craftsmanship and the finest materials with a distinctive logo and story that embodies ZoLa's core values and social mission.

Panache meets purpose with this conscious American fashion classic that is full of character. Our signature men's Underdog Polo shirt is fashioned from the finest Peruvian pima cotton with a comfortable fit and feel.

 
 

The Underdog Polo Shirt is a true "Best of Breed" in style, quality and craftsmanship. The design features:

  • Made from luxurious 100% Peruvian Pima cotton in a custom-engineered high thread count lightweight pique knit with an uber-soft and comfortable feel. The high thread count and feel of the fabric is unlike any other polo shirt on the market!
  • The custom tailored fit is a slim fit that was carefully crafted and designed through extensive research on the most desirable fit characteristics of consumers.
  • The 2-button placket is accentuated with laser-engraved buttons with ZoLa's name.
  • Rib knit collar and cuffs
  • The seams, trim and interior lining are taped and reinforced with twill stripes encompassing ZoLa's signature color - sky and sand.
  • Uneven hem and side gusset that is longer in the back than in the front so the shirt stays tucked in
  • Our signature regal English Bulldog logo embroidered on the chest has a story of its own and is a true conversation piece.

Our inaugural Underdog Polo Shirt collection is for men. A women's collection of Underdog Polo Shirts will be made available soon after launching our men's collection.

Our inaugural logo - the English Bulldog

The English Bulldog personifies the characteristics of an underdog - a kind and equable disposition, resolute and courageous with a pacific and dignified demeanor. The English Bulldog symbolizes the juxtaposition of a scrappy and headstrong appearance with a sense of regalness and humility.

The dogged pursuit of happiness and overcoming obstacles to live a distinguished and righteous life is the ultimate mark of an underdog. The Bulldog was originally bred for bull-baiting in the 1500s and as such had to be courageous and impervious to pain. The evolution of this fine breed to overcome its ferocious origins and early mistreatment to become one of the most gentle and adored breeds inspires us all to approach any challenge with the same tenacity and humility.

Our logo features a stocky English Bulldog with its head held high complemented with ZoLa's signature red neckscarf.

Each season, ZoLa will further honor the human-animal bond by introducing a new limited edition dog breed logo collection with a unique story. 

Our mission - Be Awear

For every product purchased, ZoLa will give 10% of the price to select local animal welfare and rescue organizations. Buy ZoLa. Help a Dog.

We have a lifelong appreciation for pets and being involved in animal welfare causes. Rescuing Lani as a puppy from a kill shelter in South Carolina was one of the most impactful moments that inspired our commitment to animal welfare. When a frail Lani with her fur coat hugging her ribs was handed to me by Lucky Dog Animal Rescue volunteers, she was shaking with fear as she had clearly lived a life of abuse and malnourishment. No animal deserves to be treated in such a way or have their life cut short and we created ZoLa to help provide our animal friends the life they deserve.

Everybody loves an underdog story and is inspired by those who have overcome obstacles to live the good life. ZoLa provides a platform to share these stories and galvanize the global community of animal lovers to help eradicate inhumane animal treatment.

What we wear is a defining part of who we are, what we value and how we express ourselves. Luxury fashion has been traditionally manufactured by name-brand designers who have profited at the expense of animals and poor garment workers worldwide. ZoLa's business model is based on the belief that there is no reason why premium fashion should not have a double bottom line and positive social impact. Simply put, stylish clothing should come in an animal-friendly and socially responsible form.

Our partners

ZoLa is working with a select group of founding partners to pioneer our brand and provide consumers with an understanding of our Be Awear social mission. Through our Be Awear movement, ZoLa will help expand awareness for our partners' and similar animal welfare/rescue organization missions and donate 10% of the net funds raised from this campaign and the price of each product sold to save and support animals rescued by these important organizations. We are proud that our founding partners are animal rescue organizations that we hold close to our hearts:

BARC (Brooklyn Animal Resource Coalition). BARC is a not-for-profit, no-kill animal shelter located in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. BARC's mission is to provide a safe haven for abandoned animals and to find permanent loving homes for them. 

Lucky Dog Animal Rescue. Based in Washington, D.C., Lucky Dog Animal Rescue is an all-volunteer, non-profit animal rescue organization dedicated to saving the lives of homeless animals. Lucky Dog rescues dogs from high-kill shelters and finds them loving forever homes. Lucky Dog holds a special place in our hearts as we rescued Lani from Lucky Dog who saved her from a high-kill shelter in South Carolina.

Where we are now

We have spent the last year building our business plan, perfecting our designs and samples and vetting and arranging our supply chain. We have received considerable feedback from our friends, local community and industry leaders and we thank all those who have contributed their input. We are launching our inaugural men's Underdog Polo Shirt in 3 color combinations:

  • White polo shirt with white english bulldog logo
  • Navy blue polo shirt with gray english bulldog logo
  • Black polo shirt with white english bulldog logo

Sizes offered: S, M, L, XL, XXL

Our prototype samples have been developed and received rave reviews from friends, customers, and fashion designers for their design, craftsmanship and distinctiveness.

All materials have been sourced and their prices have been negotiated with suppliers and manufacturers.

We have partnered with a premier designer and ethical, WRAP-certified manufacturer who produces fabric and apparel for some of the top global fashion brands. Our Underdog Polo Shirts are one step away from production and we need your financial support to launch.

Why we need your support and what you get

We are looking to raise a minimum of $12,000. Your support will help fund our first production run of Underdog Polo Shirts. In addition, 10% of the net funds raised will be donated to our Founding Partners - BARC and Lucky Dog Animal Rescue. Any amount of money would be helpful and what you receive in return for your pledge depends on your level of support. Those participating in the $50+ pledge levels are receiving atleast 1 Underdog Polo Shirt at a substantial discount off the retail price of our polo shirts (retail value of $89) plus FREE SHIPPING in the US due to your support as a founding sponsor.

In addition to your financial support, we also need your help spreading the word about ZoLa. ZoLa is not only a new breed of fashion, it's a movement. We started ZoLa because we believe in the power of the underdog. More importantly, we believe in the power of the underdog to use fashion to create social change.

If you believe in the power of the underdog and like ZoLa and what we are about, please share ZoLa with your family and friends and help enlist others to join the Be Awear movement. As your support through this campaign will help fund our initial production run, that makes you a pioneer. Pioneers set the standard - so join us, wear your support proudly and share our mission with the masses as we emBARK on this most righteous venture.

Be Awear and Unleash the Good Life!

Share/like our Facebook page (wearzola) and follow us on Twitter (@wearzola). Be on the lookout for ZoLa's digital flagship store (coming soon): www.wearzola.com

All rights reserved.

Background on Nick 


Hailing from modest roots in the Northern Virginia suburbs of Washington, D.C., my family (wife Jordan, newborn son Dylan and 2 rescued dogs Zoey and Lani) moved to New York City to pursue the American Dream after completing my MBA at Georgetown University's McDonough School of Business with an emphasis on social entrepreneurship.

As lifelong pet enthusiasts and animal lovers, Jordan and I decided to combine our passion for fashion, animal compassion and socially responsible business to launch a new luxury fashion brand - ZoLa. Our business model is based on the belief that there is no reason why premium fashion should not have a double bottom line and positive social impact.

We started ZoLa because we believe in the power of the underdog. More importantly, we believe in the power of the underdog to use fashion to create social change. ZoLa specializes in the qualities that define an underdog - strength, resilience, compassion - and crafts products for those that exemplify these values. As the first in my family to have attended college, I can relate a great deal to the underdog mindset and struggles that underdogs face in overcoming obstacles.

For us, our Be Awear social mission is a very personal one. We have a lifelong appreciation for pets and being involved in animal welfare causes. Rescuing Lani as a puppy from a kill shelter, we witnessed firsthand the great work that these animal welfare/rescue organizations and their volunteers perform on a daily basis. These organizations give animals hope, love, an escape from euthanasia and mistreatment and find them caring homes. Wanting to help, we created ZoLa's Be Awear social mission to expand awareness for these causes and galvanize the global community of underdogs and animal lovers. With your help, we can all do a little bit more to give our animal friends the life they deserve.

Be Awear and Unleash the Good Life!
story_txt:
Our Story
Based in Brooklyn, NY, we are a husband and wife team who decided to pursue the American Dream by creating a socially responsible brand that combines our passion for fashion and animal compassion. ZoLa, named after our rescued dogs Zoey and Lani, is a new breed of clothing that fuses American fashion classics with a social mission focused on animal welfare/rescue.
ZoLa celebrates the human-animal bond and through our Be Awear movement, supports critical animal welfare organizations that ensure our animal friends live exceptional and healthy lives. Through our philanthropic mission, ZoLa will give 10% of the price of each product sold to local animal welfare and rescue organizations. Buy ZoLa. Help a dog.
The resilience of rescued animals to live happy and fulfilling lives after overcoming abandonment and struggles inspires us all to live life good and to the fullest. ZoLa specializes in the qualities that define an underdog - strength, resilience, compassion - and crafts products for those who exemplify these values.
Be Awear and Unleash the Good Life!
Our name
ZoLa was named after our two rescued dogs, Zoey and Lani (pictured below). 

Zoey is a brown Miniature Pinscher who we rescued from Animal Welfare League of Arlington. Zoey is the real-life embodiment of Scrappy Doo - her "let me at 'em" approach to life inspired us to launch ZoLa.
Lani is a black Miniature Pinscher mix who we adopted from Lucky Dog Animal Rescue. Lucky Dog rescued Lani from a high kill shelter. Rescuing Lani inspired us to launch ZoLa with a social mission focused on animal welfare/rescue 
Our inaugural product - the Underdog Polo Shirt
ZoLa's inaugural product, the Underdog Polo Shirt, combines meticulous design, craftsmanship and the finest materials with a distinctive logo and story that embodies ZoLa's core values and social mission.
Panache meets purpose with this conscious American fashion classic that is full of character. Our signature men's Underdog Polo shirt is fashioned from the finest Peruvian pima cotton with a comfortable fit and feel.










 

 
The Underdog Polo Shirt is a true "Best of Breed" in style, quality and craftsmanship. The design features:

Made from luxurious 100% Peruvian Pima cotton in a custom-engineered high thread count lightweight pique knit with an uber-soft and comfortable feel. The high thread count and feel of the fabric is unlike any other polo shirt on the market!
The custom tailored fit is a slim fit that was carefully crafted and designed through extensive research on the most desirable fit characteristics of consumers.
The 2-button placket is accentuated with laser-engraved buttons with ZoLa's name.
Rib knit collar and cuffs
The seams, trim and interior lining are taped and reinforced with twill stripes encompassing ZoLa's signature color - sky and sand.
Uneven hem and side gusset that is longer in the back than in the front so the shirt stays tucked in
Our signature regal English Bulldog logo embroidered on the chest has a story of its own and is a true conversation piece.










Our inaugural Underdog Polo Shirt collection is for men. A women's collection of Underdog Polo Shirts will be made available soon after launching our men's collection.
Our inaugural logo - the English Bulldog


The English Bulldog personifies the characteristics of an underdog - a kind and equable disposition, resolute and courageous with a pacific and dignified demeanor. The English Bulldog symbolizes the juxtaposition of a scrappy and headstrong appearance with a sense of regalness and humility.
The dogged pursuit of happiness and overcoming obstacles to live a distinguished and righteous life is the ultimate mark of an underdog. The Bulldog was originally bred for bull-baiting in the 1500s and as such had to be courageous and impervious to pain. The evolution of this fine breed to overcome its ferocious origins and early mistreatment to become one of the most gentle and adored breeds inspires us all to approach any challenge with the same tenacity and humility.
Our logo features a stocky English Bulldog with its head held high complemented with ZoLa's signature red neckscarf.
Each season, ZoLa will further honor the human-animal bond by introducing a new limited edition dog breed logo collection with a unique story. 
Our mission - Be Awear

For every product purchased, ZoLa will give 10% of the price to select local animal welfare and rescue organizations. Buy ZoLa. Help a Dog.
We have a lifelong appreciation for pets and being involved in animal welfare causes. Rescuing Lani as a puppy from a kill shelter in South Carolina was one of the most impactful moments that inspired our commitment to animal welfare. When a frail Lani with her fur coat hugging her ribs was handed to me by Lucky Dog Animal Rescue volunteers, she was shaking with fear as she had clearly lived a life of abuse and malnourishment. No animal deserves to be treated in such a way or have their life cut short and we created ZoLa to help provide our animal friends the life they deserve.
Everybody loves an underdog story and is inspired by those who have overcome obstacles to live the good life. ZoLa provides a platform to share these stories and galvanize the global community of animal lovers to help eradicate inhumane animal treatment.
What we wear is a defining part of who we are, what we value and how we express ourselves. Luxury fashion has been traditionally manufactured by name-brand designers who have profited at the expense of animals and poor garment workers worldwide. ZoLa's business model is based on the belief that there is no reason why premium fashion should not have a double bottom line and positive social impact. Simply put, stylish clothing should come in an animal-friendly and socially responsible form.
Our partners
ZoLa is working with a select group of founding partners to pioneer our brand and provide consumers with an understanding of our Be Awear social mission. Through our Be Awear movement, ZoLa will help expand awareness for our partners' and similar animal welfare/rescue organization missions and donate 10% of the net funds raised from this campaign and the price of each product sold to save and support animals rescued by these important organizations. We are proud that our founding partners are animal rescue organizations that we hold close to our hearts:
BARC (Brooklyn Animal Resource Coalition). BARC is a not-for-profit, no-kill animal shelter located in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. BARC's mission is to provide a safe haven for abandoned animals and to find permanent loving homes for them. 

Lucky Dog Animal Rescue. Based in Washington, D.C., Lucky Dog Animal Rescue is an all-volunteer, non-profit animal rescue organization dedicated to saving the lives of homeless animals. Lucky Dog rescues dogs from high-kill shelters and finds them loving forever homes. Lucky Dog holds a special place in our hearts as we rescued Lani from Lucky Dog who saved her from a high-kill shelter in South Carolina.

Where we are now
We have spent the last year building our business plan, perfecting our designs and samples and vetting and arranging our supply chain. We have received considerable feedback from our friends, local community and industry leaders and we thank all those who have contributed their input. We are launching our inaugural men's Underdog Polo Shirt in 3 color combinations:

White polo shirt with white english bulldog logo
Navy blue polo shirt with gray english bulldog logo
Black polo shirt with white english bulldog logo
Sizes offered: S, M, L, XL, XXL
Our prototype samples have been developed and received rave reviews from friends, customers, and fashion designers for their design, craftsmanship and distinctiveness.
All materials have been sourced and their prices have been negotiated with suppliers and manufacturers.
We have partnered with a premier designer and ethical, WRAP-certified manufacturer who produces fabric and apparel for some of the top global fashion brands. Our Underdog Polo Shirts are one step away from production and we need your financial support to launch.
Why we need your support and what you get
We are looking to raise a minimum of $12,000. Your support will help fund our first production run of Underdog Polo Shirts. In addition, 10% of the net funds raised will be donated to our Founding Partners - BARC and Lucky Dog Animal Rescue. Any amount of money would be helpful and what you receive in return for your pledge depends on your level of support. Those participating in the $50+ pledge levels are receiving atleast 1 Underdog Polo Shirt at a substantial discount off the retail price of our polo shirts (retail value of $89) plus FREE SHIPPING in the US due to your support as a founding sponsor.
In addition to your financial support, we also need your help spreading the word about ZoLa. ZoLa is not only a new breed of fashion, it's a movement. We started ZoLa because we believe in the power of the underdog. More importantly, we believe in the power of the underdog to use fashion to create social change.
If you believe in the power of the underdog and like ZoLa and what we are about, please share ZoLa with your family and friends and help enlist others to join the Be Awear movement. As your support through this campaign will help fund our initial production run, that makes you a pioneer. Pioneers set the standard - so join us, wear your support proudly and share our mission with the masses as we emBARK on this most righteous venture.
Be Awear and Unleash the Good Life!
Share/like our Facebook page (wearzola) and follow us on Twitter (@wearzola). Be on the lookout for ZoLa's digital flagship store (coming soon): www.wearzola.com
All rights reserved.

With your help, we can all do a little bit more to give our animal friends the life they deserve.

story:
Waveborn makes sunglasses that combine affordable fashion with a mission to have a major social impact.

Waveborn sunglasses are designed and handcrafted in Italy, and we sell them at a price point well below typical designer brands. For each pair of sunglasses sold, Waveborn helps a person in need in one of two ways: a) we provide a new pair of prescription eyeglasses through our nonprofit partner Unite for Sight, or b) we fund a portion of a vision-restoring cataract surgery for a person in need though our new nonprofit partner Surgical Eye Expeditions (SEE) International.

 

NEW Stetch Goal: $25,000

With less than 48 hours to go, we've decided to raise the bar and set the new stretch goal of $25,000: 250% of our original plan. With these funds we’ll be able to expand the Waveborn line and help an additional 100+ people in need of vision care.
 
We've also added a $30 perk- do more good while protecting your eyes.

Be the change you wish to see in this world!

 

Announcing our first Stretch Goal: $20,000

After reaching our initial goal of $10,000 we've set a stretch goal of $20,000! 

What will we be able to do if we get to our goal of $20,000? Two key things: First, we will be able to create four new styles/colors of Waveborns as well as some special edition shades in some exciting new colors! Second, if we reach our goal of $20,000 we will fund an additional 20 sight restoring cataract surgeries with SEE International, on top of the surgeries we've already committed to support.

Please help us meet this new goal by spreading the Waveborn word!

 

Waveborn is Officially Endorsed by The Crowdfund Mafia!

"Waveborn shades is stepping up to the plate and giving back big time. Get yourself a pair of cool Waveborn glasses and change someones life forever. A very inspiring campaign on Indiegogo." - The Crowdfund Mafia

 

Waveborn in the Media and Awards

We are incredibly excited about our successful campaign launch! We reached our goal of $10,000 in < 36 hours thanks to all your support and help to spread the word. Here's some of the excellent press and awards that our campaign has received:

 

[Compass Fellows] Waveborn Interview

[Indiegogo] Sight-Giving Sunglasses And Radiation-Blocking Laptop Case

[Indiegogo] Team Indiegogo's Campaign Roundup

[Popcorn and Pandas] Find the Sun Waveborn

[Popcorn and Pandas] Waveborn

[Rebekah Bowen] Catch the Wave and Help Give the Gift of Sight

[Thee A Word] Charitable Giving Never Felt or Looked So Good

[PunchRock] The PunchList - Free Legal Counsel, Member Spotlight, and Events!

[Ask Miss A] Waveborn Crowdfunding Campaign: Purchase Sunglasses, Give the Gift of Eyesight

Keep reading to learn more about our nonprofit partners...

Our Nonprofit Partners

 

Unite For Sight

Unite For Sight supports eye clinics worldwide by investing human and financial resources in their social ventures to eliminate patient barriers to eye care. With their remarkable local partner eye clinics, Unite for Sight has provided eye care to 1,000,000+ patients living in extreme poverty. Unite for Sight is like the Peace Corps for eye clinics. People sign up to go abroad for a year or two to places like Ghana, Honduras, or India.

Unight For Sight typically sets up eye clinics in rural villages for patients who have never had an eye exam before in their life. When a patient comes to the clinic, they are prescribed their first pair of eyeglasses, which are given to the partient for free. Together we'll help keep their shelves stocked every time we sell a pair of Waveborns.

 

 

Surgical Eye Expeditions (SEE) International

As Waveborn continued to grow in a variety of ways in 2013, it made sense to also expand our social good component. Thus we formed a great new partnership with SEE International, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit humanitarian organization that utilizes volunteer ophthalmic surgeons to provide sight-restoring surgery to individuals worldwide.

Based in Santa Barbara, CA SEE International provides the link between hundreds of volunteer eye surgeons and thousands of patients in over 37 countries every year. When you choose to give to SEE International after buying Waveborn shades, we fund a portion of one of their sight-restoring cataract surgeries.

Choose your giving model

We’ve expanded our giving model! Now our customers can choose their impact and decide how they want to give the gift of sight. With each purchase, Waveborn customers will be able to provide a new pair of prescription eyeglasses or fund a portion of a vision-restoring cataract surgery for a person in need through our nonprofit partners! We will send out a survey to campaign backers in a few weeks to allow them to select which organization they want to donate to.

 

Why we need your support 

We started Waveborn not knowing exactly what kind of response we’d get. Would people like our shades? Would they care about our mission to help people around the world who lack the resources to treat their vision problems? As we found out, the answer to both questions was a resounding “Yes!” And now we’re ready to take that momentum and turn it into real growth.

And that's where you come in...

Designing, ordering, manufacturing, and selling sunglasses at a sustainable price takes a significant upfront investment. By backing our campaign, you’ll allow us to order more sunglasses in your favorite styles and to finally add polarized lenses to our most popular models. Specifically if we reach our goal of $10,000 we’ll be able to order two batches of sunglasses in new styles and colors and be able to provide hundreds of people with the gift of sight!

In short, more outreach = more sales = more new sunglasses = more people around the world to whom we can give the gift of sight! The more support we get, the more shades we can sell, and the more people we can help!

We crushed our goal of $10,000 in the first two days, and now we are setting up some stretch goals to achieve over the next week, month, and duration of the campaign. The sky is the limit!

The Waveborn Look

We’ve put a lot of effort into making a pair of shades for every face. Thrillist.com described our unisex flagship model, the Marinas, as “slightly sportier versions of Ray-Ban’s classic Wayfarer design.” 

 

New Styles

This spring we released five new models - some sporty, some more stylish - intentionally building our line to fit faces of all shapes, sizes and styles. Please see the "Gallery" tab above for more images of our styles.

 

 

Long story short, wearing Waveborn shades will make you look good AND feel good.

 

What's Our Story?

So who are we? The core Waveborn team is comprised of one guy named Jonathan and three Mikes (our email messages get super confusing!). In short, we’re four guys who love awesome sunglasses, but don't love spending $200+ per pair. We also love the feeling of building a company that’s having an a true global impact.

Jonathan is a career social entrepreneur who spent a few years working in CA before moving to NYC to work for DoSomething.org, where he served as the Executive Producer for the 2010 Do Something Awards. Jonathan then moved to DC with his beautiful wife, Jenna, where he founded Waveborn while getting his MBA at UMD. Mike Malloy is a pro frisbee player who travels the world selling sunglasses and helping people. Malloy spent four years working for Deloitte Consulting while completing his M.S. in computer science at Georgetown. He graduated in May 2012 and quit in June to move to Dewey Beach, DE for the summer to spend his days selling Waveborn shades, growing the business, and enjoying the Dewey Beach way of life.

Mike Forgit was computer science lab partners with Malloy at BC, and he was hired quickly after Malloy realized he never wanted to write another line of code in his life. Forgit is our stellar tech guru, managing our website, e-commerce platform, and any other tech related projects. Mike F. lives just outside Boston with his wife and adorable daughter. Mike McCormick is a finance/startup dude and Georgetown grad, who now resides in San Francisco. McCormick, who was born with cataracts, is passionate about helping people in poor countries who were born with the same disease, which leads to blindness if untreated. Together we are striving to have a real impact for people around the world struggling with access to vision-care.

Handcrafted in Italy

Made in a small town just north of Milan, Italy, Waveborn sunglasses are manufactured to the highest standards. Using high quality plastics and lenses, we deliver a product that we are proud to attach our names to.

Don’t believe us? Check out this video of Malloy throwing his Waveborns across the room to prove just how durable they are!



NEW Polarized Lenses 

One question we always get is “Do Waveborns have polarized lenses?”

With your support, we can finally say YES to that question! Our partnership with Major League Ultimate (MLU) has allowed us to order our first batch of polarized lenses this spring. With the success of this campaign, polarized Marinas are next, with the rest of the Waveborn line not far behind.

Our polarized Zumas are the official shades of Major League Ultimate.

What exactly does “polarized” mean?

Polarized lenses eliminate reflective glare, enhance contrast between colors, and are ideal for drivers, snowboarders, or anyone who spends time on the water. All of our lenses are great, but the polarized are the cream of the crop. Here is some more info on polarized technology:

How else can you help spread the Waveborn movement?

Share share share! We appreciate your support in all forms - whether it’s backing the campaign financially or just telling your friends about us through Facebook, Twitter, email, Friendster, JDate, or MySpace (right, JT?). Please use the social media buttons at the top of this page to share to your heart’s content! We've even made a google doc with some template messages you can use to spread the word!

We need our Waveborn Brand Ambassadors to continue to create SHAREABLE content every day to support the campaign. Email Zack Metcalf at zgmetcalf@gmail.com if you want to join the campaign staff.

Waveborn Referral Program

We've recieved a TON of great feedback from our backers, and we want to reward our early adopters who have been sharing the campaign. Everyone who backs the campaign is eligible for our referral program - if you get FIVE friends to back the campaign, then you get another FREE pair of Waveborn shades! Click here to learn more about how to share your custom referral link.

We know you'll fall in love with Waveborns!


Finally, we want to say thank you to our friends, family, and everybody else who has helped us thus far. The journey has just begun!

Thank you for riding the wave with us!

 

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: When will I get my sunglasses?

A: Our early bird backers will have the option to select a pair from our remaining spring line and receive them by Memorial Day. We will be using the funds from this campaign to place another bulk order from Italy that will take 10 weeks to fulfill, so we cannot guarantee delivery to any backers before the end of July.

Q: What are the most popular Waveborn styles?

A: Our classic Marina is by far the most popular model that looks great on almost anyone's face. We will be ordering more Bold Black, Dark Tort, Clear Gray, and Pacific Blue, as well as introducing some new limited edition colors. Our second most popular style is the Zuma, the official shades of Major League Ultimate. Tied for third are the Mandalay and Bayside which both have an aviator feel to them.

Q: What style of Waveborns do I get?

A: We plan to have all Waveborn models available to our backers but make no specific guarantee that every style and color combination will be available. Our primary focus is getting more Marinas in all of our colors because they are in the highest demand. We will send periodic surveys to our backers throughout the campaign to inform our purchasing decisions and to do our best to fulfill everybody’s preferences. If there's a specific style you want, let us know in the comments below!

Q: How do I select my style of Waveborns after I back the campaign?

A: We will send out a couple of surveys during the campaign to allow our backers to select which model/color of Waveborns you want. We will also send out a survey to confirm your shipping address.

Q: Does Waveborn ship internationally?

A: Yes of course! We are ecstatic to spread the Waveborn movement worldwide. We are still figuring out logistics for international shipping, and we will let you know the details in a few weeks. A small fee may apply, but we will only charge you what it costs us to ship. For international orders, we will email you more shipping details once we have them.

Q: How can I help?

A: The biggest way that you can help the campaign is by telling your friends and family about the campaign and encouraging them to back us at any level. Everyone who backs the campaign is eligible for our referral program - if you get FIVE friends to back the campaign, then you get another FREE pair of Waveborn shades! Click here to learn more about how to share your custom referral link.

Got another question? Email Malloy at malloy@waveborn.com, and we'll post the answers up here.

Thus we formed a great new partnership with SEE International, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit humanitarian organization that utilizes volunteer ophthalmic surgeons to provide sight-restoring surgery to individuals worldwide. 
Based in Santa Barbara, CA SEE International provides the link between hundreds of volunteer eye surgeons and thousands of patients in over 37 countries every year. When you choose to give to SEE International after buying Waveborn shades, we fund a portion of one of their sight-restoring cataract surgeries.
Choose your giving model
We’ve expanded our giving model! Now our customers can choose their impact and decide how they want to give the gift of sight. With each purchase, Waveborn customers will be able to provide a new pair of prescription eyeglasses or fund a portion of a vision-restoring cataract surgery for a person in need through our nonprofit partners! We will send out a survey to campaign backers in a few weeks to allow them to select which organization they want to donate to.
 
Why we need your support 
We started Waveborn not knowing exactly what kind of response we’d get. Would people like our shades? Would they care about our mission to help people around the world who lack the resources to treat their vision problems? As we found out, the answer to both questions was a resounding “Yes!” And now we’re ready to take that momentum and turn it into real growth.

And that's where you come in...
Designing, ordering, manufacturing, and selling sunglasses at a sustainable price takes a significant upfront investment. By backing our campaign, you’ll allow us to order more sunglasses in your favorite styles and to finally add polarized lenses to our most popular models. Specifically if we reach our goal of $10,000 we’ll be able to order two batches of sunglasses in new styles and colors and be able to provide hundreds of people with the gift of sight!
In short, more outreach = more sales = more new sunglasses = more people around the world to whom we can give the gift of sight! The more support we get, the more shades we can sell, and the more people we can help!
We crushed our goal of $10,000 in the first two days, and now we are setting up some stretch goals to achieve over the next week, month, and duration of the campaign. The sky is the limit! 
The Waveborn Look
We’ve put a lot of effort into making a pair of shades for every face. Thrillist.com described our unisex flagship model, the Marinas, as “slightly sportier versions of Ray-Ban’s classic Wayfarer design.” 
 


New Styles
This spring we released five new models - some sporty, some more stylish - intentionally building our line to fit faces of all shapes, sizes and styles. Please see the "Gallery" tab above for more images of our styles.
 

 
Long story short, wearing Waveborn shades will make you look good AND feel good.
 
What's Our Story?
So who are we? The core Waveborn team is comprised of one guy named Jonathan and three Mikes (our email messages get super confusing!). In short, we’re four guys who love awesome sunglasses, but don't love spending $200+ per pair. We also love the feeling of building a company that’s having an a true global impact.
Jonathan is a career social entrepreneur who spent a few years working in CA before moving to NYC to work for DoSomething.org, where he served as the Executive Producer for the 2010 Do Something Awards. Jonathan then moved to DC with his beautiful wife, Jenna, where he founded Waveborn while getting his MBA at UMD. Mike Malloy is a pro frisbee player who travels the world selling sunglasses and helping people. Malloy spent four years working for Deloitte Consulting while completing his M.S. in computer science at Georgetown. He graduated in May 2012 and quit in June to move to Dewey Beach, DE for the summer to spend his days selling Waveborn shades, growing the business, and enjoying the Dewey Beach way of life.

Mike Forgit was computer science lab partners with Malloy at BC, and he was hired quickly after Malloy realized he never wanted to write another line of code in his life. Forgit is our stellar tech guru, managing our website, e-commerce platform, and any other tech related projects. Mike F. lives just outside Boston with his wife and adorable daughter. Mike McCormick is a finance/startup dude and Georgetown grad, who now resides in San Francisco. McCormick, who was born with cataracts, is passionate about helping people in poor countries who were born with the same disease, which leads to blindness if untreated. Together we are striving to have a real impact for people around the world struggling with access to vision-care.
Handcrafted in Italy
Made in a small town just north of Milan, Italy, Waveborn sunglasses are manufactured to the highest standards. Using high quality plastics and lenses, we deliver a product that we are proud to attach our names to.
Don’t believe us? Check out this video of Malloy throwing his Waveborns across the room to prove just how durable they are!

NEW Polarized Lenses 

One question we always get is “Do Waveborns have polarized lenses?”
With your support, we can finally say YES to that question! Our partnership with Major League Ultimate (MLU) has allowed us to order our first batch of polarized lenses this spring. With the success of this campaign, polarized Marinas are next, with the rest of the Waveborn line not far behind. 

Our polarized Zumas are the official shades of Major League Ultimate.
What exactly does “polarized” mean?
Polarized lenses eliminate reflective glare, enhance contrast between colors, and are ideal for drivers, snowboarders, or anyone who spends time on the water. All of our lenses are great, but the polarized are the cream of the crop. Here is some more info on polarized technology:

How else can you help spread the Waveborn movement?
Share share share! We appreciate your support in all forms - whether it’s backing the campaign financially or just telling your friends about us through Facebook, Twitter, email, Friendster, JDate, or MySpace (right, JT?). Please use the social media buttons at the top of this page to share to your heart’s content! We've even made a google doc with some template messages you can use to spread the word!
We need our Waveborn Brand Ambassadors to continue to create SHAREABLE content every day to support the campaign. Email Zack Metcalf at zgmetcalf@gmail.com if you want to join the campaign staff. 
Waveborn Referral Program
We've recieved a TON of great feedback from our backers, and we want to reward our early adopters who have been sharing the campaign. Everyone who backs the campaign is eligible for our referral program - if you get FIVE friends to back the campaign, then you get another FREE pair of Waveborn shades! Click here to learn more about how to share your custom referral link.
We know you'll fall in love with Waveborns!

 Finally, we want to say thank you to our friends, family, and everybody else who has helped us thus far. The journey has just begun!
Thank you for riding the wave with us!
 
Frequently Asked Questions
Q: When will I get my sunglasses?
A: Our early bird backers will have the option to select a pair from our remaining spring line and receive them by Memorial Day. We will be using the funds from this campaign to place another bulk order from Italy that will take 10 weeks to fulfill, so we cannot guarantee delivery to any backers before the end of July.
Q: What are the most popular Waveborn styles?
A: Our classic Marina is by far the most popular model that looks great on almost anyone's face. We will be ordering more Bold Black, Dark Tort, Clear Gray, and Pacific Blue, as well as introducing some new limited edition colors. Our second most popular style is the Zuma, the official shades of Major League Ultimate. Tied for third are the Mandalay and Bayside which both have an aviator feel to them.
Q: What style of Waveborns do I get?
A: We plan to have all Waveborn models available to our backers but make no specific guarantee that every style and color combination will be available. Our primary focus is getting more Marinas in all of our colors because they are in the highest demand. We will send periodic surveys to our backers throughout the campaign to inform our purchasing decisions and to do our best to fulfill everybody’s preferences. If there's a specific style you want, let us know in the comments below!
Q: How do I select my style of Waveborns after I back the campaign?
A: We will send out a couple of surveys during the campaign to allow our backers to select which model/color of Waveborns you want. We will also send out a survey to confirm your shipping address.
Q: Does Waveborn ship internationally?
A: Yes of course! We are ecstatic to spread the Waveborn movement worldwide. We are still figuring out logistics for international shipping, and we will let you know the details in a few weeks. A small fee may apply, but we will only charge you what it costs us to ship. For international orders, we will email you more shipping details once we have them.
Q: How can I help?
A: The biggest way that you can help the campaign is by telling your friends and family about the campaign and encouraging them to back us at any level. Everyone who backs the campaign is eligible for our referral program - if you get FIVE friends to back the campaign, then you get another FREE pair of Waveborn shades! Click here to learn more about how to share your custom referral link.
Got another question? Email Malloy at malloy@waveborn.com, and we'll post the answers up here.

story:
Through the miracle of the indiegogo crowdfunding platform, The Appledrum Group embarks on a worldwide campaign to advance the work of those dealing with end-of-life care.  The late sculptor, James Farris, brings meaning to his early passing through The Angel Trilogy…brought to life in the form of An Angel Affair…through the transformation of the original bronze sculpture into jewelry.

 

                 


It was 25 years or so ago that my friendship and business relationship began with James Farris.  Son, brother, husband, father, grandfather, sculptor, partner, and friend…these were the attributes that fueled our friendship, and perspectives that brought to life the images that became James’ body of work during his all-too-brief 63 years of influence in our lives.

From the onset of our friendship, we also began the collaboration of a total of 13 sculptures whereby James fulfilled his desire to create in bronze what became a series of trilogies that are today known as The Appledrum Collection. 

The first of the The Appledrum Collection to reach the public is The Angel Trilogy…appropriately known as Guardian I, Guardian II, and Guardian III.  Let me now describe the path leading to your door.

Following the completion of The Angel Trilogy by James…and my part, to see to it that the molds were produced and properly secured…I suggested that perhaps the series would be suited for reproduction in the form of gold jewelry, so as to facilitate the popularity of the sculpture and lend to the success of both over time.  With James’ approval, I enlisted the help of a friend in the jewelry industry familiar with the process, resulting in pendant and earring sets in 14- karat gold.  Upon James’ inspection, as fate would have it, and although the quality of the images was spectacular, it was his desire and decision to be known as the sculptor he had become and not a jewelry designer for which he wasn’t known.  It was a wish that I was happy to honor by not pursuing the production of the series in jewelry at that time.

As we had for virtually all of our 25 years as friends, James and I met every other Sunday for breakfast (along with my Jean-Marie, of whom James was quite fond and she of him), giving way only to the rare conflicting engagement by either of us.  It was in October, 2010, that our happy ritual would come to an end, when James was diagnosed with terminal pancreatic cancer and was to pass away only two months later, on December 17, 2010. 

I was blessed to be with James much of the time of his remaining two months, during which we shared many opportunities for goodbye’s and, of course, the manner in which I would go forward with our collaborations in James’ absence.  Oddly, perhaps, we simply never allowed for the probability that either one of us would not always be around as support for the other.  Nonetheless, that day did arrive and I am given now to pursuing the dissemination of James’ artistic gifts without him…satisfied that it is intended to be this way.  Prior to his passing, James was baptized and received first communion.  His passing was far too early, but certainly according to His plan.

Through one of our daily discussions, James and I arrived at a decision allowing me to proceed with the creation of a jewelry line for his body of work.  To satisfy his deep gratitude for the wonderfully compassionate treatment he received while in hospice care with the Veteran’s Administration in Phoenix, James requested only that any royalty to him, created from the success of sales with The Angel Trilogy jewelry line, be directed to hospice care for others, while considering the needs of veterans as may be feasible.

To that end, I am proud to present The Angel Trilogy…in celebration of James’ extraordinary talent as a sculptor…and the path we traveled together in friendship.


God Bless you James...your friend always.

Charlie

story:
What we are trying to do:

Walk in love. clothing has been in business for five and a half years. We've slowly been building our business and brand to the place it is now.  Our holiday kiosk has been very successful the last three years and we're ready to take it to the next level! We've just been given the opportunity to open a store in the Park City Mall in Lancaster, PA.


What we need:

The store isn't in the best shape.  The last tenants left holes in the walls and ceiling tiles dirty and missing.  The space needs all new flooring and paint. We also need to purchase shelves, fixtures, mannequins and all the technology to run the store.  Basically, the store needs a serious overhaul! Because we are at such a young stage in our business, we need your help!

Why help?

Walk in love. clothing is in business because of the loyal support of our friends, family and fans.  We can't exist without you.  By helping us open a store you are giving us the ability to develop new products, meet more people and widen the impact we have on this world.  Our goal is to remind people of the love of Jesus - and there's no better way to do that than by being where people already are: the mall.

If you give, you get! Be sure to check out the list of perks in the sidebar!


Where will the money go?
We will use every single cent we raise toward fixing, furnishing and stocking the store. 

Other Ways You Can Help

1. Tell your friends you gave to our campaign.  By doing this you will inspire them to do the same!

2. Post this page to your facebook, twitter and blogs.

3. Wear your walk in love. shirts and apparel.

4. Click the feature it button on the bottom right sidebar.


"Be imitators of God, therefore, as dearly loved children and walk in love, just as Christ loved us and gave himself up for us as a fragrant offering and sacrifice to God."-Ephesians 5:1 and 2




Mission Statement:

Walk in love. clothing is simple. We are dedicated to selling well-designed, high quality clothing with a positive and inspiring message. That message is a reminder to imitate God by loving others every chance we get - no strings attached. We believe that Jesus came and showed us how to be that message. We want you to walk in love.

How It Started:

In July 2005, T.J. Mousetis started walk in love. clothing. At that time it was just called walk in love. and it was started with one goal. That goal was to raise money for a mission trip to Russia with T.J.'s dad to set up Christian sports camps. T.J. purchased 100 blue shirts and sold them to friends, family members, his church's youth group and a couple online.

 

In July 2006 T.J. was able to go to Russia and has been back two other times. Above is a photo of T.J. giving his testimony about God's love and faithfulness to campers in Irkutsk, Russia. After returning from Russia T.J. had a passion to sell shirts so he upgraded the quality of shirt and screen printer. He also decided that he wanted some professional photos of the shirts so he asked a starting photographer at his church if she would be willing to do some photos. Her name was Brooke. Two years later they were married. Over the years walk in love. clothing has not changed the way it sees business, it's purpose and it's future. The desire of walk in love has always and will always be to remind people that God loves them and because of that love we can love others.

story:
Kimberly Lewis Home is a Brooklyn based design studio that specializes inplayful patterned home furnishings. Feel free to check out our website with our current products at KimberlyLewisHome.com you can find us onFacebook, Twitter, and Pinterest as well!

I originally launched Kimberly Lewis Home in May of 2011 at The International Contemporary Furniture Fair. I debuted a collection of boutique wallpaper, 4 patterns in 2 colorways each. We have been slowly growing over the last year with new products such as pillows, trays, and notecards. I have been working on our newest collection and I am dying to share it with the world!

Where will the Funds Will Go?

If I reach my goal of $3,000 the money will be used to bring the new collection from my computer screen into actual products! I have 5 new patterns that I will  make into wallpaper. If I exceed my goal I will also be making fabric as well. I will also be printing the patterns from the first collection on a beautiful linen which will be a new addition. I would also like to add to the pillow collection and introduce the new patterns in pillow form as well. 

Since the beginning I have been working with local manufacturers and I plan on continuing that with the second collection. Everything is printed not far from NYC and all of the pillows are sewn right here in the Garment District. Even the pillow fillers are made here in the US. Launching a new collection isn't cheap and this is where you come in!

What do the new patterns look like?

I have 6 new patterns that I can not wait to show you! (I may introduce more if I go over my goal as well) I have taken a lot of inspiration for a handful of patterns from one of my favorite places, the beach!  The patterns have a dash of nautical, a nod to some classic motifs and a whole lot of color and fun! Oh and did I mention Flamingos?! I will be unveiling more patterns as I start to climb to my goal but here is a sneak peak!

Kimberly Lewis Home NEW Pattern

Tell me more! Details Please!

There are a lot of behind the scenes details that go into designing a collection. These include color matching, sampling sewn products, and strike offs. What is a strike off you ask? It is a full-sized cropped section taken from the overall image/artwork. It’s produced on the same material with the same finishing as the final product. It provides you with an exact sample of the final product.

I will also be using the money to help spread the word. Don't forget the marketing materials! I will be developing a look book with photos of the products, a line sheet to distribute online and in person. I will also need to make samples to give to potential clients as well as a sample book to take with me to client meetings and for trade shows. Another big part of the success of the products is getting them into the public eye, It is my goal to exhibit the new collection at a trade show in NYC where I will be able to reach buyers, press, and the media. If I go over my goal all of the money will most likely be used for trade shows since they are pricey to exhibit. 

Any contribution amount will help reach my final goal, please pass on my Kickstarter project information to your family & friends and post it on your Facebook & Twitter accounts. 

If you have any questions please feel free to reach out, I love emails! Leave a comment here or email me at Hello@KimberlyLewisHome.com

Thank you so much for your support!

story:
Who/What is bny'b?

(britta'nyb - the brand)

First of all I'd like to thank you for even taking the time out to browse my campaign.
My name is Brittany, I am the designer of britta'nyb which is the initials for my name. The pronunciation of the brand is [BE-TAH-KNEE_B], my design aesthetic is focused on the quality and time in each garment made. I dream to be a High-end designer with a mix of basic yet high quality commercial styles at both affordable price ranges. Currently I'm a 2nd year college student, with the major study of Fashion Design. I absolutely love retail, and ever since I first started working with people, helping them style themselves, and just having fun with fashion trends (especially there being no limits). I knew this path was for me. I attend Savannah College of Art and Design, and I absolutely love it there. I grew up with a very talented and very ambitious family who always continue to strive for success. One thing people do say about me is that I am a GOAL getter, and I never turn down my dreams, and for this opportunity to create beautiful pieces and show the world has been a blessing that I am very thankful for. 
The money raised will be used for my sewing supplies as well as much needed fabric for my upcoming fashion classes this whole 2014-2015 school year being that I just got into my major anything contributed is a big help. Creating garments is what I adore doing the most, but the cost of fabric to start a collection is always the big hiccup as a student, but it will not stop me from achieving my goal of a successful designer.
After I graduate from SCAD I plan to already have a name established for myself/officially launch my label my senior year in college, move to New York,and intern for a well known designer. With the help of you all I know it would just motivate me more to achieve just that and even more.

What I Need & What You Get

The intended goal for the campaign is $4,000USD

With the very fun and Personalized perks by donating:

EVERYONE receives a very personal Thank you letter.

I love to paint in my spare time, and each piece I make sure to put my personality and passion I have for art. If you love art you'd love this!

For those who donate $40 receive: Thank you, Paint you

*Thank you letter attached

*with a small surprise canvas painting done by me.

Those who donate $50 receive: Totes from BNY'B

Everyday tote use it for EVERYTHING !!!

Limited customized everyday (unisex) Tote by bny'b.

*Thank you letter attached.

* Features a painting/drawing from the artist of garment design on the bag.

If I don't reach my intended goal whatever is donated will still help me pursue my school year in the upcoming Fashion courses I do take.

The Impact

Because this Campaign is only up for 60 days, With your help you'd gift me more motivation than ever to reach for the stars and become what I dreamed to be. I would love for you to follow up with me on my social media sites to check out my progress and actually see why fashion is my passion. I personally invite you to follow my Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter Accounts to see photo's, and hear the great upcoming news from me. 

Twitter: britta_nyb

Instagram: britta_nyb

Facebook: Brittany Bernier


What Inspires me

I love the life I live, and the friends and people I meet. Everything inspires me from the time I wake up in the morning to the time I rest at night. Colors have been my biggest motivation to create beautiful and tasteful pieces, also seeing nature and people express their own sense of style only pushes me to never fear limits in design.

If you'd like to see what Inspires me on a daily basis please visit my Tumblr page

Tumblr: tumblr.com/blog/brittanyib


    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't donate, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

    For those who still want to help me I only ask one thing and one thing of you !

    Spread the word about my campaign, tell everyone you know, your voice is always heard, and very much appreciated by me.

    Thank you ALL SO MUCH ! Britta'nyB
story_txt:
Who/What is bny'b?
(britta'nyb - the brand)
First of all I'd like to thank you for even taking the time out to browse my campaign.

My name is Brittany, I am the designer of britta'nyb which is the initials for my name. The pronunciation of the brand is [BE-TAH-KNEE_B], my design aesthetic is focused on the quality and time in each garment made. I dream to be a High-end designer with a mix of basic yet high quality commercial styles at both affordable price ranges. Currently I'm a 2nd year college student, with the major study of Fashion Design. I absolutely love retail, and ever since I first started working with people, helping them style themselves, and just having fun with fashion trends (especially there being no limits). I knew this path was for me. I attend Savannah College of Art and Design, and I absolutely love it there. I grew up with a very talented and very ambitious family who always continue to strive for success. One thing people do say about me is that I am a GOAL getter, and I never turn down my dreams, and for this opportunity to create beautiful pieces and show the world has been a blessing that I am very thankful for. 

The money raised will be used for my sewing supplies as well as much needed fabric for my upcoming fashion classes this whole 2014-2015 school year being that I just got into my major anything contributed is a big help. Creating garments is what I adore doing the most, but the cost of fabric to start a collection is always the big hiccup as a student, but it will not stop me from achieving my goal of a successful designer.
After I graduate from SCAD I plan to already have a name established for myself/officially launch my label my senior year in college, move to New York,and intern for a well known designer. With the help of you all I know it would just motivate me more to achieve just that and even more.
   What I Need & What You Get The intended goal for the campaign is $4,000USD
With the very fun and Personalized perks by donating:
EVERYONE receives a very personal Thank you letter.

I love to paint in my spare time, and each piece I make sure to put my personality and passion I have for art. If you love art you'd love this!
For those who donate $40 receive: Thank you, Paint you
*Thank you letter attached
*with a small surprise canvas painting done by me.
Those who donate $50 receive: Totes from BNY'B

Everyday tote use it for EVERYTHING !!!
Limited customized everyday (unisex) Tote by bny'b.
*Thank you letter attached.
* Features a painting/drawing from the artist of garment design on the bag.
If I don't reach my intended goal whatever is donated will still help me pursue my school year in the upcoming Fashion courses I do take.
  The Impact Because this Campaign is only up for 60 days, With your help you'd gift me more motivation than ever to reach for the stars and become what I dreamed to be. I would love for you to follow up with me on my social media sites to check out my progress and actually see why fashion is my passion. I personally invite you to follow my Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter Accounts to see photo's, and hear the great upcoming news from me. 
Twitter: britta_nyb
Instagram: britta_nyb
Facebook: Brittany Bernier


What Inspires me

I love the life I live, and the friends and people I meet. Everything inspires me from the time I wake up in the morning to the time I rest at night. Colors have been my biggest motivation to create beautiful and tasteful pieces, also seeing nature and people express their own sense of style only pushes me to never fear limits in design.
If you'd like to see what Inspires me on a daily basis please visit my Tumblr page
Tumblr: tumblr.com/blog/brittanyib

 
  Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't donate, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
For those who still want to help me I only ask one thing and one thing of you !
Spread the word about my campaign, tell everyone you know, your voice is always heard, and very much appreciated by me.
Thank you ALL SO MUCH ! Britta'nyB

story:
About T&K


Founded by Tuck & Kim, more than 20 years of tailor experience. We love minimalism and quality crafted goods. Hefty wallet makes you uncomfortable and so, we crafted this wallet and sleeve for daily convenience.


Benefits

The Wallet holds up to 7-8 (or more) credit cards size and thickness, together with 7-8 business cards yet the wallet is not more than 1.5cm! The Card sleeve thickness is less than 0.8cm with 7-8 cards in it. A good choice to bring along with your daily access cards. Good price, good quality, lightweight & slim, minimal.

We are a small team of three which strive to give you the superlative handcrafted quality goods. If there is unpredictable matter occur we will do our best to sort it out in soonest time possible. We sincerely appreciate your understanding. 



Spec

Wallet size (width x height) : 11 x 8cm
Card Sleeve size (width x height) : 7 x 10cm



Timeline

This is where the thrilling part begins. The production time which incur material ordering and goods handcrafting which need some time as we do precise QC for the final stage. Please refer timeline below for better understanding.


Reaching Out

Words of mouth are gold. Let your friends reach us by sharing our links here. A big shoutout to all of you!
