story:
For more information about our custom color shoes and accessories
please visit marcosichaussures.com

info@marcosichaussures.com

Our mission at Marcosi

Marcosi is specialized in the production of quality custom color shoes. We turn your shoes into a work of art. At Marcosi we know that shoes are a form of personal expression, which allows men to distinguish themselves and assert their personality.

Your imagination is our inspiration

From its workshop in Montreal, Marcosi creates unique and personalized products. We offer a color palette that is limited only by your imagination. We also plan to offer many other services to meet the needs of our customer, including free state-of-the-art foot-scanning diagnosis and modeling, and a web application to customize your shoes.

Your impact

Your contribution will make a difference. At Marcosi, we plan on supplying a high-quality hand-crafted product, but we need your help:

  • Be a part of this unique and exciting fashion venture
  • Enhance your wardrobe and set yourself apart from the crowd
  • Donate $380 to receive your own matching shoes and belt

Other ways you can help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools

Thanks for your help!

Exclusive Indiegogo Shoe/Belt Package

Only on Indiegogo, Marcosi offers custom color shoes and belt complement your Marcosi shoes.

Before we get too far, we would like to thank you and our community of fans for allowing us to do something special in the shoe industry.

Why Crowdfunding?

By bringing this project to IndieGoGo and directly to you, we can cut out distributors and retailers, as well as additional marketing expenses. 

This allows us to deliver our shoes and belt package at less than $400 which is a fraction of their $550 normal retail price, worth far more than you will pledge and that will keep their value over time.

This offer is limited edition and is exclusively on IndieGoGo. Take advantage of the offer while it is here for this short period of time.

Your personality is expressed by your personal style. Make a statement and set yourself apart.

Anatomy of the Marcosi Shoe

Our shoes are designed according to ancestral methods, and are hand sewn with to the "Goodyear" technique. These processes ensure maximum comfort, a longer service life, and higher quality shoes.

Achieving a quality shoe is based primarily on the technical mastery of the men who produce the product and on two other elements: the choice of materials and the construction technique.

Materials

The choice of materials plays an important role in the life and aesthetics of shoes. Leather shoes are carefully selected by the manufacturer and from the largest tanneries in Europe.

For all models, Marcosi uses calf leathers, which are characterized by their suppleness. Box-calf--calf leather tanned with chromium--is preferred for most models. They can be smooth or embossed depending on the formality of the shoe. Most models will be made from smooth black aniline box-calf leather. Suede shoes embody a more relaxed urban feel. This flesh-side calfskin gives a velvety appearance reminiscent of deer skins used in the past.

Each element of the shoe has its proper material. A shoe can be decomposed into two parts:

  1. The upper and the lining
  2. The sole

The upper and the lining

The upper includes all the elements of the top of the shoe. For the upper, the cutter will choose the most beautiful parts of the skin. Cutting the skin from suitable leather, and according to the direction of the grain and stretch, is a true art.

For the lining, Marcosi utilizes very soft leathers to ensure customer comfort.

The sole

The choice of sole will seriously affect the life of the shoe.

When considering soles, we tend to think only of the part in direct contact with the ground. However, the sole comprises at least two components:

  • The outsole is in direct contact with the ground. This is selected from a high resistance of leather. This leather is slow tanned (usually more than 12 months) to offer maximum resistance to abrasion and rot.
  • The insole is the cornerstone of a quality shoe. It is the connection between the upper and the outsole. Therefore, soft leather is chosen for its realization. A lining is added on the rear for comfort as a decorative support for the brand name.

Assembly

Assembly is another important determinant of the quality of a shoe. Although today's machines facilitate much of the work, construction still requires a very large number (about 270) of expert operations by the skilled craftsman.

Marcosi uses the best technology and techniques to offer the highest quality products. The Goodyear mark is a sure guarantee of quality and durability. The manufacturer is a specialist, having many years of experience producing products for Marcosi. All shoes are made with this same technique.

This type of arrangement allows a connection between the upper, the insole and the outsole through the use of fine hidden stitching, known as German welt stitching.

 

The soles

All shoes are assembled using German welt stitching. Unlike the open stitching technique which reveals the seam, this hidden stitching technique does not show the threads which bind the shoe.

The shoes have a raised arch shank and a dynamic double wooden dowel. This technique is not aesthetic, but is designed to give exceptional comfort to arch of your foot.

Final thoughts

The shoe/belt set is an indieGoGo EXCLUSIVE. It comes with a hand-crafted leather belt, which will retail for $125.

*JUST TO NOTE, WE WILL ASK YOUR COLOR PREFERENCE AND THE MODEL OF SHOES AT THE END OF THE CAMPAIGN

100% of the funds will be used for the first round of Marcosi production. After much preparation we are ready to move forward!

All the work is done, we have our prototypes and are ready to produce the shoes! The shoes will be ready to be shipped by May.

At Marcosi the most important aspect to any company is how it takes care of it's customers.

 Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)

 

How do I choose my sizes, colors, and styles?

At the end of the campaign we will send you a link to a page with a form to
fill out where you can chose you sizes, colors, and styles. You can also choose your styles and colors from our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/marcosichaussures

What are you going to do with the money you raise?

Once we reach our goal, we'll make your shoes and ship them to you as quickly
as possible. Any additional funds raised will go towards continued production and
expansion of the current line of products.

When do I get my shoes and other leather products?

Our manufacturing partners are standing by and excited to start producing Marcosi. As soon as our campaign ends, they will get to work.

Allowing for 20 days to receive the funds we raised we can expect to have Marcosi products delivered to you in May. And we will do everything within our control to expedite the process to get them to you as soon as possible.

What sizes do they come in? How do I know my size?

Marcosi are currently offered in standard size ranges based off of standard US
shoe sizing:

What if I don't like them?

Unlikely, but stranger things have happened. That said, we stand by our product
100% so if for any reason you aren't happy with your Marcosi products just reach out to us at info@marcosichaussures.com and we'll arrange for an exchange or full return.

Our mission at Marcosi

story:
Limited editions with a unique story, that don't compromise in quality or comfort.

Our brand was born one year ago as an attempt to help others remember their creativity. We were feeling trapped in our own routines and feared that we were forgetting our former authentic selves. That's why we decided to create unique shoes that would give you back your freedom to be your own self and live your own style. 

Having brought already our first Derby Shoe Collection to our customers around the world, we are ready now to continue creating unique shoe collections. Here in Indiegogo, we are offering our next Chelsea Boot Collection to pre-order. With your support we will go back to the family owned business in Portugal helping us to make this collection a reality.

Versatile

Chelsea Boots are really versatile and can be combined with almost anything in your wardrobe. They will always give a special notch to your outfit. For instance, take a lay back outfit with jeans, and combine it with the Timber Accra model to dress up your look. Or try the opposite and dress down your official office outfit by combining these boots with dress pants.

Unisex

This new Chelsea Boot Collection is unisex and is available in any size ranging from the 36 (US 5) to 45 (US 11.5). The female sizes will use a female width giving a narrower look. See the sizing section below for more information.

Limited Editions

Only small batches of 30 pairs or less are created of each design. This is due to the small amount of textiles that we have personally collected during our trips around the world. Also because we believe in uniqueness instead of mass-produced products. Our limited editions support our vision of creating a world where people feel free to stand out from the crowd.

Textiles

The way we collect textiles is done with love, respect and without haste. Our textiles come from local markets and artisans discovered in our travels around the world. Only small quantities of textiles are collected so that they can fit in our small travel backpacks - enough to make a unique shoe batch of about 30 pairs, sometimes less. Read below to learn more about each of the specific textiles features in our new Chelsea Boot Collection: 

African Wax Print (Ghana): The process to make African Wax prints is inspired by the Indonesian method of dyeing cloth by using wax. Africans use the fabrics as a method of communication, with certain patterns having widely understood meanings. This type of textile is featured in the Sunset Accra and Timber Accra boots. 

Hand Woven Indigo (Thailand): This hand woven cotton is dyed with plant-based indigo, which creates a deep and rich blue. The waste water from the dying process is biodegradable. In addition to using natural dyes, the Thai weavers utilize locally picked cotton, which is less refined (not bleached) than mass-produced cotton. This type of textile is featured in the Mangkhud Bangkok boot.

Batik Print (Indonesia):  Batik is the traditional textile of Indonesia and it was designated by the UNESCO as Masterpiece of Oral and Intangible Heritage of Humanity. Locally produced batik prints are commonly used in normal life and help improve the local economy. This type of textile is featured in the  Javakafe Jakarta boot.

Silk Brocade (Shanghai): Interestingly, silk was first discovered in China, where it was kept in secret for centuries, and today it is China who still holds the repute of producing one of the world’s finest quality silk fabrics. This soft white satin in a silk brocade is featured in the Midnight Shanghai design. 

Khokhloma Print (Russia): The Forest Moscow  boot features a cotton print decorated in the well-known khokhloma style, a Russian folk art first used in the 17th century to decorate tableware. The style includes a rich floral motif where the golden or yellow flowers symbolize a happy life and are believed to bring light and wealth.

Leather

Our boot collection is made of high-quality and durable leathers from tanneries in Italy or Portugal. In this collection you can chose between a soft suede (see Forest Moscow, Sunset Accra, Timber Accra, Midnight Shanghai or Mangkhud Bangkok) or a vegetable-tanned leather (see Javakafe Jakarta). All boots have a cow-leather lining.

Crafting

All Liebre Style shoes are handcrafted in Portugal by a small team of experienced artisans. It is not easy to find the right artisans that will agree to focus on quality and uniqueness, rather than quantities. Luckily for us, our artisans in Portugal believe in our vision to make the world more diverse. Our prototypes have been finished and successfully tested. Thanks to your help we can now go back to the family businesses in Portugal helping us with this collection so that they can start handcrafting our boots and belts.

Belts

In the social media feedback it was important for you to have matching belts and for this new collection we will be designing them. We have found a small family-owned atelier in Portugal specialized in handcrafting leather belts. Each of our boots will have a matching belt featuring the same leather color and type of the boot design. At the moment, we are in the prototyping phase and we will be sharing detailed pictures with you very soon. 

Add a Boot/Belt

If you have already ordered your favorite shoe design, you may want to add a second shoe pair or a matching belt to your order. We will send you a survey after your pledge to get your requested boot design and size, and/or your requested belt design.

Who We Are

 

Sizing

All boots are available in sizes ranging from the US 5 (EU 36) to the US 12 (EU 46). Orders for sizes outside of this range are unfortunately not available due to the unavailability of cutting knives. We will send you a survey after your pledge to get your requested size. If you are not sure about your shoe size, you can find some help in this link.

Questions

You may find extra useful information about our shipping and returns policy in the links provided. If you further questions, please send us an email to info@liebrestyle.com and we will get back to you a speedy as possible! You may also contact us by private message in our Facebook Page or Instagram account (you'll find us under Liebre Style). 

 

THANK YOU!

Who We Are

THANK YOU!

story:
About the Brand:

The Hometeam brand fosters tangible civic pride and engagement. Our apparel and accessory products mimic sports uniforms to cultivate a team feel around a city, while benefitting organizations driving local economic development. 

What we Need/What you Get:

Hometeam has a fundraising goal of $5,000 to pilot the brand in Providence. In order to do this successfully, and fulfill orders made through this campaign, we'll need to finalize prototypes and test products through e-commerce and in retail.

In exchange, you'll receive the first Hometeam products, help tee us up to scale to new markets, and support Social Enterprise Greenhouse entrepreneurs!

Prototyping:

The Hometeam products are still a work in progress, and exact materials and manufacturing methods that will be used are to be determined. However, the first generation of products will look very similar to those depicted throughout the campaign page.

story:
Nixon

I was born 8 months ago. Mother bore me naturally, although they say that French bulldogs are mostly born via c-section. That told me I was special right away. I saw the world in 10 days, walked in 22 days and started exploring the room we were living in. Mom, Aunt, the 4 of us. There was a guy called Milos who took care of all of us. Mom and Auntie were going out and came back from time to time. We, little kids, were eating, drinking, biting all we could find, peeing, pooping, sleeping, and round and round. One day, brothers started leaving the room, not coming back. I started suspecting that this was going to happen to me to. I was worried, because I haven’t had a clue what was out there and whether I would like it. I was cozy here, feeling just fine. As it happened it turned out I was right.

 

Nancy

6 months ago Nancy saw my photos online and called Milos. She was interested in me. I didn’t know who Nancy was nor what it meant to be interested in someone. He kept taking photos of me and sending to her every day, and she answered in some heart signs. Later on, when I grew up a bit, I realized that all women were sending hearts when they saw little adorable babies. And I was that adorable one. Taking photos, corresponding, texting hearts and next thing I knew, I was on my way to Belgrade. That day was my first car ride, my first going out of the room and the town I had been born in, and the first time I saw Nancy. She bought me a bed, toys, food, little dining dishes and a blanket. It was so obvious that I was here to stay. I liked Nancy and I liked her apartment. And to be honest, after only an hour spent with her, it was so clear that I would be a royal here. I told Milos: “Its ok. You can go. I’ll stay here definitely.”

 

Help Us Make Our Plans a Reality

Nancy and I, we have plans working together. We are planning to set up a local business for all the Nixons in the world. Nancy loves dogs a lot and thinks that all dogs should have their own personalized collars, hand made just for them. I agree. Nancy will make unique, custom designed collars so that we, dogs, can go out with style. I will give her support. And we all know that support is crucial.  

 

What Can You Expect of Us

All dog collars and bracelets will be made of Paracord 550 type III, super strong and durable, with adjusted measures, ranging in colors, waves, buckles, accessories, that you can choose, so that you can definitely personalize the look of your dog’s collar.

Paracord is of high quality and very strong and can hold a lot of weight/pressure (550lb/250kg), water resistant, comfortable, smooth and durable material. All the collars will have stainless steel D-rings. You can check the designing options in the List of choices.

 

Nixon, Nancy, Friends and Family

That’s me, Nixon, and I’m wearing Paracord dog collar in the basic Cobra weave.

 

This is my best friend Atila, wearing Paracord dog collar in the Trilobite weave.

 

This is my brother Max, he is wearing Paracord dog collar in the double wide Soloman weave.

 

This is Mina, wearing Paracord dog collar in the Fishtail weave. I think she is my girlfriend, but she’s playing hard to get!

 

This is Nancy, taking self-portrait, wearing Mad Max Style survival bracelet. This is not just any bracelet, this is the cobra weave no-buckle paracord bracelet similar to the one Tom Hardy was wearing in “Mad Max Fury Road”.

List of Choices

 

Supporting is Caring

The funding raised on Indiegogo will be used for: original US made nylon cord, accessories, working tools, VAT and custom fees for materials and tools, production, building a web site & shop. Not only that your support will make production possible but will also provide the community in Serbia with handmade and personalized dog collars. Also, you will be supporting revitalization and development of domestic handicraft in Serbia.

 

…and Caring is the Future

If our campaign is successfully funded and everything goes according to plan, there is no reason not to meet the promised deadline. Once the Indiegogo campaign is done we’ll be ready to start the production. The estimated beginning of production is August 2018 and products shipment November 2018.

Nixon & Nancy’s future plans: more Paracord waves in the List of choices, Paracord leashes and cotton/leather dog collars, and to build together a unique and loving community for all dog lovers.

As a two member team your support means a lot to us.

Best,

Nixon, the French Bulldog and Nancy

 

Like us on Facebook

Follow us on Instagram

What Can You Expect of Us
All dog collars and bracelets will be made of Paracord 550 type III, super strong and durable, with adjusted measures, ranging in colors, waves, buckles, accessories, that you can choose, so that you can definitely personalize the look of your dog’s collar.

Paracord is of high quality and very strong and can hold a lot of weight/pressure (550lb/250kg), water resistant, comfortable, smooth and durable material. All the collars will have stainless steel D-rings. You can check the designing options in the List of choices.
 
Nixon, Nancy, Friends and Family

That’s me, Nixon, and I’m wearing Paracord dog collar in the basic Cobra weave.
 

This is my best friend Atila, wearing Paracord dog collar in the Trilobite weave.
 

This is my brother Max, he is wearing Paracord dog collar in the double wide Soloman weave.
 

This is Mina, wearing Paracord dog collar in the Fishtail weave. I think she is my girlfriend, but she’s playing hard to get!
 

This is Nancy, taking self-portrait, wearing Mad Max Style survival bracelet. This is not just any bracelet, this is the cobra weave no-buckle paracord bracelet similar to the one Tom Hardy was wearing in “Mad Max Fury Road”.

List of Choices

 
Supporting is Caring
The funding raised on Indiegogo will be used for: original US made nylon cord, accessories, working tools, VAT and custom fees for materials and tools, production, building a web site & shop. Not only that your support will make production possible but will also provide the community in Serbia with handmade and personalized dog collars. Also, you will be supporting revitalization and development of domestic handicraft in Serbia.
 
…and Caring is the Future
If our campaign is successfully funded and everything goes according to plan, there is no reason not to meet the promised deadline. Once the Indiegogo campaign is done we’ll be ready to start the production. The estimated beginning of production is August 2018 and products shipment November 2018.
Nixon & Nancy’s future plans: more Paracord waves in the List of choices, Paracord leashes and cotton/leather dog collars, and to build together a unique and loving community for all dog lovers.
As a two member team your support means a lot to us.
Best,
Nixon, the French Bulldog and Nancy
 
Like us on Facebook
Follow us on Instagram

story:
We are already funded on Kickstarter and production is to begin shortly, so you know when you pledge that the watches are going to be produced.

Up front, we believe the most important thing to convey is that while Pramzius may be a new brand, we are by no means a new company or new to the watch business. During the past two decades, our company has imported watches into North America as the exclusive distributors of brands like Vostok-Europe, Aviator and Sturmanskie (the first watch in space on the wrist of Yuri Gagarin).

Our main focus has been watches from Eastern Europe and Russia, thus the choice of our name and area of focus for inspirations. We have thousands of satisfied customers around the globe and we have many resellers of our watches in the US, Canada and the Caribbean. You can check us out on Facebook not only for Pramzius but Russia2all is one of our other pages where we have nearly 50k followers.

Throughout our years in business, we have been involved in ALL aspects of the watch business, including design, development, distribution, servicing, marketing, you name it. While this is our first brand we have launched by ourselves, you can pledge with confidence knowing a company with a solid history is behind your Pramzius watch.

You can also find out more at Pramzius.com

You spoke and we listened! The single most common piece of feedback was that the hands on the watch are too small. We went back to the drawing board and have designed new hands. For the black and blue models they will be both thicker and longer (so more lume!). For the white, with the way they are designed, our only option was to go longer, so we did.

Our company is based in Connecticut, USA.

The massive locomotive barrels through the Siberian night while the conductor braces against the frigid air as he moves between cars. He tugs at the chain hanging from his tattered pocket and pulls out his trusty railroad watch to check the time of the coming next stop. He doesn't realize he is holding a piece of history. The Tran-Siberian railroad pocket watch; now more than a decade out of production. 

In the spirit of these famed timepieces and the trans Siberian railroad, Pramzius -- our new brand based in the USA -- is bringing back the Trans-Siberian railroad watch, but this time for the wrist. Pramzius, named for the mythological Baltic Ruler of Time, seeks inspirations from Eastern Europe and the Baltic region to reignite a world of often forgotten horology and great historic timepieces with new looks and top-flight engines.

By backing our project, not only will you get an amazingly cool timepiece (depending on your level of support) but you will be helping a small, family-run company to realize our dreams of owning our own watch brand. We promise we won't let you down with this or any of the future models we are already developing. Our goal is to make every Pramzius watch an event and something unique on the wrist.

Pramzius pulls together the two decades worth of experience from our Connecticut based team that has been importing and engaged in design of watches from this part of the world, including Vostok-Europe, Sturmanskie and Tsikolia. All our Pramzius watches will use inspirations from one of the eight countries that border the Baltic Sea.

We chose this name to be true to our roots, while providing us with a wider geography from which to draw our inspirations.

We designed the Trans-Siberian collection as a wrist watch tied to the world of the pocket watch that marries antiquity and modernity like nothing else you have ever put on your wrist.

Our first edition is inspired by a Trans-Siberian Russian railroad pocket watch popular in decades past built by a company that sadly ceased operation in 2007. 

The original watch maintained popularity throughout its run, because, well, it was just plain cool. The simple dial and that amazing relief image of the train on the back made the watch a must have for collectors of Russian timepieces as well as devotees to pocket watches.

We sold this watch in North America for many years before the company folded, and it was a personal favorite of Co-Founder Craig Hester (he has several in his private collection). We have always wanted to bring this watch back to life ever since the last one left the assembly floor.

Even with our love of the original, we made sure the Trans-Siberian incorporates critical updates from the inspiration that today's watch consumer demands. The case, crystal and crown, among other things, are all significantly improved. The original was plated brass, and the Pramzius is all surgical-grade stainless steel. 

The acrylic crystal on the inspiration is upgraded to a K1 mineral (or optional sapphire). And, of course, the inspiration wasn't designed for the wrist and didn't have an optional desk stand.

We like to say the Trans-Siberian "is unapologetically big" at 48 mm. We just had to have it sized similarly to the inspiration and we wanted it to be usable alternatively as a clock on the cherry wood veneer stand that comes with Tier 3. A local artisan friend of ours produces these right here in Connecticut.

Instead of a pocket watch movement with a sub-dial second hand, we chose the NH38 open-heart movement built by SII of Japan, with the open heart displayed where the sub seconds would normally appear. This gives your watch a visually engaging look while maintaining a pocket watch feel and holding true to the inspiration's legacy.

This is a 24-jewel movement of the highest caliber of construction. We have years of experience with Seiko movements and know they are among the best-made in the world. This caliber winds automatically with the movement of your wrist, so it never needs a battery and if worn daily, you won't need to wind it. The movement can be manually wound and it "hacks", which means the second hand will stop when the crown is pulled out.

For us, the case back was the most critical feature to be lifted directly from the inspiration. It's what made the original such a stand-out timepiece. So our case back features the large, 3D relief of the original train that appeared on the inspiration watch down to even the smallest detail. All three models are numbered, limited editions of no more than 999 pieces per dial. We like rarity.

Even though this is not a dive watch, we also insisted on 10 ATM water resistance. We simply aren't satisfied with 3 or 5 ATM. What does this mean? We won't go into all the aspects of water resistance in watches here. But 10 ATM can handle most any water situation short of serious diving. It is a sign that we are committed to top-quality construction not usually found in non-dive watches.

This is a watch for those who love bright, highly visible lume. And that includes us. We are lume nuts and won't wear watches ourselves that don't have excellent lume. The luminous material on the Trans-Siberian lights up the night and splits the dark. The full-lume dial on the white model is, of course, a stand out. However the lume on the blue and black is excellent (with 15 to 20 layers), with the black sporting the coveted blue color lume.

The original pocket watch didn't have any luminous material at all. That is really not all that uncommon for vintage pocket watches. So, this was one area we had to depart from the inspiration for sure. We have to have great lume on our watches. We are building what we like to wear and hope you will too.

We kept it simple and decided to produce three color executions to choose from -- Antique White, Sun-ray Blue and Black. The black is Sun-ray as well, but it is very subtle.  

The watch will come on a bund, or sometimes called a lagarto, that goes fully underneath the watch. There are two other options, with all three available depending on which tier you choose. The other two are more traditional leather but also with the screw system for security and/or a nylon strap done in the Zulu style. 

So, you may be asking, what's with the two crystal options? Isn't a crystal just a crystal? The short answer is, no. The long answer is a bit more complicated. There are actually several types of watch crystals that provide different kinds of protection for your watch 

For the purposes of the Trans-Siberian, we are only concerned with the K1 mineral crystal and the sapphire. So, what is the difference and why does one cost more? The easiest way to describe the difference is using the Mohs hardness scale. A regular mineral crystal is a 5 on the scale. The K1 is a 7 and sapphire is a 9.

The K1 is a special manufacturing process that gives the crystal more scratch resistance than regular mineral and more shatter resistance than sapphire. They are excellent crystals for sport watches, which the Trans-Siberian really isn't, even though it is 10 ATM water resistant. But we wanted the base model to be under $300 and the only way to do that was with a K1.

Why does sapphire cost more? The main reason is it is the hardest crystal material you can get and therefore the most scratch resistant. It's nearly impossible to scratch a sapphire crystal. It is also about the way they are produced versus mineral, but we won't get into that much technical detail here. Bottom line: The K1 will serve you just fine on the Trans-Siberian but if you want the ultimate protection from scratches, the sapphire is worth the upgrade.

You may also be wondering: This watch is 48 mm and it has the extended lugs and crown of a pocket watch configuration, is it actually comfortable on the wrist? 

First we would refer you back to the testimonial video up top where Marton Radkai, the editor of Wristwatch Annual, test drove the watch for a day and said it was not only comfortable on the wrist, but VERY comfortable on the wrist.

Second we share that is why we made three strap options. We are confident one or more will work for you. But there is no question this is a big watch that can't be missed on the wrist. This watch isn't for those who prefer subtlety in their timekeeping. Diminutive is not in the vocabulary of the Tran-Siberian watch.

We ensured that every aspect of the Pramzius Trans-Siberian watch is thoroughly thought through. The smallest touches are of the highest quality.

story:
Short Summary

Hello and thank you for taking the time to read over and ponder our request for your help in this campaign. My name is Jeff Burkholder and I am a current Active Duty Military Chief Warrant Officer 2. I’ve been in the Armed Services for over 11 years now with time served in the Marines, Army National Guard and now the Active Duty Army.

This campaign to me is not just very important but very personal in nature. I was almost hit and could have been very possibly killed a short while ago. No, not while in the sands of Iraq or Afghanistan, but here in our great nation while trying to do the very basic of things, help others cross the street.

This campaign is important to us because not only it will allow us the opportunity to produce more jobs for hard working AMERICANS and fellow Veterans, but because it encompasses the chance to help save someone’s life and possibly even your very own or someone you love or know one day when you or they least expected it.

Have you ever found yourself driving down the road just bebopping along then all of a sudden out of the blue you come across someone you didn’t see in, out or alongside of the road? Then you find yourself looking in the review mirror scared to death wondering where in the world did that person just come from?

I have, all too often I have found myself in that situation, where someone is running, walking or biking in, out and along the roadway with dark clothing on. They may or may not have been wearing a piece of reflective clothing but they were not visible until my headlights illuminated them or I was passing them and it was in my opinion to close for comfort should they have fallen or decide to dart in the other direction at the last minute.

So I embarked upon a journey to try and locate a safety vest that would do just what I had envisioned. But too much of my disappointment, I was not able to discover ANY safety vest that could do what it said neither in any environment nor to the distance that would be noticeable to drivers allowing us the reaction time we needed to avoid the person or hazard.

I set out to invent an LED Safety Vest that would change the standards for not just safety vests in general but LED safety vests forever. I wanted a vest that would do as it was intended for-SAVEING LIVES and not just be another thing that we are told to wear or that we purchase in the hope that it might work as designed or advertised one day.

High visibility non-reflective clothing (bright color’s) offer limited safety to the person wearing them, and offers a way to be seen while working, walking, running, or riding bikes in and along the roadways during the day time. This type of personal protection equipment can be seen from a short distance but it’s limited to just that, a short distance and the attention of drivers.

Bright high visibility reflective clothing is also only as good as the weather and light surrounding it, thus paving the way for the need for more and more reflective types of clothing i.e. reflective safety vests, straps & bands that offer the chance to be seen at a greater distance.

To be seen or not to be seen: almost all safety vests and reflective attire require some sort of headlight or lighted source to be illuminated upon them in order to be seen or function as they are intended even during the daytime.

There is a very high need for a safety vest that can give drivers an added ambient light or better said; “Visual Cue” farther in advance and still is able to perform in all types of day, night and inclement weather conditions. How many of us like to see there is going to be a traffic signal ahead before we get there?

That is why I have designed a vest that will do the very thing that it is designed for- SAVE LIFES and Alert Drivers. This isn’t just another Safety Vest; it is setting a NEW STANDARD for the Safety Community. This vest is versatile and meant to be used by EVERYONE. Road workers, bikers, walkers, runners, joggers, Police Officers, Firefighters, EMS workers, tow truck driver etc. etc.

By supporting this campaign you will help us to get this product out to the mainstream market not for making of a quick buck, but for offering a product that REALLY WORKS and you can depend on.

What We Are Asking You’re Help For

We are asking for your help to raise $250,000 for the purchase of all the materials we will need to get this Patent Pending LED Safety Vest to the mass market. It will pay for all the cost for initial production equipment, supplies and materials, hiring of AMERICAN and Veteran workers, store placement, shipping & packaging equipment and so forth.

The Impact

You are helping another AMERICAN and or VETERAN out there with getting that job they may have really needed.

You will have contributed to the production of a QUALITY AMERICAN MADE Product and not another garbage foreign made product that have flooded our stores.

You can stand reassured that you are supporting the values of Honor and Integrity with the production of this Safety Vest and that it actually does what it was designed to do, Alert Drivers and SAVE-LIVES.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you just can’t contribute, and we totally understand that but could you help us get the word out?

If you can help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign we would be forever in your debt. If we could reach 250,000 people whom all could give just $1 we would make our goal.

Thank you for taking the time to read over our request for your support. May you be blessed in all you do ~ Thank you again for your time…

story:
Designer Original | Limited Edition

“Having someone help you doesn't mean that you failed, it means you're not in it alone.”

I've always been reluctant to ask for help, but on this occasion I knew it was a challenge I couldn't face alone. Thank you all for being there for me, your support is truly a humbling. You’ve created a supportive community for me and my work, showing me that I am not in it alone.

Although together we have reached the goal, I’d like to extend a promotion for the duration of the campaign as a thank you for everyone’s support. I will offer the chance for you to purchase the featured one-of-a-kind designer accessory at a lower rate. Just donate the amount of the item you’d like to receive.


  • customized linen keychain tag = $10

  • customized silk chiffon headband or linen suit handkerchief = $15

  • customized linen tie or cotton knit scarf = $25


Reagan Rockers | The Finishing Line

  • University of Minnesota, Twin Cities

  • Major: Apparel Design

  • Minor: Retail Merchandising

  • Future Plans: MA in Textile Design in London starting F’14


Align Fashion Show | Feb 15, 2014 | Rapson Hall | University of Minnesota | Minneapolis | Showtimes 5:30pm and 8:00pm

Crunch time

The end is in sight. Four years working towards one short walk down a runway. It doesn’t sound like much but it’s the single most important moment of my career to date and one that will hugely influence the rest of my working life. On February 15, 2014 my senior line will feature in the University of Minnesota, Apparel Design Fashion Show; four looks meticulously created to form the main body of my undergraduate work. Planning and funding of the show will be coordinated by myself and fellow students and all materials are at our own expense. This page has been launched to humbly ask for support in achieving a hard fought ambition.

Fashion can be a superficial world and after a number of unpaid internships doing various menial tasks for little appreciation I have questioned more than a few times whether it is a world I really want to be a part of. But it’s not the glitz and ostentation that interests me, it’s what happens behind the scenes to inspire complex designs, source unusual fabrics, and create something that is ultimately a work of art. To achieve this is anything but superficial but requires a great deal of determination, self-belief and a total sacrifice of any social life.

In my work I often play with the idea of hard and soft. I am exploring the concept of confinement; garments that constrict natural movement and tread a fine line between wearability and art form. My designs are avant garde yet retain a beautiful simplicity. They are not eccentric for the sake of provocation. For my senior line I have painstakingly created my own digital designs which will be printed using state of the art fabric plotting technology. Combining strong structural forms with organic prints I have intentionally held back from designing an overly conceptual composition in order to balance the attention of both the silhouette and the prints.

Although I’m still an undergraduate I have strived to get exposure in a number of fashion design businesses. It has given me an insight into the real fashion world and has also given me an appreciation of professionalism. It is my goal to create credible and high-end pieces that not only stand out in a degree show but can ultimately stand up against runway pieces by the world’s top designers. Your contribution will truly help me reach the level I’m aiming for.


Where will your contribution go?

There are so many elements involved in creating each piece, from multiple test garments to styling the final look. The bulk of the funding will go towards designing my own fabric. Digital fabric printing is cutting edge technology and is still relatively expensive to access. Although it is costly to use I’m fortunate that the University of Minnesota has a fabric plotter available so I can control the process from start to finish. This large printer will allow me to create the pattern in the desired yardage amount.

My sponsorship goal is $800 with the breakdown of costs:

  • Digitally printing my designs onto fabric: $350

  • Interior structure (interfacing, horsehair canvas, lining etc): $250

  • Styling (accessories, shoes, etc): $125

  • Notions and sewing supplies (thread, zippers, etc): $75


Donation perks

Your contribution means so much. I am constantly amazed and humbled by my supportive community.I wish I were able to repay everyone’s generosity for what it is truly worth, and I hope that with your contribution I will be set on the right path to one day be able to repay you all fully. In the meantime I have created a few unique, limited edition accessories as gestures of my gratitude. There are 5 levels of donation perks in which you will receive a “piece” of my work, as all the accessories will be made from the same prints used throughout my line!


  • Level 1 $10: handwritten thank you card with original print design*

Handwritten thank you card in purple and black



  • Level 2 $25: linen tag for keychain and a handwritten thank you card*

Linen tag for keychain in orange egg shell



  • Level 3 $50: headband or suit handkerchief and a handwritten thank you card*

 

Silk Chiffon headband in tortoise shell      Linen suit handkerchief in poppy



  • Level 4 $100: linen tie or cotton knit scarf and a handwritten thank you card*

  

Linen tie in tortoise shell                  Cotton knit scarf in poppy


  • Level 5 $150: linen tag for keychain, you choice of perk from level 3 and level 4, and a handwritten thank you card*


*As the perks will be made out of the same prints used in my senior line, your accessory will be customized in the print of your choice to cater to your taste:

Orange egg shell        Black and purple          Poppy                        Tortoise shell
story_txt:
Designer Original | Limited Edition
“Having someone help you doesn't mean that you failed, it means you're not in it alone.”
I've always been reluctant to ask for help, but on this occasion I knew it was a challenge I couldn't face alone. Thank you all for being there for me, your support is truly a humbling. You’ve created a supportive community for me and my work, showing me that I am not in it alone.
Although together we have reached the goal, I’d like to extend a promotion for the duration of the campaign as a thank you for everyone’s support. I will offer the chance for you to purchase the featured one-of-a-kind designer accessory at a lower rate. Just donate the amount of the item you’d like to receive.

customized linen keychain tag = $10
customized silk chiffon headband or linen suit handkerchief = $15
customized linen tie or cotton knit scarf = $25
Reagan Rockers | The Finishing Line
University of Minnesota, Twin Cities

story:
Six Shooter Shot Glass


What We Need:

We need $8,000 to make the first production run of the Six Shooter Shot Glass (patent pending). By helping us you will get exclusive access to our products just in time for the holidays!

By contributing to our project you get personalized shot glasses and an authentic .50 Caliber Bottle Opener.  

Your contributions will go towards funding the costs of tooling, machining, and anodizing the initial inventory of shot glasses.  

The shot glasses are machined out of aluminum and are a replica of the cylinder from a Colt Revolver. They are anodized in black and silver and come as a pair of Six Shooter Shot Glasses.  

What You Get:

 (S/H Included)

1. Social Supporter

 Contribute $1 and we will give you a thank you on Twitter!

2. Sober Supporter

 Contribute $5 and we will send you a Bullets2Bandages sticker.

3.  Casual Drinker

Contribute $20 and get a pair of Six Shooter Shot Glasses.

4. Social Drinker

 Contribute $30 and get a pair of custom engraved Six Shooter Shot Glasses.

5. Drinker's Delight

Contribute $50 and get a pair of custom engraved Six Shooter Shot Glasses and a custom engraved .50 Caliber Bottle Opener.  

6. Bartender Pack

Contribute $90 and get one dozen custom engraved Six Shooter Shot Glasses--six black and six silver.

7. Pub Pack

Contribute $180 and get one dozen custom engraved Six Shooter Shot Glasses--six black and six silver--and one dozen custom engraved .50 Caliber Bottle Openers.  

What Are The Specs:

 Certified safe for drinking by F.D.A. standards (kind of important)

Complies with U.S. 21 CFR F.D.A. Reg Part 175.300 clause C1/C2/C3/C4.

Light as a feather, but tough as nails

Machined from Aircraft Grade Aluminum.

Engraved with a laser

Yes, we own a laser.

Who We Are:

Bullets2Bandages LLC is a veteran-owned small business in San Diego, CA. In addition to making interesting products, we spend time helping raise money for veteran charities.

Don't Forget To Share With Your Friends

story:
Who Are We?

Welcome to Simply Inspired Accessories! Or better known as Sia. We are a group of high school students who are interested in the US free enterprise system. As a part of the Junior Achievement Program, we are organizing and creating our very own business! Sounds exciting right?! 

 SIA

As you may know, we are in the technology age. So most of us have a smartphone and a pair of earphones. (Or perhaps you have multiple) Simply Inspired Accessories will bring to you two products: iPhone cases and earphone holders.

Our first product will be inspirational and humorous iPhone cases. Everyone has their down days, so what's better than having inspirational quotes or humorous jokes on your iPhone case to cheer you up!  Also,  they are the perfect accessory to glam up your iPhone. Not to mention, they will protect your precious iPhone from scratches. 

Our second product will be earphone holders. Don't you hate it when your earphones get tangled whenever you pull them out of your bags? This product will hold your earphones together nicely so you'll never have to worry about tangled earphones!

How will the iPhone cases look?

We will have 9 different iPhone case designs. We will have four inspirational quotes and five code jokes on hard plastic iPhone cases. Below are some designs: 


  


How will the earphone holder look?

We will have 8 different colors. The eight colors are magenta, red, blue, black, neon green, white, and purple. 


Why do we need you?

Our goal is to raise $500 to move our designs into production. What will the money go towards?
  • Purchasing customized iPhone cases
  • Purchasing earphone holder
  • Purchasing packaging 
  • Printing hazard warning signs
  • SUPPORTING YOUNG ENTREPRENEURS!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Share the link with your friends and families! 
    For more designs, please check out our Facebook page!

    Thank you for reading and supporting young entrepreneurs!

story:
Update:

In response to some feedback, if we dont meet our goal we will absolutely honor all perks. Our craftsman can do 1 or 1000 and Flexible Funding means we will receive whatever funds we receive - Thanks, James

_______________________________________________________________________

Have you ever wanted a small, thin, premium wallet that looks good, functions well and stops credit and identity theft?

                             BANTAM WALLET

The thinnest premium leather customizable RFID blocking wallet.

                              Stop skimmers, scammers and scumbags!




Hi my name is James and I want to show you a wallet I’ve been playing with for a while now. I’ve been using this design for over 11 years and every time someone buys me a wallet, or I think another one looks good, I’ve always come back to this design. It just works!

I love leather. Its natural and sustainable, and I love that leather smell and so decided to finally make a real nice one to share with you guys. Its taken about 2 years to source the right high quality leather and craftsmanship and about 8 months to refine and create the samples. It’s handmade from super tough kangaroo leather which is thinner than cow leather and far stronger than any other leather in the world.

Kangaroo Leather? Kangaroo leather is the toughest leather. Its very thin, durable and light and yet has a higher tensile strength than any other leather. Even when its cut thinner it still keeps most of its strength. This is because the hide contains virtually no fat due to the Australian environment which can cause holes and weakness when tanning.



I really hate those massive wallets that can hurt your back or bulge out from your pants that many people endure with. The Bantam Wallet is not like those small plastic and metal RFID wallets that severely limit what you can put in them and a lot tougher than the wallets that are just 2 pieces of material with an expensive rubber band around it. Most importantly, you won't be embarrassed carrying the Bantam Wallet around as it looks stylish with jeans or a suit!


The Bantam Wallet is super thin at 4mm (about 5/32inches) and still allows for a number of cards and cash to be carried. You CAN stuff a lot of cards, cash, dockets, post-it-notes, whatever you want in there if you really want to, even coins and keys! I’ve only needed about 7 cards and some cash at any time and I store all those dozens of other cards at home that I use only once-in-a-blue-moon.

_______________________________________________________________________

8 Reasons to Support the Bantam Wallet Project:

1 - Its super thin, durable, light and perfect for any sized front, back or inside pocket.

2 - Its made of very high quality leather.

3 - You don’t have to pull it apart and put it together every time you want to use it, or have the risk of it falling apart accidently or from use over time.

4 - It doesn’t expose any cards to prying eyes, even when you open it.

5 - Your cards and cash can’t accidentally slip out.

6 - The contents wont fall out if you drop it.

7 - It has RFID blocking to stop someone skimming your cards and stealing your credit card money, or worse, your identity!

8 - You can customize the RFID feature by blocking the whole wallet, half of it, or none!

_______________________________________________________________________ 

 

Choose from 2 different styles of leather or suede.

Each wallet includes 2x RFID blocking cards.

 

RFID blocking? Increasingly in today's techy world, credit cards, drivers license cards, ID cards, and many other cards have an RFID chip. Radio Frequency Identification allows the transfer of information through electromagnetic induction at very short distances with no wires.
 


We’re ready to go!

Design - At this stage we have the final design which minimises wastage of the leather hide. It also allows for quick production as well.

Leather - The leather we use is ethical, sustainable and government approved and is of a very high quality.

Workshop - We have 2 skilled workshops ready for production and have been making similar items for over 25 years combined and are eager to help us out!

Funds - The money raised will go into buying materials such as the leather, thread, tools, and paying the leather crafters.

I hope you like the Bantam Wallet. Please click on a perk of your choice on the side and if you have any questions just let us know.

Thanks!
James



www.bantamwallet.com

www.facebook.com/pages/JamesWatson/170960969711060

www.jameswatson.com.au

Made in Australia.

 

 

F.A.Q.

Warranty
30 day money-back, or replacement, due to faulty workmanship. Just send it back to us and we'll refund your money or send you a new one.
  
Does the Bantam R Wallet protect all UHF, HF and LF cards?
The Bantam R Wallet is designed for cards that have low frequency (LF) chips which are used in almost all consumer cards that require tapping the reader to access its functionality. Ultra-high frequency (UHF) and high frequency (HF) chips are usually reserved only for packaging, distribution and shipping purposes.
 
Privacy
All personal information is kept strictly confidential.
 
Social Responsibility
We use government approved and sustainable leather. We use 100% recycled packaging where possible.

(The wallet has 4 cards on one side and 3 cards on the other with 5 folded notes.)

(and the money shot...)

Made in Australia.

Just send it back to us and we'll refund your money or send you a new one.  Does the Bantam R Wallet protect all UHF, HF and LF cards?The Bantam R Wallet is designed for cards that have low frequency (LF) chips which are used in almost all consumer cards that require tapping the reader to access its functionality. Ultra-high frequency (UHF) and high frequency (HF) chips are usually reserved only for packaging, distribution and shipping purposes. PrivacyAll personal information is kept strictly confidential. Social ResponsibilityWe use government approved and sustainable leather. story:
Hello Indiegogo Family,

I thought I would start by telling you where we came from. In 2006, I began to think about how I could create a meaningful, lasting American company that would compete in the world market, while supporting artisans and manufacturing here at home. After seeing the rise of popular food culture with such things as The Food Network, I realized that there was a gaping whole in the market for a lifestyle brand that suited the modern foodie as well as the professional chef. I was a chef myself, so I knew there was a demand for products that centered around the culinary lifestyle. I also knew, after years of working with local artisans from a chef's perspective, that there was a way to build such a company using American craftsmen as well as a few select small producers around the world that were making a difference in their communities. 

This year, after teaming up with an amazing graphic artist (James Porter), we brought that vision to life by creating our first t-shirt that paid tribute to Heritage ingredients. Eventually, we progressed into making prototypes for other items that make up the culinary lifestyle, including chef knives, cutting boards, aprons, soaps with culinary ingredients, and more. This Fall, we're ready to produce the full and complete line of Butcher & Baker products, manufactured completely by small manufacturers in socially responsible ways. All of our items will be either sustainable, organic, upcycled, recycled, and supportive of artisans and small-producers.

Together, James and I have spent the last year seeking out people that could take our designs from prototype to production - people that embraced our philosophies. We found them, and we're ready. Now, Butcher & Baker has an opportunity to make a difference in the economy , and spark a revolution in American manufacturing.

We have developed relationships with small operations that have the ability to scale up as we go. We want to make sure our partners have a real opportunity for growth over a sustained period of time. As we move to produce the Fall Line, increased demand will create more work for them, and will greatly increase the positive impact on their local communities. Even with the small amount we have done, we have immediately noticed an excitement level that doesn't come from large operations. With tens of millions of people in the U.S. identifying themselves as food and cooking enthusiasts, and even more around the world, we know we can build a viable American company with a real purpose. 

We’ve worked through all of the logistics of proving that this will work. We've built the site and we're ready to go. Here's where your pledges will go. 

25% - Manufacturing of Clothing 

30% - Bladesmiths, Woodworkers, Potters, Sewers, Soap Makers, Blacksmiths, Cobblers

  5% - Culinary Ingredients including spices, salts, bitters, etc.

15% - Equipment, Packaging

10% - Fair Trade, Other Products

15% - Wood Shop Time/Materials, Site Improvement, Event Participation (Like the Culinary Institute's Sustainability Conference in New York)

We've put together some rewards that we think you'll like. With every $16 increment, we create about 1 hour of work for American manufacturing - that's not even mentioning the long-term effect of what we accomplish with this round. Everyone at the $36 or more level will become a FOUNDING FOODIE, entitling them to special discounts when we launch the Fall line, and they will get their name on our site for as long as we're around. 

NOTE* WE'VE JUST REVAMPED OUR REWARDS WITH ALL NEW ITEMS, THIS IS WHY YOU WON'T SEE WHO HAS BACKED US WITH THE PREVIOUS REWARDS

I thought I would start by telling you where we came from. In 2006, I began to think about how I could create a meaningful, lasting American company that would compete in the world market, while supporting artisans and manufacturing here at home. After seeing the rise of popular food culture with such things as The Food Network, I realized that there was a gaping whole in the market for a lifestyle brand that suited the modern foodie as well as the professional chef. I was a chef myself, so I knew there was a demand for products that centered around the culinary lifestyle. I also knew, after years of working with local artisans from a chef's perspective, that there was a way to build such a company using American craftsmen as well as a few select small producers around the world that were making a difference in their communities. 
This year, after teaming up with an amazing graphic artist (James Porter), we brought that vision to life by creating our first t-shirt that paid tribute to Heritage ingredients. Eventually, we progressed into making prototypes for other items that make up the culinary lifestyle, including chef knives, cutting boards, aprons, soaps with culinary ingredients, and more. This Fall, we're ready to produce the full and complete line of Butcher & Baker products, manufactured completely by small manufacturers in socially responsible ways. All of our items will be either sustainable, organic, upcycled, recycled, and supportive of artisans and small-producers.
Together, James and I have spent the last year seeking out people that could take our designs from prototype to production - people that embraced our philosophies. We found them, and we're ready. Now, Butcher & Baker has an opportunity to make a difference in the economy , and spark a revolution in American manufacturing. 
We have developed relationships with small operations that have the ability to scale up as we go. We want to make sure our partners have a real opportunity for growth over a sustained period of time. As we move to produce the Fall Line, increased demand will create more work for them, and will greatly increase the positive impact on their local communities. Even with the small amount we have done, we have immediately noticed an excitement level that doesn't come from large operations. With tens of millions of people in the U.S. identifying themselves as food and cooking enthusiasts, and even more around the world, we know we can build a viable American company with a real purpose. 
We’ve worked through all of the logistics of proving that this will work. We've built the site and we're ready to go. Here's where your pledges will go. 
25% - Manufacturing of Clothing 
30% - Bladesmiths, Woodworkers, Potters, Sewers, Soap Makers, Blacksmiths, Cobblers
  5% - Culinary Ingredients including spices, salts, bitters, etc.
15% - Equipment, Packaging
10% - Fair Trade, Other Products
15% - Wood Shop Time/Materials, Site Improvement, Event Participation (Like the Culinary Institute's Sustainability Conference in New York)
We've put together some rewards that we think you'll like. With every $16 increment, we create about 1 hour of work for American manufacturing - that's not even mentioning the long-term effect of what we accomplish with this round. Everyone at the $36 or more level will become a FOUNDING FOODIE, entitling them to special discounts when we launch the Fall line, and they will get their name on our site for as long as we're around. 
NOTE* WE'VE JUST REVAMPED OUR REWARDS WITH ALL NEW ITEMS, THIS IS WHY YOU WON'T SEE WHO HAS BACKED US WITH THE PREVIOUS REWARDS

story:
HACKABLE: GET YOUR LED MODS ON!

HACKABLE wearable tech kits and mods are the first adaptable public releases from Toyshoppe Systems. Add light (+ power, communications, data and device connections) into anything you want to wear.

The engineering behind your favorite costumes can be applied to anything you want to light up. Use Hackable kits to add LEDs to your wearables, bikes, vehicles and anywhere or buy a custom piece!

As a Hollywood Effects Wizard Brent Heyning has designed physical and technical delights in 25 years of media engineering:

Major Movies (SpiderMan 2, Dark Knight Rises, Star Trek: Into Darkness, Tron, The Matrix and Star Wars trilogies + many sci-fi and blockbuster films) 

Musician Technical Effects (Daft Punk, Black Eyes Peas at Superbowl, Destroid, Rolling Stones, Metallica, Cheap Trick, Henry Strange, Eurovision)

Renegade & Indie Media (Lightning in a Bottle, Robot Combat League, The Ghastly Love of JohnnyX, Fly Me to the Moon, Oedipus, Team America: World Police)

Helmets coming soon will be the new evolution of this style with color-changing LEDs.

NOW ITS YOUR TURN TO LIGHT UP ANYTHING YOU DESIRE!

Many of these items will be offered here for the first time from Toyshoppe Systems, a team of talented makers and engineers in Los Angeles, CA. A few first look pieces are available for rush pickup this August and first kits will be out by late fall.

YOU ARE THE FIRST TO GET THESE KITS & MODS!

We have never before offered these incentives to the public and some items will never be offered again after this campaign - so now's your chance to make yourself into the object of art you've always dreamed about!

HACKABLE: ROAD AND FILM TESTED ENGINEERING

After Brent finished 77 helmets with Ironhead Studios for TRON: LEGACY we began to talk about taking the basic technology inside and putting it on everyday bike and cycle helmets. Our first prototype was worn by Evo for over 200 hours (over 100 hours on 1 9V battery!) and made it through a daytime car accident without getting destroyed. We found that we preferred the waterproof LEDs seen on the back of our first prototype helmet - they can be seen for TWO CITY BLOCKS when biking at night!

These LEDs are DURABLE - LONG LASTING - BRIGHT - EASY TO ADD ON

 
We use a mix of LED in our wearables and encourage you to hack and mod your solutions with other sensors, accelerometers, el-wire, sound effects or anything that suits your creative vision! Hackable elements are designed to be modular, hackable and adaptable to easily integrate with your existing systems.
 

Limited edition helmets, jackets and hats are available for men and women for the first and in some cases only time. You can send us your existing jacket to mod (stronger materials like leather are often easiest) or we can work with you to source the right piece for you. Batteries are included in your custom mods for ready-to-wear fashion.

There will only be 10 of these color-changing fashion designs:  

* Vintage Hat: Color-changing LED fascinator (from ComicCon 2013)

Your hat can include any items you want - send us your hat or objects and we'll construct a color-changing vintage hat for you. We provide a basic hat (fascinator or fedora) and 3 color-changing LEDs with a basic lithium-ion coin cell battery inside. Hats are designed to glow from the inside out or LEDs can go behind a featured object on the hat of your choice.

* Rebel Jacket: Your jacket or ours + up to 36 LEDs 

We cannot guarantee superpowers like the Resurrection Suit but we do expect you to rock this jacket with up to 36 LEDs attached in the color of your choice (also available in color-changing with basic programming). We will provide a leather jacket for you or send us one to mod. Let us know if you prefer us to mail you the pieces and instructions - you can always DIY with Hackable kits to add more functions and features.

No tesla coils on this one unless you come in for a custom design project with the Toyshoppe Systems crew. Thanks Will Keenan, costumer Kristina West and the cast & crew of the Ghastly Love of Johnny X!

WE MAKE CUSTOMS FOR STAGE, SCREEN AND PRIVATE USE

On request we have other limited edition art available through the Toyshoppe: transparent screens and LED walls, windchimes and home items along with custom LED/costume art like our work for DESTROID with Ironhead Studio (yes, those are thousands of LEDs + a CO2 cannon on their armor!)

HELP US MAKE MORE EPIC WEARABLES WITH YOU

With your support we will be able to buy a laser cutter and 3D printer for prototyping new projects in our studio - possibly from other IndieGogo Makers! We are looking at sourcing components from other IndieGogo artists and studios and we encourage you to get in touch if you want to work with us for costumes, props or models in your upcoming media projects. If we raise beyond our goal we will be investing in bulding the Hackable.me community to share your mods, tutorials and add-ons this fall.

GET A STAR PACKAGE FOR EFFECTS ENGINEERING

Custom time at Toyshoppe can include help with your work on large scale art, shows and series. We will meet with you to discuss your project goals and constraints and help you design a path to fabrication for anything you've dreamed up.

Toyshoppe artists are led by Brent Heyning including featured work from Bruce Giddons, Tim Lamb, Jason Willis, Kim Williams, Marc Rosenthal, Philip Horvath and Evonne Heyning with photos by Brent, Evonne and Allan Natian.

PICK UP YOUR KITS ON PLAYA! 

Thanks for helping us tool up the Toyshoppe Systems studio in Los Angeles and our mobile truck in Black Rock City!

A limited number of DIY Kits will be available for pickup at our mobile studio near 3:15/Airstrip in Black Rock City. Brent Heyning will be in the desert after August 9th and will have a workbench, mirror and supplies for you to come and create your mods. Make sure you reserve a playa pass so there's space and materials in the mobile workshop.

Brent Heyning speaks on technical wizardry at major conferences like SXSW, Wearable Tech World along with film festivals and studios such as this FOX Studios event with Singularity University in May 2013 where we premiered the new transparent LED screens based on work last seen in Star Trek Into Darkness.

HACKABLE EDUCATION, MEDIA & EVENT EXPERIENCE

We have been making top special effects for touring shows and movies for 25 years. Brent has worked with almost every major studio and director in Hollywood and now we bring you the best of our engineering work to your wearable tech and fashion dreams.

If you love our work, hire us and our partners for your project!

  • IRONHEAD STUDIO: Amazing wearables for film and major events
  • SPECTRAL MOTION: Mechanical props, characters and creatures
  • THE DO LAB: Events, installations and arts festivals
  • CHOIDO BROS: Puppetry and props for screen
  • PERSONAL CREATIONS: Production management, projection design
  • MAKER SHED: Share great add-ons, kits and maker products
  • EDDEFY: Personalized learning paths, experiential media software

HELP US GROW HACKABLE CAMPS FOR ALL AGES

We want to help everyone make their own fantastic wearable tech! You can bring us to your event to share Hackable kits and DIY maker culture guides with soldering irons, heatshrink and glue.....or bring us in to work on your existing project. Kids can learn how to get their helmets to talk to one another, creating fun programmable mesh patterns for sports teams and groups who want to light up and play together!

EXPERIENCED PRODUCTION SUPPORT AND HANDS-ON LEARNING

We offer production support to 6-12 major events per year such as Eurovision, Superbowl and big premiere events like ComicCon. If you have a major event to produce in the coming year and you know that you want the WIZARD and his team to help, now's the time to reserve time with our team.

SHARE HACKABLE HELMETS WITH FRIENDS!

We want to see your mods! Take a picture and tag them #wearabletech #hackable and send them to @Toyshoppe so we can see your work!

If you cannot give but want to help us out - post it out #hackable #wearabletech @Toyshoppe @TSsystems & click the SHARE button here. We look forward to lighting up your dreams.

ORDER A VIP PASS, LET US WORK WITH YOU TO DESIGN YOUR MASTERPIECE OR GET A KIT TO GET STARTED BEFORE WE SELL OUT OF THIS FIRST EDITION.

story:
Semper Fido Shirt Design

We originally did this shirt as an entry for the Woot.com tee shirt derby. It didn't win, but it got a lot of votes (and has come closer to winning straight up than any other design we've done.)

We got enough people saying that if we printed it ourselves, they'd be willing to buy it, and after our partial success on our last project, we're trying IndieGoGo again.

We were also introduced to the fine folks at http://www.USWarDogs.org, who agreed that this was a very on-mission shirt for them.  We're happy to help them raise money for helping four-legged service members transition back to civilian life.

We want to use this campaign to continue test marketing our shirts, to help reduce the risks of starting a small business, and to help a really worthwhile cause.  You're helping a pair of artists slowly, incrementally, get to do more art, full time, and make a living at it, and we really can't thank you enough for that support.  Both of us have had "graphic design" jobs that, while they paid the bills, were somewhat unfulfilling.

And, of course, you're helping transition four-legged veterans from military life, to civilian life, and finding adoptive homes.  

While Loyalty Is Greater Than Gold, Gold Has Its Uses...

For the $750 target, we print 50 shirts, and assume we'll be shipping about 30 of them at $360 in shipping costs, and will be donating around $100 to USWarDogs.org from a mixture of the different contribution levels.  We make almost no profit off of our initial shirt buy - we get these shirts into production, support a good cause, and have a small inventory to go from for future sales.  

If we hit that $750 target by May 5th (or earlier!) we'll do the initial shirt order so we can get the orders in the mail by the 22nd so you have them for Memorial Day.  Obviously, the sooner we hit that target, the faster the shirts come out.

If we fall short on this, we'll still print the shirts, and honor the commitment to http://USWarDogs.org based on what orders we actually get in the door.

It's our hope that we'll overshoot the $750 - at that point, the shirts have broken even on production costs, and we start to see a return on our time and efforts.  We expect this shirt to be a perennial, something we'll keep in stock on a regular basis.

Because we're supporting the US Armed Forces, we're particularly proud to offer an American-made shirt, made by people earning a living wage, as one of the options.  We would sincerely love to have that shirt be the dominant level of contributions, because it only seems appropriate.  We do understand that we're in the midst of hard financial times, so are keeping both the Anvil and American Apparel options.

We're only going to order one or two American Apparel shirts above and beyond what we get actual orders for. If you want to guarantee that you get this design on an American-made shirt, this is the only way to do it.

How You're Helping Us...And Others

We feel the value of this project is giving support for the US Marine Corps members.  It also provides a way to open a discussion of the Corps history and traditions.  You'll also be helping to fund a worthwile charity that combines both the best aspects of your local Humane Society and Veterans Outreach programs. 

While our first launch didn't quite hit the break even point, we have printed the shirts and have them in the hands of our customers even as we speak.  We have had to issue one refund (for a shirt that had a manufacturing defect in a size we didn't have a replacement for.)

Like all of our designs, anyone who contributes via IndieGoGo will be given a Shirt Patron credit on our web site at www.ReagencyDesign.com.

After this fundraiser is over, we will sell our inventory as a standard item off of our web shop, but there won't be an ongoing contribution to www.USWarDogs.org If you want to make a difference with our four-legged service members, the time to do it is with this fundraiser.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't make a contribution, or buy a shirt, please take the time to pass around the YouTube video, and the video for this IndieGoGo campaign. Most of our purchases the first time around came from second and third order referrals!  Every time you pass that link around to a group of people, you help us out a lot.

IndieGoGo has a lot of tools to help you share the information around - to FaceBook, to Twitter and to Google+.  Please do us a favor and spread the word!
