story:
INTRODUCING THE PODPLUG

 

We are Powering Us, a group of students at Ryerson University pursuing our Master's of Digital Media. We have created an energy efficient, convenient and safe outlet you can access through your home enabled app on your smartphone. Our biggest concern is providing you with a quality product, and the PodPlug is just that.

The PodPlug is attempting to limit the problems of the current traditional 3-prong outlet (electrocution, overheating and limiting ports for charging devices) and provide new and innovative alternatives to the clear plastic safety coverings that are inserted into the outlet to prevent electrocution, and by utilizing the PodPlug as a Smart Outlet.  

 

Meet the PodPlug

The PodBase plugs in and covers the wall outlet.  The base doesn't conduct electricity on its own so there's no risk of electrocution.  Lights, radios, phones and laptops can still be used by connecting them to the PodPlug which in turn pops into the PodBase.  Using induction charging the device is free to use.

 

Why is this important to us?

Like you (probably), we are tech fanatics and usually have multiple devices plugged in at once. Sometimes, we can forget to unplug or turn the devices off (the "old" age is catching up to us!). How awesome would it be to access our devices at home through the PodApp? It can be THAT simple. Now I don't need to worry about whether or not my hair straightener is going to cause a fire. 

 

Meet the PodApp on your HomeKit           

We also have come to the conclusion that regular three-prong outlets are safety hazards for most, especially for kids and pets. There will be no need to worry about "baby or pet-proofing" your home anymore, the PodPlug has you covered! No more unwanted "parent stress" about the possibility of electrocution. The PodPlugs use induction to transfer electricity, so the PodBase (where your 3-prong outlet once was) is safe to touch. 

 

The Journey So Far...

The PodPlug started as a design challenge that has quickly picked up steam.  Things have changed dramatically as the team at Powering Us have improved upon the original concept and brought onboard an engineering team to help bring the PodPlug to fruition. 

 

The PodPlug Package 

A single package includes one PodBase, and two PodPlugs. Expected retail price to be $50 CDN at launch, September 2018. 

Additionally....

  • PodBases will be sold individually
  • Pods will be sold in sets of two
  • USB and Nightlight specialty Pods will be sold separately

 

PERKS MAKE US POD-HAPPY!

Our outlet will be the first in its kind with all of the features associated with the device. Child safety is of the upmost importance and our PodPlug will revolutionize the traditional outlet. Once again, the PodPlug is attempting to limit the problems of the current traditional 3-prong outlet (electrocution, overheating and limiting ports for charging devices) and provide existing alternatives through clear plastic safety coverings that are inserted into the outlet to prevent electrocution, and by utilizing the PodPlug as a Smart Outlet.

YOU can help us create an innovative twist on the traditional outlet. Our lives are now consumed with technology; therefore, convenience is so important to us – add safety and energy efficiency to that list and you can help reinvent the outlet with just the click of a button. Check out our perks to get started!

For $30 you can choose from one of our pod-tasticly fun coffee mugs or t-shirts.  All of our perks can be found in the upper right column.  Thank you for being part of our journey!

 

Meet the "PodSquad"

Kristian Howald: Co-Founder, Creative Executive

Kellie Ring: Co-Founder, Marketing Executive

 Diane Stolte: Co-Founder, Digital Content Executive

Meaghan Taylor: Co-Founder, Business & Brand Executive

 

 

Risks & Challenges

As students, we do not have access to the following resources in order to make this product a reality:

  • Distributors
  • Warehouse space – storage
  • Established relationships within the market and industry

Throughout our journey of creating a quality product for YOU, we are likely to face hurdles and obstacles along the way. 

 

Can't donate? That's okay...there are other ways you can help. 

We understand that you might not be able to contribute, and that is okay! We ask you to share our idea through social media and get the word out there about the revolutionary PodPlug. Follow, tag and share our company on social media:

 

Still want more info, looking to invest or join our campaign?

CONTACT US

Instagram: @PodPlug

Twitter: @PodPlug

Facebook: PodPlug

Email: info@poweringus.ca

Website: https://www.poweringus.ca
story_txt:
INTRODUCING THE PODPLUG
 
We are Powering Us, a group of students at Ryerson University pursuing our Master's of Digital Media. We have created an energy efficient, convenient and safe outlet you can access through your home enabled app on your smartphone. Our biggest concern is providing you with a quality product, and the PodPlug is just that.

The PodPlug is attempting to limit the problems of the current traditional 3-prong outlet (electrocution, overheating and limiting ports for charging devices) and provide new and innovative alternatives to the clear plastic safety coverings that are inserted into the outlet to prevent electrocution, and by utilizing the PodPlug as a Smart Outlet.  
 
Meet the PodPlug
The PodBase plugs in and covers the wall outlet.  The base doesn't conduct electricity on its own so there's no risk of electrocution.  Lights, radios, phones and laptops can still be used by connecting them to the PodPlug which in turn pops into the PodBase.  Using induction charging the device is free to use.

 
Why is this important to us?
Like you (probably), we are tech fanatics and usually have multiple devices plugged in at once. Sometimes, we can forget to unplug or turn the devices off (the "old" age is catching up to us!). How awesome would it be to access our devices at home through the PodApp? It can be THAT simple. Now I don't need to worry about whether or not my hair straightener is going to cause a fire. 
 
Meet the PodApp on your HomeKit           
We also have come to the conclusion that regular three-prong outlets are safety hazards for most, especially for kids and pets. There will be no need to worry about "baby or pet-proofing" your home anymore, the PodPlug has you covered! No more unwanted "parent stress" about the possibility of electrocution. The PodPlugs use induction to transfer electricity, so the PodBase (where your 3-prong outlet once was) is safe to touch. 

 
The Journey So Far...
The PodPlug started as a design challenge that has quickly picked up steam.  Things have changed dramatically as the team at Powering Us have improved upon the original concept and brought onboard an engineering team to help bring the PodPlug to fruition. 



 
The PodPlug Package 
A single package includes one PodBase, and two PodPlugs. Expected retail price to be $50 CDN at launch, September 2018. 

Additionally....

PodBases will be sold individually
Pods will be sold in sets of two
USB and Nightlight specialty Pods will be sold separately


 
PERKS MAKE US POD-HAPPY!

Our outlet will be the first in its kind with all of the features associated with the device. Child safety is of the upmost importance and our PodPlug will revolutionize the traditional outlet. Once again, the PodPlug is attempting to limit the problems of the current traditional 3-prong outlet (electrocution, overheating and limiting ports for charging devices) and provide existing alternatives through clear plastic safety coverings that are inserted into the outlet to prevent electrocution, and by utilizing the PodPlug as a Smart Outlet.
YOU can help us create an innovative twist on the traditional outlet. Our lives are now consumed with technology; therefore, convenience is so important to us – add safety and energy efficiency to that list and you can help reinvent the outlet with just the click of a button. Check out our perks to get started!

For $30 you can choose from one of our pod-tasticly fun coffee mugs or t-shirts.  All of our perks can be found in the upper right column.  Thank you for being part of our journey!
 

Meet the "PodSquad"
Kristian Howald: Co-Founder, Creative Executive
Kellie Ring: Co-Founder, Marketing Executive
 Diane Stolte: Co-Founder, Digital Content Executive
Meaghan Taylor: Co-Founder, Business & Brand Executive
 
 
Risks & Challenges
As students, we do not have access to the following resources in order to make this product a reality:

Distributors
Warehouse space – storage
Established relationships within the market and industry

Throughout our journey of creating a quality product for YOU, we are likely to face hurdles and obstacles along the way. 

 
Can't donate? That's okay...there are other ways you can help. 
We understand that you might not be able to contribute, and that is okay! We ask you to share our idea through social media and get the word out there about the revolutionary PodPlug. Follow, tag and share our company on social media:
 
Still want more info, looking to invest or join our campaign?
CONTACT US
Instagram: @PodPlug
Twitter: @PodPlug
Facebook: PodPlug
Email: info@poweringus.ca
Website: https://www.poweringus.ca

story:
I’m a Mom.

I’ve been there. The late-night changings, holding down a wiggling baby with one hand and searching for the wipes with the other. Changing a toddler on the ground at the park and realizing that I forgot to bring the butt cream. There is not one scenario that I can’t relate to. I realized that parents around the world needed a way to stay organized at home, at the park, on a plane, and anywhere else they may roam. So, I created the ChangePal as an easy solution and it has literally changed my life. I know you’re going to love it too.

Mini Diaper Bag (Micromercial Tabletop+ Product Video) from Micromercial on Vimeo.

 

 

Wipes are essential for kids. You need to be able to wipe tiny fingers and tushies when things start to get messy...which they always do. The front pocket of your ChangePal has been designed using velcro so that you can open the flap and extract a wipe with one hand. Parents get it.

 

 

Quite frankly, wipes are also great for adults to keep your hands and mouth clean or even to use in the bathroom, so this is a great option for anyone who had to use a public restroom. You can even use this pocket to carry around a medium bottle of hand sanitizer instead of wipes. 

 

 

I hated digging through my diaper bag for diapers or trying to find them at home at 1 AM when I just need the baby to get back to sleep. ChangePal is meant to be compact so that if you grab for something, it’s right there where you can reach it without looking. You don’t need to remember where you put what anymore. The main pocket fits about 5 diapers, as well as your phone, keys, a small toy, a pacifier, and any other small item you may need. 

 

You can also use it to carry snacks for older kids or even your lunch. ChangePal is easy to access for whatever you need. 

 

 

We’ve included a matching wipeable changing pad made of non-toxic materials that is perfectly comfortable for your child and easy to roll up again and put inside the bottom pouch. There’s also enough room for a spare empty bottle or a tube of ointment. When you no longer need the changing pad or if there are no kids in diapers, this is the perfect compartment for a water bottle, hand lotion, and other items that you might want to grab quickly when you’re out and about. 

Not everyone wants to bring a full pack of wipes with them, so we’ve included a refillable ChangePal pouch so you can split your pack of wipes between home and your ChangePal. It’s just one more option to make it easier to organize your life. 

 

There is absolutely no way we would put anything toxic next to our children. Because of this, we’ve made the ChangePal out of non-toxic materials so that baby stays safe.

 

Our gray ChangePal is made from 100% durable, wipeable Vegan Leather (PU). The lining of the pockets is made out of wipeable nylon (do you see a trend here) and the Changing Pad is made of matching vegan leather on the bottom and top where baby gets changed is made of EVA material that is PVC-free and waterproof. Everything is easy to clean and safe to use next to the most delicate of skin. 

 

Want another option? The black ChangePal is made out of 100% nylon and also safe for baby use. The color-coordinated change pad is also made of matching nylon on the bottom and non-toxic EVA material that is PVC-free and waterproof on the side where the baby is changed.

 

Because the Gray is already in production, if you order it, it will be shipped to you in December of 2020. However, the black option has not started production yet, so the earliest we could ship it would be March 2021.

 

We weren’t quite ready to give up on looking good, so we created the ChangePal to be a classic style using vegan leather or nylon, and gold hardware for an upscale unisex design that looks good with any outfit. Dads love the look too (and it certainly looks good with a suit), so everyone can use it.

 

 

ChangePal is a minority and Woman-owned business and we care about our community because we’re already a part of it. By supporting small minority businesses, you are helping enrich the lives of everyone in the community. We’re so glad to be on this journey with you!

 

 



 

Baby Convenience is a Maryland-based company established in 2010. It is a women-owned and minority-owned company that specializes in manufacturing travel diaper bags and accessories designed to make caring for kids on-the-go easy and convenient. Baby Convenience is a company that cares about issues that affects us all, especially as it relates to caring for children and supports Compassion International, an organization aimed at helping kids living in extremely poor conditions all over the world. For more information, please visit www.mychangepal.com or email them at info@mychangepal.com

story:
A ready to use and sterilized underwear 

UNDIGO is a ready to use and sterilized pair of underwear, packed inside of an ultra-compact capsule. We want to let you feel strong and confident in delicate situations where a change of undies is needed.

 

 

We created this product thinking about all the situations women and trans folks have to face during their lives. From the day you start your period the first time in high school, all those ''oopsie'' moments, those wonderful maternity effects on the body and some unlucky people facing problems like Crohn's disease and other non-too fun stuff.

Carry it discretely in your purse, backpack while travelling away for days or in your gym bag. Everybody should always have this sensational feeling of wearing a dry, clean and fresh pair of underwear everywhere.

  • Between the ages of 18 and 44, approximately 24% of women experience incontinence. (American Medical Systems)
  • According to the Crohn's & Colitis Foundation of America, about 1.4 million Americans have Crohn’s disease or ulcerative colitis.

 

Our story began during a trip to Portugal in July 2016. Patrice had just left his job in the search of new challenges and Stéphanie, an elementary school teacher, allowed for them to have a full month of traveling during the summer.

One night after a "love session", the two decided to go to a restaurant in Lisbon city. The restaurant was a fantastic, cozy place serving good food, however, the moment was interrupted by an inconvenient situation in Stephanie’s jeans. This sparked a discussion on the differences between the things women and men must deal with daily which led to the idea that, wherever you are, you should always have the sensational feeling of wearing a fresh, clean pair of underwear.

Although Stéphanie did not get pregnant that night, the idea of a pair of underwear you can keep with you was born. We are now proud to present Undigo to the world.

 

 

Q: How does it work?
A: It's easy! You just have to take it, open it and wear it!

Q: Is it safe to use or wear anywhere?
A: Oh yes! Undigo is ready to use. It's sterilized so you don't have to worry.

Q: What is in Undigo?
A: In this tiny capsule, you can find your comfortable and life-saver underwear and a small wash-me bag to put your stained underwear. 

Q: Do you have different sizes?
A: Yes we do! We have from XS to XL.

Q: Do you have only black underwear?
A: No! We have nude underwear too.

Q: What can i do with my capsule after?
A: The capsule is made of aluminum so it's easy to recycle. We are working on an underwear recharge system so you will be able to recharge it yourself. 

Q: When will it ship?
A: Our target date to ship are february 2018. These are estimates and are subject to change.

Q: Where are the products made?
A: The underwear come from a nice, clean and safe environnement place in Vietnam.

We are about to start a production but we need your help! The important cost related to created this product and bring it alive is the major reason why we go through this Indiegogo campaign.

By the time we will reach our goal, let's start this journey together!

story:
Founding members of Golfkicks™ created the Sushi Roll® by Fishpond and work and play together in the Colorado tech and outdoor industries. "We came up with the idea for Golfkicks when we noticed that most golf shoes aren't cool and a lot of folks just wear sneakers out there on the course." Even serious golfers, who own several pairs of golf shoes, can make a pair of fun golfkicks and dominate their foursome.

 

Risks and challenges

We're prototyping, field testing and already starting the production phase after a successful Kickstarter campaign. Golfkicks stay snug in your sneakers when you swing for the fences and help you dominate whatever terrain the course throws at you. We are optimizing for simplicity and fun and will deliver this project quickly to our backers.

The Golfkicks team has a 5+ year history of successful product invention, design, and global distribution in the sporting goods industry.

story:
Short Summary

Exciting Journey!

  • Hey!  My name is Andrea Witt.  I have my BS-in Business with an emphasis is Management.  I am 3 classes away from the completion of my MA-Media Communications. 
  • This campaign is quite exciting and important to me.  The idea of the Bucket Wrist was a collaborative effort with my fiance.  He had this idea, and I took it and ran (with him, of course!) We are patent pending and the name is trademarked,  Motivating the world to live out their dreams is fulfilling, making them fashionable in the process is just an added perk! 
  • Patents are expensive.  New fees are added on a regular basis.  The funding would do many things--help us complete the patent process, and pay for manufacturing efforts of this bracelet.  We are looking into licensing the patent to Rembrandt upon completion--unless we get enough funding to  manufacture, market and sell these on our own. 

What We Need & What You Get

Your funds would pay for:

  • Patent fees
  • Manufacturing costs
  • in the event we don't reach our goal, the funds will be used for patent fees.  We will then sell licensing rights to the patent to a large charm manufacturer. 

The Impact

Your funding will make a difference. 

  • Remember the Italian Charm?  The Bucket Wrist will be the next big thing! Be a part of the success.
  • Help people remind themselves to live their dreams out.
Risks & Challenges

 The only risk I have right now in achieving this goal is lack of funds.  I am confident it will be a HUGE SUCCESS!!

  • Funds remove hurdles.  Money talks, and the Bucket Wrist (TM) is dependent on it. 
  • With funding, I can grow more funds and pay it forward to people like me on sites like this!

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't help me?  PLEASE PASS THIS FORWARD.

  • PLEASE SHARE my story in facebook and twitter and help the Bucket Wrist move to the next level!
  • DON'T FORGET TO USE THE INDIEGOGO SHARE TOOLS!

story:
Cream/Blue (left), Grey/Blue (right), and Navy Blue/Light Cream (below) Libre Sweaters. Currently available at the $99* EARLYISH BIRD perk ($139.95 retail price), $198* for two, or $285* for all three. *Does not include shipping.

 

 

 

 

Made in Bolivia with llama fiber, the Libre Sweater is our answer to the garment that doesn’t exist any more—a beautiful, rugged knit engineered to be put through the wringer, day after day. It keeps you comfortable, invites you to push yourself, and maintains that classic, heritage-inspired look, wherever you happen to roam. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

We started with a tailored, unisex silhouette for the Libre, and then added raglan sleeves for enhanced mobility. In other words, no restriction while reaching for a climbing hold, zero bunching while stretched out over the handlebars, and no pull while lifting the coffee mug. For the front panel and arms, we’ve employed a buttery-soft, midweight llama knit for year-round wear. We engineered an innovative, breathable knit mesh for the back panel, helping to regulate body temperature by releasing excess heat and moisture vapor. Say goodbye to sweaty back syndrome. Additionally, we beefed up the ribbing on the neck, cuffs, and hem to eliminate the dreadful stretching and sagging that plagues most woolen tops. We then rounded out the design by adding double-reinforced seams throughout to ensure it stands up the loads of use and abuse we encourage you to dish out. 

The Libre pays homage to the early wool-wearing boundary pushers—vikings, sailors, climbers, alpinists, skiers, writers, and other trailblazers who did things their way. After all, the wool sweater is one of the original technical midlayers, and we recognize it as a symbol of freedom that invites, and challenges, us to push ourselves to do things our way. 

 

The story starts with the llama—that noble, dependable pack animal that’s been providing a way of life for people in the Bolivian Andes for thousands of years. Llamas are adapted to this high plains region, where 50-degree temperature swings can occur daily, and their hollow hair serves as the perfect form of natural insulation. It’s proven to effectively trap warm air, insulate when wet, create a natural wind block, in addition to being naturally hypoallergenic, elastic, strong, and soft to the touch. This made it the perfect choice for the foundation of our Libre project.

 

 

Additionally, llama fiber is sourced with minimal effects on the environment, and the sale of llama fiber acts as a source of income for thousands of families in the Andes. We’re working closely with these farmers and manufacturers to develop a supply chain that focuses on the animals’ well-being, improves people’s lives, and minimizes our impact on the environment. Members of our team regularly visit suppliers to ensure that we’re creating a lasting, positive impact on communities in the region by responsibly sourcing the fiber that goes into our products.

 

 

 

 

 

  

 

We’ve partnered with a team in Bolivia for our fiber, which is one of the few companies in the world that’s developed an innovative dehairing process to separate coarse llama hair from fine hair. It’s based on the same principles used for dehairing cashmere, yielding the finest fibers possible for its “Cashmere of the Andes.” This fiber is then knitted to our specs to create the highly insulating, comfortable, and durable Libre sweater.

Transparency and camaraderie stand at the center of this company, with a group of employees that has grown into a family within a superb working environment and excellent working conditions. 

The group we've partnered with proudly holds social and environmental sustainability as the company’s core values. Its strong commitment to social responsibility is evident throughout the company’s practices and production processes: 

  • It is WRAP (Worldwide Responsible Accredited Production) certified. 
  • All workers receive health and retirement benefits, paid vacation, and double pay for overtime. 
  • It provides food subsidies to factory workers. 
  • Ergonomic chairs for all of its workers. 
  • Close to 80% of its workforce are women; many of whom are the sole providers of their households. 
  • Preservation of Bolivia’s strong heritage of knitting by providing job opportunities through this trade. 
  • The use fiber dyes with low environmental impact. 
  • A water treatment plant has been mounted by its sister company and yarn provider to treat the production’s water residues. 
  • Low-carbon emissions through the use of natural gas as our main source for heating. 
  • The use of biodegradable plastic bags for shipping. 

 

 

 

All our products are Guaranteed For Good. Your product is guaranteed to last 61 years, the average lifespan of a person living in the developing world. 

If your product does not meet your expectations in any way, we’ll work with you to resolve the issue, whether that means returning the item for repair, replacing or exchanging it, or refunding your purchase.

 

Davis Smith is a member of the UN Foundation’s Global Entrepreneurs Council. He was previously the Co-CEO of Baby.com.br, Brazil's startup of the year in 2012. He is a graduate of Brigham Young University (BA), the University of Pennsylvania's Lauder Institute (MA) and Wharton School (MBA). Davis is a lover of the outdoors and recently lead a team on the first successful crossing from Cuba to Florida via kayak.

Prior to joining Cotopaxi, Cheri designed technical apparel for top brands across the outdoor industry, such as Marmot, Columbia Sportswear and Dakine. She’s also a patent-holding shoe designer with designs at Nike ID and Ariat. Growing up on a sunny California farm, she fell in love with the outdoors. Today, she gets her fix skiing Utah’s famous snow, hiking with her dog Ned, or looking for the next wave on her kiteboard. Cheri holds a BA in Product Design and Development from San Francisco State University.

Spread the word! Make sure to let others know about our campaign! Thanks again for your support of everything we're doing at Cotopaxi. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

FAQ

What sizes will the Libre Sweater be available in?

The Libre Sweater will come in unisex sizing. The available sizes will be Women's XS to Women's XXXL, or Men's S to Men's XXL. A further breakdown of the sizing is as follows. Women's XS Women's S Women's M/Men's S Women's L/Men's M Women's XL/Men's L Women's XXL/Men's XL Women's XXXL/Men's XXL

How will you collect my size/will there be a survey to collect my size(s)?

Yes. ~10 days after your Indiegogo pledge, a survey will be sent out to collect your sizing information and more information. The waiting period is 10 days, because that is when your funds are locked in. Keep an eye out for a survey via BackerKit.

Does the Libre fit true to size?

Yes, the Libre fits true to size for athletic/trim fit. Keep in mind that as a knit, the sweater will grow a little over time, so when it arrives and it feels a little snug, you should be fine. If you wear a medium/large, we recommend you plan for a large.

How do you recommend cleaning the Libre?

We recommend washing by hand with cold water + mild soap, laying it flat to dry, or dry cleaning it. The other option is using a front loading washing machine (not top loading/machines with agitator).

Are Cream/Blue, Grey/Blue, and Navy Blue/ Light Cream the only colors currently available?

Yes

Can I swap out the hat and get a bigger discount on my Libre?

No. The Libre is available at these early bird prices for backers and is already discounted from the $139.95 retail price. As a thank you for early backers, we decided to offer something else as a free item at our cost, similar to when other brands/retailers offer a free item when you purchase a certain item. This ended up being the trucker hat. If you'd rather not have a hat, we can hold off sending it to you, or you can give it to someone else who you think would enjoy it.

Where does the name Cotopaxi come from?

Cotopaxi is named after a volcano near Quito, Ecuador.

What if I don't like my product?

Cotopaxi products are guaranteed to last 61 years, the average lifespan of a person living in the developing world. If there’s a problem with your product, we’ll gladly exchange it, get you a replacement, or repair the item in-house. If you are unhappy with your purchase please reach out to us at llamas@cotopaxi.com and see our return and exchange policy below.

What is your exchange policy?

We want you to love your Cotopaxi gear as much as we love making it. If for any reason you are not completely satisfied with your purchase, we gladly accept exchanges on orders shipped within the U.S. within 90 days of purchase. Exchanges are not guaranteed because our stock is limited. We will cover the costs of shipping any new item(s) for all exchanges. (Please note that all international sales are final, i.e., we cannot accept exchanges.) If you would like to exchange for a different item then we will treat it like a return, and you can place a new order for your new awesome item! View our exchange and return policy here: https://www.cotopaxi.com/pages/help%20

What is your return policy?

We accept returns on orders shipped within the US within 90 days of purchase, no questions asked. Please ensure that items are unworn, unwashed, and undamaged. Returns are always free and refunds are issued in the original form of payment for all purchases. Please note that all international sales are final, i.e., we cannot accept returns. Please do not hesitate to contact us at llamas@cotopaxi.com if anything seems amiss.

Who is responsible for international import, duties, VAT, and customs fees?

You, the backer/buyer, are responsible for any extra fees that may be applied when shipped to/arriving to your country. This includes international import, duties, VAT, and customs fees. Good news is that you will most definitely be able to get your awesome stuff, no matter where you live. Please note that all international sales are final, i.e., we can not accept returns or exchanges. UPDATE: We're excited to announce that we will be shipping EU orders of Libre Sweaters from within the EU! This means that there will be no extra import duties for EU backers on sweaters/hats. If you have any questions, please email llamas@cotopaxi.com.

For More FAQ's, visit

http://help.cotopaxi.com/
story_txt:
Cream/Blue (left), Grey/Blue (right), and Navy Blue/Light Cream (below) Libre Sweaters. Currently available at the $99* EARLYISH BIRD perk ($139.95 retail price), $198* for two, or $285* for all three. *Does not include shipping.    Made in Bolivia with llama fiber, the Libre Sweater is our answer to the garment that doesn’t exist any more—a beautiful, rugged knit engineered to be put through the wringer, day after day. It keeps you comfortable, invites you to push yourself, and maintains that classic, heritage-inspired look, wherever you happen to roam.       We started with a tailored, unisex silhouette for the Libre, and then added raglan sleeves for enhanced mobility. In other words, no restriction while reaching for a climbing hold, zero bunching while stretched out over the handlebars, and no pull while lifting the coffee mug. For the front panel and arms, we’ve employed a buttery-soft, midweight llama knit for year-round wear. We engineered an innovative, breathable knit mesh for the back panel, helping to regulate body temperature by releasing excess heat and moisture vapor. Say goodbye to sweaty back syndrome. Additionally, we beefed up the ribbing on the neck, cuffs, and hem to eliminate the dreadful stretching and sagging that plagues most woolen tops. We then rounded out the design by adding double-reinforced seams throughout to ensure it stands up the loads of use and abuse we encourage you to dish out. The Libre pays homage to the early wool-wearing boundary pushers—vikings, sailors, climbers, alpinists, skiers, writers, and other trailblazers who did things their way. After all, the wool sweater is one of the original technical midlayers, and we recognize it as a symbol of freedom that invites, and challenges, us to push ourselves to do things our way.  The story starts with the llama—that noble, dependable pack animal that’s been providing a way of life for people in the Bolivian Andes for thousands of years. Llamas are adapted to this high plains region, where 50-degree temperature swings can occur daily, and their hollow hair serves as the perfect form of natural insulation. It’s proven to effectively trap warm air, insulate when wet, create a natural wind block, in addition to being naturally hypoallergenic, elastic, strong, and soft to the touch. This made it the perfect choice for the foundation of our Libre project.  Additionally, llama fiber is sourced with minimal effects on the environment, and the sale of llama fiber acts as a source of income for thousands of families in the Andes. We’re working closely with these farmers and manufacturers to develop a supply chain that focuses on the animals’ well-being, improves people’s lives, and minimizes our impact on the environment. Members of our team regularly visit suppliers to ensure that we’re creating a lasting, positive impact on communities in the region by responsibly sourcing the fiber that goes into our products.        We’ve partnered with a team in Bolivia for our fiber, which is one of the few companies in the world that’s developed an innovative dehairing process to separate coarse llama hair from fine hair. It’s based on the same principles used for dehairing cashmere, yielding the finest fibers possible for its “Cashmere of the Andes.” This fiber is then knitted to our specs to create the highly insulating, comfortable, and durable Libre sweater.Transparency and camaraderie stand at the center of this company, with a group of employees that has grown into a family within a superb working environment and excellent working conditions. The group we've partnered with proudly holds social and environmental sustainability as the company’s core values. Its strong commitment to social responsibility is evident throughout the company’s practices and production processes: 
It is WRAP (Worldwide Responsible Accredited Production) certified. 
All workers receive health and retirement benefits, paid vacation, and double pay for overtime. 
It provides food subsidies to factory workers. 
Ergonomic chairs for all of its workers. 
Close to 80% of its workforce are women; many of whom are the sole providers of their households. 
Preservation of Bolivia’s strong heritage of knitting by providing job opportunities through this trade. 
The use fiber dyes with low environmental impact. 
A water treatment plant has been mounted by its sister company and yarn provider to treat the production’s water residues. 
Low-carbon emissions through the use of natural gas as our main source for heating. 
The use of biodegradable plastic bags for shipping. 

   All our products are Guaranteed For Good. Your product is guaranteed to last 61 years, the average lifespan of a person living in the developing world. If your product does not meet your expectations in any way, we’ll work with you to resolve the issue, whether that means returning the item for repair, replacing or exchanging it, or refunding your purchase. Davis Smith is a member of the UN Foundation’s Global Entrepreneurs Council. He was previously the Co-CEO of Baby.com.br, Brazil's startup of the year in 2012. He is a graduate of Brigham Young University (BA), the University of Pennsylvania's Lauder Institute (MA) and Wharton School (MBA). Davis is a lover of the outdoors and recently lead a team on the first successful crossing from Cuba to Florida via kayak.Prior to joining Cotopaxi, Cheri designed technical apparel for top brands across the outdoor industry, such as Marmot, Columbia Sportswear and Dakine. She’s also a patent-holding shoe designer with designs at Nike ID and Ariat. Growing up on a sunny California farm, she fell in love with the outdoors. Today, she gets her fix skiing Utah’s famous snow, hiking with her dog Ned, or looking for the next wave on her kiteboard. Cheri holds a BA in Product Design and Development from San Francisco State University.Spread the word! Make sure to let others know about our campaign! Thanks again for your support of everything we're doing at Cotopaxi.              FAQWhat sizes will the Libre Sweater be available in?The Libre Sweater will come in unisex sizing. The available sizes will be Women's XS to Women's XXXL, or Men's S to Men's XXL. A further breakdown of the sizing is as follows. Women's XS Women's S Women's M/Men's S Women's L/Men's M Women's XL/Men's L Women's XXL/Men's XL Women's XXXL/Men's XXLHow will you collect my size/will there be a survey to collect my size(s)?Yes. ~10 days after your Indiegogo pledge, a survey will be sent out to collect your sizing information and more information. The waiting period is 10 days, because that is when your funds are locked in. Keep an eye out for a survey via BackerKit.Does the Libre fit true to size?Yes, the Libre fits true to size for athletic/trim fit. Keep in mind that as a knit, the sweater will grow a little over time, so when it arrives and it feels a little snug, you should be fine. If you wear a medium/large, we recommend you plan for a large.How do you recommend cleaning the Libre?We recommend washing by hand with cold water + mild soap, laying it flat to dry, or dry cleaning it. story:
Welcome to the official Indiegogo page for WAEL. If you're here, it's because you're interested in what we have to offer. We are a street/urban brand of clothing, all designed and created by Julian Astudillo. We became an idea a couple years ago, and now we're making a mere idea into a reality. Urban and street style is a very popular way of life these days, and fashion will always be something that people find interesting. The fashion industry is one of the world's top grossing industries today, this is due to the fact that fashion is a part of our everyday lives. How we dress says something about who we are as people. WAEL has taken different styles and incorporated them into one style. Below you will find 8 shirts that we're using for our first ever collection.


The design of our products are very articulate and WAEL uses the best picture/logo editing software for designing shirts and advertisements such as:

- Adobe Photoshop CC

- Adobe Illustrator CC

Not to mention, it's all done on a lightning fast iMac. With the right tools and the knowledge, we've been able to look at what people are interested in from all different types of clothing and design 8 individual shirts. From colorful to black and white, we have created our very own spectrum of design.


Each shirt you see here has been designed for individuals with urban and street style. They reflect the "outcast" sense of style while maintaining their edgy appearances. While some have clean looking designs, a few others have a grunge/urban look to them. Each design was made by Julian Astudillo, the creator of WAEL.


We have a goal of $30,000. This will cover the costs of packaging, as well as printing the shirts in order to get them to customers. We want the best quality merchandise for our customers, so we need a good amount to invest into our clothing! Our goal will make sure we have the right amount of funds to deliver our merchandise to customers without a problem, as well as providing quality merhcandise.


We want to get you your clothing as soon as possible! Funds will be used for the following:

- Printing the shirts individually

- Packaging costs (Wrapping, Tags, etc.)

- Shipping

- Advertisements (Paper ads, web ads, spreading awareness, etc.)



Waiting is the best thing you can do. Picture this, you print roughly 200 shirts. But, only 80 people order a shirt, you're left with 120 shirts just sitting there.

What if 120 people end up ordering your shirts over time?

Why wait? It's a bit risky, and it's only wasting money that could be used towards customers who want to purchase our merchandise. Waiting to print is a strategy we're using for the benefit of the customer. We only print a shirt when it's ordered.


Anyone should be able to rock our clothing! We want our shirts to come in sizes small to XXXL. We don't discriminate.


We've designed simplistic black and white tags for our packaging (above picture). Packaging is a key factor in catching the public's attention. Our packaging will be environmentally friendly too!


Julian Astudillo is the founder and creator of WAEL. At age 15, he came up with the idea to create his own clothing company, which has transformed into what you see now. At the age of 18, he is ready to begin his life as an entrepreneur and work his way up into the fashion industry. Spending hours a day planning, designing, and thinking of new and creative ways to catch the public's eye, Julian is sure his company will one day be a huge success. He has always asked himself what he may be capable of, and he's wondered about where his future may take him. He doesn't have to wonder anymore, because he's found his outlet.

"It's all about drive and motivation. Nothing can stop you once you have both by your side."

From the time he was little, Julian has always loved to draw. And over time he's improved in all aspect of art. His strongest aspect, is design.

But what's most important to him is making a change.



This is a very important part of WAEL. For this aspect of the company, we are currently designing a shirt that is edgy, yet will spread awareness of our oceans current conditions. We will be donating a percentage of our "Ocean Help" Tee to the Ocean Conservancy in order to heal our oceans and keep them healthy. We will keep you updated on the design of the shirt and if we need to change anything. This shirt is important to us. You can't have a healthy world without a healthy ocean.




What is the Ocean Conservancy?

The Ocean Conservancy is a voice for the ocean. It's a company dedicated to keeping our oceans clean while motivation thousands of others to do the same. By bringing volunteers together, they have already made a huge impact on protecting wildlife and cleaning our beaches. Together, we can all help our ocean to be as clean and healthy as possible. By purchasing WAEL's Ocean Help shirt, you too can be a part of the fight to save the ocean. A percentage will be donated to the Ocean Conservancy in order to restore our once healthy ocean.

One day, WAEL wants to be able to make a worldwide impact. This is just the start of something great. Our "Ocean Help" Shirt is in the making. We will have you updated on the shirt shortly so you are able to see what it looks like, and other aspects of it's packaging.



-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



Other Ways You Can Help:

Some people aren't able to contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help. If you can't afford a perk, you could always take the time to tell your friends and family if this interests you. Ask someone you personally know that is able to make a contribution that will help us along our journey.

Please share this campaign on any social networking sites so others can help contribute. The sites include:

  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • Instagram
  • Through E-Mail

Your help is highly important to us and we appreciate it greatly.


Why are we unique?

We're different from the rest. We've taken an urban/skate style and developed it into a simplistic clothing company. Each shirt design has a very unique quality.


We are so excited for you to be a part of the WAEL family and help us start our journey!

So what are you waiting for?

Join the campaign.

This is only the beginning.

story:
PAIX Design is dedicated to connecting you to the world in style. Based in San Francisco, PAIX Design understands the fast morphing world and its lightening pace. Grabbing the essence of modern life, we give you, the urban commuters, the best versatile and stylish gear, the BACKPAIX.

We know connection, we live life at its cusp, we drive forward hard just like you, the urban commuters. The BACKPAIX is stylish, personal, connected, eco-friendly, weather-proof, powered, on top of its capacity to store things - vital and trivial, physical and digital.


BACKPAIX is you, your own statement in life as who you are, and always on the move.


Your support is critical to the dream backpack. We need your help to bring this fashionable and versatile backpack to the market. To bridge technology and creativity in life is our goal. If our funding target is reached, we’ll be moving forward directly into tooling and manufacturing the BACKPAIX. If you like BACKPAIX, please kindly lend us your support to make it happen. Your help is greatly appreciated.

An eye-candy of a backpack, equipped with smart accessories, imbues new life into an indispensable accessory in life. The PAIX Design team further dedicates to developing different smart devices to keep the BACKPAIX at the edge of time. 

To do so, we need your support and participation in the process that involves UX/UI integration, hardware/software development, as well as high tooling cost.



Get your project founded today!


Get cash back on the projects you love!

story:
The vision was to create a Couture Ready to Wear Collection that reflects our times as well as honor our past combining old world craftsmanship with a post modern Road Warrior's Spirit!

Artist/ Fashion Designer Yuki Tanaka has studied Fashion Design at Parson's School of Design in New York and has worked professionally as a Fashion Designer for various projects & as a Fashion Stylist for several music videos, commercials, private clients & Fashion editorials in Miami & New York. Yuki  was also a couturier/stylist on the John Legend Evolver Tour. Yuki's Fine Art has also been exhibited and curated by Irene Hernendez-Feiks of Wonderland SF & Chillin Productions in San Francisco, Miami's Wynwood Art District & various gallery shows in New York since 2007.

Yuki became a fixture in the NYC underground Art Scene for many years making Art and Fashion shows and underground parties with the notorious Art Collective "Collective Hardware" in the L.E.S , The Chelsea Hotel & The National Arts Club with the support of world renown Art Critic, writer, poet Anthony Haden Guest, Actor Norman Reedus,  Artist Ronnie Cutron (Andy Warhol's Assistant) & the leader of the Cunt Rock Revolution Alex Zapak A.K.A "The Countess".

Yuki also has dedicated  herself to the study of ancient cultures and traditions of the world including the wisdom teachings of her own Japanese / Cherokee and French American Heritage by meditating in the temples of Kyoto Japan since the age of 4 and learning and living out the shamanic traditions of the Native Americans. This has led her to studying abroad by visiting & learning from various indigenous medicinal cultures of the Amazon Jungle in Peru, India, Japan, and the U.S. Such influences of design, cultural perspectives, craftsmanship and aesthetics infuse her work with a futuristic hand.

Yuki believes in keeping up the tradition and quality in garment construction only found in couture and creates & designs each prototype by hand from sketch to finish and takes great care in sourcing quality fabrics and materials from around the world. All of the leather and furs used are vegan synthetic fibers of the highest quality that gives you the warmth, look, and weather durability found in fur & leather while being more sustainable!




This is the official introduction of Yuki's first men's and women’s collection which includes lounge, active wear and urban clothes geared toward those who love to look great while living life to the fullest! The style evokes a futurist, urban soulfulness, with a Road Warrior aesthetic. The pieces are versatile enough to take you from a walk through the city to a lunch meeting, from working out to just hanging out.

CHATEAU DE LION is about freedom of movement with durable functionality for the changing demands of Global Warming and the challenges of urban living. Yuki is dedicated to bringing together the flare of couture with the demands of everyday life to create a new lifestyle brand for the Road Warrior in everyone!

"I’ve obsessed over the details of fabric, fit and finish. Using my years of experience in the fashion industry, I’m working with the same fabrics and factories as many of today's top luxury brands.

CHATEAU DE LION is also about collaboration. I want a dialogue with you and I want you to be part of our community from its inception!

Join me; become a part of the CHATEAU DE LION movement!"

I have production lined up and ready to go, but as a relatively new brand I need to guarantee certain production minimums. That is where you come in. By taking part in this campaign you will help us fund our first production run..and be the first to get your hands on the CHATEAU DE LION Collection!  In order to take advantage of new opportunities of stable growth I need your support so I can meet the new production needs. Also it will help me make more fresh styles available to all of you fashionistas without breaking the bank!

So in short, you guys are going to get the best deals you are ever going to find for quality Rock Star Designer clothing that is not only killing it in style but also in durability and function!

As soon as you choose your donation package,  your gift for donation will be processed and delivered within 2-3 weeks after the campaign ends!
Packages that include custom work have their own timelines depending on the custom work requested by the supporter and will be discussed before hand.

To further show my gratitude for your support at this crucial moment of growth I will include a limited edition CHATEAU DE LION  Art Graphic Print 1/100 signed and numbered!

The goal is not only to help people bring out the Rock Star from within, but also to create the most sustainable Fashion forward and well made Designer Collection out there that is made to perfection!

Please help me show the world a company can thrive while enriching the well-being and quality of life of their employees, clients, business partners, & the global community!

Also, most of the styles are available in both women's and men's sizes so that everyone can wear what they wish!

Everything is tailor-made to order with LOVE in San Francisco & L.A !
By buying CHATEAU DE LION and supporting the campaign you will be making a HUGE contribution to helping launch CHATEAU DE LION'S first collection as you Rock the streets in your fresh designer gear!

So let's do this together!
I believe together as one we can do anything!

Please forward this to anyone you know that would be interested in joining and supporting CHATEAU DE LION in Rocking the world with style!

Thank you and stay BLESSED!

xoxxo,

YUKI*
story_txt:
The vision was to create a Couture Ready to Wear Collection that 
reflects our times as well as honor our past combining old world 
craftsmanship with a post modern Road Warrior's Spirit!Artist/ 
Fashion Designer Yuki Tanaka has studied Fashion Design at Parson's 
School of Design in New York and has worked professionally as a Fashion 
Designer for various projects & as a Fashion Stylist for several 
music videos, commercials, private clients & Fashion editorials in 
Miami & New York. Yuki  was also a couturier/stylist on the John 
Legend Evolver Tour. Yuki's Fine Art has also been exhibited and
 curated by Irene Hernendez-Feiks of Wonderland SF & Chillin 
Productions in San Francisco, Miami's Wynwood Art District & various
 gallery shows in New York since 2007. Yuki became a fixture in 
the NYC underground Art Scene for many years making Art and Fashion 
shows and underground parties with the notorious Art Collective 
"Collective Hardware" in the L.E.S , The Chelsea Hotel & The 
National Arts Club with the support of world renown Art Critic, writer, 
poet Anthony Haden Guest, Actor Norman Reedus,  Artist Ronnie Cutron 
(Andy Warhol's Assistant) &  the leader of the Cunt Rock Revolution
 Alex Zapak A.K.A "The Countess".Yuki also has dedicated  herself to the study of ancient cultures and 
traditions of the world including the wisdom teachings of her own 
Japanese / Cherokee and French American Heritage by meditating in the 
temples of Kyoto Japan since the age of 4 and learning and living out 
the shamanic traditions of the Native Americans. This has led her to 
studying abroad by visiting & learning from various indigenous 
medicinal cultures of the Amazon Jungle in Peru, India, Japan, and the 
U.S. Such influences of design, cultural perspectives, craftsmanship and
 aesthetics infuse her work with a futuristic hand.Yuki believes
 in keeping up the tradition and quality in garment construction only 
found in couture and creates & designs each prototype by hand from 
sketch to finish and takes great care in sourcing quality fabrics and 
materials from around the world. All of the leather and furs used are 
vegan synthetic fibers of the highest quality that gives you the warmth,
 look, and weather durability found in fur & leather while being 
more sustainable!This
 is the official introduction of Yuki's first men's and women’s 
collection which includes lounge, active wear and urban clothes geared 
toward those who love to look great while living life to the fullest! 
The style evokes a futurist, urban soulfulness, with a Road Warrior 
aesthetic. The pieces are versatile enough to take you from a walk 
through the city to a lunch meeting, from working out to just hanging 
out.CHATEAU DE LION is about freedom of movement with durable 
functionality for the changing demands of Global Warming and the 
challenges of urban living. Yuki is dedicated to bringing together the 
flare of couture with the demands of everyday life to create a new 
lifestyle brand for the Road Warrior in everyone!"I’ve obsessed 
over the details of fabric, fit and finish. Using my years of experience
 in the fashion industry, I’m working with the same fabrics and 
factories as many of today's top luxury brands.CHATEAU DE LION 
is also about collaboration. I want a dialogue with you and I want you 
to be part of our community from its inception!Join me; become a part of the CHATEAU DE LION movement!"I have production lined up and ready to go, but as a relatively new brand I need to guarantee certain production minimums. That is where you 
come in. By taking part in this campaign you will help us fund our first
 production run..and be the first to get your hands on the CHATEAU DE 
LION Collection!  In order to take advantage of new opportunities of stable growth I need your support so I can 
meet the new production needs. Also it will help me make more fresh 
styles available to all of you fashionistas without breaking the bank!So
 in short, you guys are going to get the best deals you are ever going 
to find for quality Rock Star Designer clothing that is not only killing 
it in style but also in durability and function!As soon as you 
choose your donation package,  your gift for donation will be processed 
and delivered within 2-3 weeks after the campaign ends!Packages that include custom work have their own timelines depending on the custom work requested by the supporter and will be discussed before hand.To further show my 
gratitude for your support at this crucial moment of growth I will 
include a limited edition CHATEAU DE LION  Art Graphic Print 1/100 
signed and numbered!The goal is not only to help people bring 
out the Rock Star from within, but also to create the most sustainable 
Fashion forward and well made Designer Collection out there 
that is made to perfection!Please help me 
show the world a company can thrive while enriching the well-being and 
quality of life of their employees, clients, business partners, & 
the global community!Also, most of the styles are available in both women's and men's sizes so that everyone can wear what they wish!Everything is tailor-made to order with LOVE in San Francisco & L.A !By buying CHATEAU DE LION and supporting

 supporting CHATEAU DE LION in Rocking the world with style!Thank you and stay BLESSED!xoxxo,YUKI*

story:
This campaign is going to re-launched soon, as we are finally starting to build a fan base and getting bloggers and media interested.

************************************************************************

 

If you could try on any clothes from anywhere in the world, which clothes would you choose?

Our fb page: https://www.facebook.com/grundergruppa

Clothes are dynamic flexible objects with a personality photos cannot bring out. They are individual choices and their personality needs to match our own.

When buying clothes online we still have to use technology developed for paper; photo. The digital media have possibilities web stores have not begun to use. Because of this, most people still have an aversion to buying clothes online.

Large dominant brands are selling us dreams. They dress up photo models and celebrities in tailor-made versions of their clothes, then Photoshop them until they are almost not recognizable. These pictures create a dream and illusion they sell us through media.


How many of us have bought into this illusion only to find out we do not fit in the dream when the clothes arrives. Because of all the hassles of returning clothes, we end up putting them in the back of the closet, only getting rid of them when enough time has passed for our guilty conscience to let it happen.

This is not only bad for the environment, it is also putting a serious brake on online shopping and therefore our choices of stores and brands.

The real power over what we buy are still with us; you and me.
This is under the assumption we have any real choices in clothes we can try on. Often this is not really the case as only a few dominating chains are available and within easy reach.

 

The vision behind our project is to make the clothes universally available and bring out the full potential of the digital media. We are allowing you as a customer to try on clothes and to create whole outfits independent of brand and location. 

 

 

Some surveys regarding online shopping

 The Online Fit Problem has three parts:

  1. It is clearly impossible for online shoppers physically to try on clothes before they buy.
  2. There is widespread inconsistency among retailers and brands in terms of size names, conventions and standards.  This makes online clothes shopping a challenge for six out of ten shoppers (Mintel, Fashion Online, March 2012).
  3. The size of an item provides no information about the fit of that item.  There is no way to know how it will look on any individual person.

There are two direct consequences and one indirect consequence of the Online Fit Problem:

  • Buyer hesitation: buyers either never add the item to his/her basket, or fail to check out.  This happens because they are not confident about their choice.  The result for retailers is: low conversion rates.
  • High levels of garment returns: a customer who finds that a garment does not fit in the desired way will simply return the garment to the retailer.  Sometimes this is for an exchange, but usually for a refund.  The result for retailers is: high rates of costly garment returns.
  • Brand damage: returning a garment because it doesn’t fit is disappointing to any customer, even for speculative purchases.  Any brand that disappoints its customers risks brand damage, however smooth its returns process.

What is the scale of the Online Fit Problem?

The size of the US online apparel market alone is over $40 billion – yet garment return rates average 25% for online apparel sales of which around 70% is for reasons of fit.  Measured even in this simple way, the value of garments returned because of the Online Fit Problem is $7 billion per year in the USA alone.

PwC Multi channel shopping survey

 http://www.pwc.com/en_us/us/retail-consumer/publications/assets/pwc-us-multichannel-shopping-survey.pdf

A key to growing business in this multichannel world is, unarguably, the use of digital technology. The billions of smartphones, tablets and other digital devices in circulation are fuelling multichannel growth and innovation. By 2015, US retail e-commerce sales are expected to reach $279billion. It is evident for retailers and brands that digital channel excellence is no longer an option, but an imperative for success.

 

Our history, so far

My wife is a very skilled clothing designer and we have been selling and marketing her clothes for years  http://www.norskfashion.com/. 

After participating at Oslo Fashion week, several tradeshows in Paris and
even on some TV shows, we found it too expensive, too inefficient and too time consuming.

 

Press coverage

    

 

 

http://www.digitaljournal.com/pr/1915637

 

 

Italian sites:

http://dammilvia.it/avatar-virtuale-che-crea-vestiti-un-click/

http://it.paperblog.com/avatar-virtuale-che-crea-vestiti-in-un-click-2314632/

Italians love clothes and Things related to clothes .

Bulgarian newspapers:

http://www.nbp.bg/nbp/?p=65704

http://nikak.bg/?p=15766

Our concept, explained

(screenshots from prototypes)

When you browse clothes through the ItsMeSee system, you can start the same way as you would do in any other clothing store: you browse clothes. The major difference is the ease and smoothness you can do this. There are no rows of photos, but hanging clothes you can flip through like you would in a store. You can even scroll the clothes on a mannequin to create outfits.

 

On the next level (if you want to spend some more time setting up) you can enter some basic sizing on the different parts of the body, like for pants, shirt or jacket. This takes only a few seconds. Now you will automatically get only the sizes you have set up, and you can see how things look.

If you want to set up even further, you can enter more measures and get a more accurate mannequin with your exact sizes. This will take perhaps 5-10 minutes.

On the next level you will take some pictures of yourself from different angles and the software will create a 3D silhouette of your body. This will be filled with a computer gaming figure With your shape and look. You enter some basic measures and the software will calculate the rest. This will take 15-30 min. Depending on how accurate you want this to be.

 

Now you can start trying on clothes. In the 3D dressing room you can set up parameters like prices, brands, colors,
etc.

When you browse your mouse over different parts of the body you get choices of clothes to try on. If you pick a jacket you will get a wheel of jackets stretching out behind you. These jackets you can scroll on in any speed you want. The current jacket on your digital body will show as an ikon next to you. If you click on this ikon you zoom into that jacket. You can now shake it, turn it around and zoom into any detail.

 

(all of these are just rough sketches to try out differnt solutions, not showing the quality of Our finished product )

After picking a jacket you can browse your mouse further down to get a selection of pants.


When you finish putting together outfits, you can send your mannequin into a showroom. This you can do several times. When you have created enough outfits you can go into the showroom and see how each of them look. You can also invite family or friends into the showroom to get their opinion before you buy. If you wish you can also share any outfit on facebook or other social media.

 

Quality of clothes and mannequins

What we have made in the video is not the quality our product will have. Up until now, we have focused on solving technical and financial challenges in our development. Everything we show now is on a rough sketch level, made only to try out solutions and Interfaces.

 

Technology

I have been working at several Oil/Offshore related Companies the last decade and am very familiar with engineering software used to do complex imulations.

Doing 3D modelling myself and being more than average interested in omputer gaming, I started to think: Why not use these Technologies to show our clothes to the world?

 

There have been several attempts to do this before but none has succeeded so far.


Some failed because the Technology at the time was not ready. Other ran into technical problems or limitations preventing them from showing the necessary quality. The biggest challenge our predecessors have run into is the 3D display through web browsers. It is fine when you only need to turn around the object, but when you need to do complicated manipulation, like opening and shaking, things has not worked out so well . Our solution is simple, but very effective. We are able to show everything in just about any quality. 

 

 

We found some very skilled and dedicated people in India, who have been helping us solving technical issues as well as doing some developing.

 

See my blog here: http://itsmesee.com/blog.html

 

 

There is no effective way to buy clothes today. You have to “walk the miles” or browse clumsy web pages. 

The clothes need to come to you and you should be able to try them on fast and effortless.

Through our concept, you can try on a hundred clothes in a minute, creating any outfits and seeing how they looks on you.

 People buy clothes online in an ever-increasing tempo. Today around 10%, but within 2020, it is estimated 20% or more. In addition, People browse clothes online before they go to the store to do the purchase. More and more clothing stores are aiming at a global marked, especially online. 

Our Project put you as a customer in the center and all the clothes
YOU want around you. Our team have spent around 6 years developing
a "simple" (the solution and work behind is not simple) and effective way to display clothes on screen. 

 

Here are the benefits?

 
 Forget the highly inaccurate sizing (S, M, L) system. A few basic measures of your  body and you will see how the clothes actually fit.

In our system you scroll on clothes. It is fast, pleasant and effective. No more pictures of clothes.
 
Put together whole outfits, and see how they look on you.
 
Let the clothes come to you, no need to travel looking for exciting new clothes.

Invite friends into the showroom to get their opinion about clothes or outfits.

ItsMeSee bring you “real” clothes much closer to the real thing.

And a lot more to come!


The ItsMeSee Interactive 3D clothing Project is an ambitious Technology Project, aiming to change how clothes are being marketed and sold on the web.

We have been developing a system for showing clothes on any digital display (monitors, smart phones, pads etc) as close to the real thing as technology allows.

We have spent years (since 2008) trying out technologies, finding solutions for problems we never knew was there until we hit it.

 

 

We have a couple of working prototypes ready. What we need Money for is to expand and redesign these platforms and add features . We are also modelling up as many clothes as we have funding for. 

 When this is ready we will present the future of clothing for Our funders first. All contributers will be asked to be Our beta testers, before we release to the general Public.

 

Where does my money go?

Each piece of clothing requires a LOT of work to create the quality and realism we want.

There are hundreds of parameters we need to tweak to create optimal simulations.

We need to hire more people to scale up production and do some more programming.

The showroom and dressing room platforms need to have many functions implemented as we only have some very basic things ready now. We have a couple of working prototypes ready. What we need Money for is to expand these platforms and add features.

We are also modelling up as many clothes as we have funding for. 

 Even if we do not reach Our goal we should be able to create
something amazing for you to try. Perhaps not with all the features
and not as many clothes as we want. 

 

Risk

We are not developing new technology, only doing some adaptations and programming. Everything we use is tested solutions and we know it works. In addition, we have already made simple versions of everything and know how it will turn out. Some challenges there will be, but nothing major.

 

Our team

We are working closely with highly skilled people from Norway, India and The Philippines. We will also add people as we progress with our development.

 

Our goals

We  introduce a new standard for searching and buying clothes online. To improve old fashion and obsolete systems for digital web stores and showrooms. It is also our goal to give the consumer more saying in what clothes should be available each season.

This would of course be clothes from different designers and brands from all over the world.

 We have several additional goals, which we will get back to after some further progress.

If you are an investor or know someone who might be interested in investing in us, let us know.

 

Production timeline

July: preparations

August: Production clearification and planning

September: Production start

Desember: 1st  Prototype ready for beta testing (for contributers to try)

April 2015: launch of full demo showroom for the global testing and demonstration


The perks

Everyone who donates to Our Project will be kept updated about Our progress via e-mail

 

T-shirt and E-shirt

Not yet ready but it will be AMAZING and INCREDIBLE!!!

 

Plaque

The Plaque will look great, this is just a sketch, what you get will be much nicer.

The ugly face will be extchanged With a much nicer Picture of you or perhaps Your pet pig or dust bunny.

You can promote your contact information, web page or a short text of Your Choice.

 

 

Get a statue of yourself

Our Graphics team will create a digital 3D statue of you from photos. It will rock the site forever. People will be in awe in the centuries to come and forever gaze upon Your glory.  

 

Personal mannequin

We set up a mannequin With Your basic measures and look.

 

 

Clothing designers

To you clothing designers out there: we understand what you are struggling with.


Support us and we will help bring YOUR brand out.

We can remake one or more of your designs into what will be the new format and let people all over the world try on your products.

 The most interesting clothes are not being provided by large brands, but by small innovative designers like you.

It is also our goal to give the consumer more saying in what clothes should be available each season.This would of course be clothes from different designers and brands from all over the world. We have several additional goals, which we will get back to after some further progress.If you are an investor or know someone who might be interested in investing in us, let us know.  Production timelineJuly: preparationsAugust: Production clearification and planningSeptember: Production startDesember: 1st  Prototype ready for beta testing (for contributers to try)April 2015: launch of full demo showroom for the global testing and demonstration
The perksEveryone who donates to Our Project will be kept updated about Our progress via e-mail T-shirt and E-shirtNot yet ready but it will be AMAZING and INCREDIBLE!!!  PlaqueThe Plaque will look great, this is just a sketch, what you get will be much nicer.The ugly face will be extchanged With a much nicer Picture of you or perhaps Your pet pig or dust bunny.You can promote your contact information, web page or a short text of Your Choice.  Get a statue of yourselfOur Graphics team will create a digital 3D statue of you from photos. It will rock the site forever. People will be in awe in the centuries to come and forever gaze upon Your glory.   Personal mannequinWe set up a mannequin With Your basic measures and look.  Clothing designersTo you clothing designers out there: we understand what you are struggling with.Support us and we will help bring YOUR brand out. We can remake one or more of your designs into what will be the new format and let people all over the world try on your products.  The most interesting clothes are not being provided by large brands, but by small innovative designers like you.

story:
I'm reaching out to raise funds for a start-up I've been dreaming about since a young age. Currently I am a business major in my third year of school and I truly have a vision to help change the world for the better. If you've seen my established twitter page "@pen_named" you understand my message. The people who follow me have the same vision and I'm counting on contributors to help make this dream a reality. I choose to stay anonymous so that people can view my messages through an unbiased lens. My goal is to make people think critically and to spread awareness of the need for peace and "new age" ideas. I'm trying to help the world transition into this positive shift in consciousness through my messages.  

If I reach my goal of $1500 I will use it towards the initial cost of material, website fees, and for expanding my platform of viewers. Eventually I want to turn it into a non-profit that mainly gives back to orphanages and shelters in my area. Growing up in shelters and foster homes myself has deeply inspired me to help those that are going through some familiar battles.

I'm very driven to succeed and I have a history of success when it comes to marketing and completing projects. If you share my vision, I ask that you please contribute what you can. There are multiple incentives if you choose  to do so. It's a secure website so it's safe to donate. Most of my followers are younger so I don't expect huge donations, but a few dollars here and there really add up. Anything truly helps.

Be a part of something bigger.
-"pen_named"

story:
Thanks so much for checking out Serengetee and our 50-50-50 campaign. It means everything to us to have so many amazing fans and supporters behind us.

We started Serengetee out of our dorm room last year with just a few hundred dollars and a bold dream to connect the world through fabric. So far, we've been able to source fabrics from 25 different countries while supporting 25 partner causes around the globe. 

However today, with your help, we can double our reach and double our impact, while putting together the most diverse fabric collection in the world. We can't wait to see how far your support can take us and how many lives your donations can change for the better.

Wear the World. Change the World. 

- Jeff, Ryan, Nate


What is Serengetee?

Serengetee is a social, global apparel company that sources fabric from talented artisans all over the world. Each pattern is paired up with a cause located in the same region of purchase. Wear the World, Change the World.

How do I customize my Serengetee – choose my fabric, shirt size, and shirt color?

About a week after you order your prize, we will email you a form where you will select your fabric, shirt size, and shirt color. Your prize will then be made-to-order and shipped out to you before the holidays!

When will prizes ship?

We are going to make sure everyone gets their prizes before the holidays, so all orders will be shipped by December 16th.

What size should I get?

Please refer to our sizing guide here. Keep in mind that our T-shirts are unisex and 100% cotton. 

How do I choose my sizes, styles, and fabrics?

About a week after you order we will send you a link to a page with a form to fill out where you will choose your size, style, and fabric choices.

When will my prizes be shipped?

We will ship everything out no later than December 16th to ensure you get your prizes before the holidays.

What size should I order?

Please refer to our sizing guide here. Keep in mind that our T-shirts are unisex and 100% cotton.

Is everything really Made-to-Order?

Yes! Once we receive your form, your prize will be assembled in our workshop in California.

Do you take returns?

All of our products are made-to-order just for you, so unless there is something wrong with your order we cannot accept returns.

Will Ryan really get the Elephant Tattoo?

Ryan has been known to never back down from a promise, let's hit $100,000 and see this happen.
